analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / dad pa'i rtsa ba can gyi yon tan rgya chen po mtha' yas pa zhig der gsungs te //
translated: And so on. There, the root of faith is said to have limitless, vast qualities.

original: de rdzogs nas yang mdor bsdus te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rdzogs nas yang mdor bsdus te gsungs pa /
translated: After that was completed, it was taught again in brief:

original: 'di 'dra chos ni gang dag dad gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di 'dra chos ni gang dag dad gyur pa //
translated: Such a Dharma is rare

original: sems can so so skye bo'i tshogs na dkon //
analyzed: sems can so so skye bo'i tshogs na dkon //
translated: Among the masses of ordinary beings.

original: gang dag dge bsags bsod nams byas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang dag dge bsags bsod nams byas gyur pa //
translated: Those who have accumulated virtue and made merit🔽Will have faith in this through the power of their cause.

original: de dag rgyu yi stobs kyis 'di la dang // gang g'a zhing bcu'i rdul snyed sems can la //
analyzed: de dag rgyu yi stobs kyis 'di la dang // gang g'a zhing bcu'i rdul snyed sems can la //
translated: Even if one were to serve sentient beings

original: bde ba kun gyis bskal par bsnyen bkur yang //🔽chos 'dir dad pa'i bsod nams ci 'dra ba //🔽bsod nams khyad @5a * //
analyzed: bde ba kun gyis bskal par bsnyen bkur yang // chos 'dir dad pa'i bsod nams ci 'dra ba // bsod nams khyad @5a * //
translated: As numerous as the Ganges’ sand grains with all forms of happiness🔽For eons equal to the number of atoms in ten buddhafields,🔽The merit would not compare to that of faith in this Dharma.

original: par de 'dra de la med //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: par de 'dra de la med // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Such is the distinctive merit.

original: de skad du chos bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /🔽gang gis 'dren pa nges 'byung ba //
analyzed: de skad du chos bcu pa'i mdo las kyang / gang gis 'dren pa nges 'byung ba //
translated: It says in the Sūtra on the Ten Qualities:🔽Faith in the vehicle of the Victorious Ones

original: dad pa theg pa mchog yin te //
analyzed: dad pa theg pa mchog yin te //
translated: Is the source of renunciation.

original: de'i phyir blo dang ldan pa'i mis //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo dang ldan pa'i mis //
translated: Therefore, the wise should rely

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba bsten //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba bsten //
translated: On those who follow faith.

original: ma dad pa yi mi dag la //
analyzed: ma dad pa yi mi dag la //
translated: In those who lack faith

original: dkar po'i chos rnams mi skye ste //🔽sa bon me yis tshig pa las //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos rnams mi skye ste // sa bon me yis tshig pa las //
translated: Virtuous qualities do not arise,🔽Just as sprouts do not grow

original: myu gu sngon po ji bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: myu gu sngon po ji bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: From seeds destroyed by fire.

original: de bas ni 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas ni 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Extensive Sport Sūtra also teaches:

original: kun dga' bo dad pa la sbyor bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dad pa la sbyor bar bya ste /
translated: Ānanda, one should apply oneself to faith.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This is the request to the Tathāgata.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: And it is said:

original: seng ges zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /🔽dad pas mi khom spang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: seng ges zhus pa'i mdo las kyang / dad pas mi khom spang bar 'gyur //
translated: The Sūtra of Questions of Siṃha

original: zhes bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: says, “Through faith, one abandons the unfavorable.”

original: de ltar dad pa'i rtsa ba brtan par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar dad pa'i rtsa ba brtan par byas la /
translated: Thus, having stabilized the root of faith,

original: bsod nams thams cad sdud pa'i phyir na byang chub kyi sems brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad sdud pa'i phyir na byang chub kyi sems brtan par bya'o //
translated: in order to gather all merit, one should stabilize the mind of awakening.

original: ji skad du seng ges zhus pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du seng ges zhus pa las /
translated: As the Sūtra of Questions of Siṃha says:

original: bcom ldan 'das la rgyal bu seng ges zhus pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rgyal bu seng ges zhus pa /
translated: The prince Siṃha asked the Bhagavat:

original: chos rnams thams cad bsdu ba ni //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad bsdu ba ni //
translated: “How does one gather all dharmas?

original: chos gang gis ni thob par 'gyur //🔽gang dang gang du skyes pa der //
analyzed: chos gang gis ni thob par 'gyur // gang dang gang du skyes pa der //
translated: By what dharma does one attain🔽the joy of sentient beings

original: sems can rnams ni dga' ba 'thob //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni dga' ba 'thob //
translated: in whatever place they are born?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said:

original: sems can thams cad thar bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can thams cad thar bya'i phyir //
translated: “For the sake of liberating all sentient beings,

original: byang chub don du sems btud pa //
analyzed: byang chub don du sems btud pa //
translated: The mind that bows to the enlightenment of the buddhas

original: des ni chos rnams bsdu ba 'thob //
analyzed: des ni chos rnams bsdu ba 'thob //
translated: is the one that gathers the Dharma.🔽The mind that bows to the enlightenment of the buddhas

original: des ni dga' ba thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni dga' ba thob par 'gyur //
translated: is the one that attains joy.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //🔽de skad du /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no // de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Array of Stalks Sūtra,

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, the thought of awakening is like a seed for all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a field, because it makes the wholesome qualities of all beings grow.

original: 'jig rten thams cad rten pas sa lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad rten pas sa lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is like the earth, because it supports the whole world.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su srung bas pha lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du sbyar te dbul ba thams cad yang dag par gcod pas rnam thos kyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su srung bas pha lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du sbyar te dbul ba thams cad yang dag par gcod pas rnam thos kyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a father, because it protects all bodhisattvas.

original: don thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: don thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, because it accomplishes all aims.🔽It is like a cloud, because it rains down the Dharma everywhere.

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a good vase, since it fulfills all wishes.

original: nyon mongs / @5b pa'i dgra pham par bya ba la mdung thung lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs / @5b pa'i dgra pham par bya ba la mdung thung lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a spear, since it conquers the enemy, the afflictions.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'gebs pas go cha lta bu'o //🔽nyon mongs pa'i mgo lhung bar byed pas ral gri lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'gebs pas go cha lta bu'o // nyon mongs pa'i mgo lhung bar byed pas ral gri lta bu'o //
translated: It is like armor, since it covers the misapprehensions.🔽It is like a sword, since it cuts off the head of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i shing gcod pas sta re lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i shing gcod pas sta re lta bu'o //
translated: It is like an axe, since it cuts down the tree of the afflictions.

original: 'tshe ba thams cad las skyob pas mtshon cha lta bu'o ;
analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad las skyob pas mtshon cha lta bu'o ;
translated: It is like a weapon, since it protects from all violence.

original: /'khor ba'i chu'i nang na gnas pa steng du 'byin pas mchil pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: /'khor ba'i chu'i nang na gnas pa steng du 'byin pas mchil pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a boat, since it rescues from the waters of cyclic existence.

original: sgrib pa dang khebs pa'i rtsa ba thams cad rnam par 'thor bas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang khebs pa'i rtsa ba thams cad rnam par 'thor bas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a wind-wheel, since it scatters all the roots of obscurations and coverings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir mdor bstan pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir mdor bstan pa lta bu'o//
translated: It is like a summary, since it includes all the bodhisattva practices and aspirations.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten la mchod rten lta bu ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten la mchod rten lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a shrine for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni yon tan de dag dang / yon tan gyi bye brag tshad med pa gzhan dang yang ldan no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni yon tan de dag dang / yon tan gyi bye brag tshad med pa gzhan dang yang ldan no zhes brjod do //
translated: Son of noble family, the thought of awakening is endowed with these qualities and with other immeasurable specific qualities as well.

original: so so'i skye bo la yang byang chub kyi sems skye ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la yang byang chub kyi sems skye ste /
translated: The thought of awakening can arise in ordinary beings.

original: 'di tshig tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di tshig tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that this is not just words?

original: mdo sde du ma mthong ba las te /
analyzed: mdo sde du ma mthong ba las te /
translated: Because it is seen in many sūtras.

original: re zhig 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las /
analyzed: re zhig 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las /
translated: In the noble Sūtra of the Teaching of Vimalakīrti,🔽it says that the thought of awakening can arise even from the view of the transitory collection, and that from it the qualities of a buddha can develop.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ri rab dang mnyam pa dran nas byang chub kyi sems skye zhing de las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam par skye'o zhes ji skad du bstan pa dang / dkon mchog za ma tog gi mdo las kyang //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ri rab dang mnyam pa dran nas byang chub kyi sems skye zhing de las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam par skye'o zhes ji skad du bstan pa dang / dkon mchog za ma tog gi mdo las kyang //
translated: And in the Sūtra of the Jewel Chest,

original: so so'i skye bo la yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: it says that even ordinary beings can be called bodhisattvas.

original: ji skad du 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na ka la bing ka'i phru gu sgo nga'i sbubs kyi nang na 'dug pa sgo nga ma brtol zhing sbubs nas ma byung yang ka la bing ka'i sgra nyid du 'byin to //
analyzed: ji skad du 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na ka la bing ka'i phru gu sgo nga'i sbubs kyi nang na 'dug pa sgo nga ma brtol zhing sbubs nas ma byung yang ka la bing ka'i sgra nyid du 'byin to //
translated: As it is said, Mañjuśrī, it is like this: for example, a young kalaviṅka bird, inside the shell of its egg, has not broken out of the egg, has not come out of the shell, but it already makes the sound of a kalaviṅka.

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs kyi nang na 'dug pa bdag tu lta ba ma brtol zhing khams gsum las ma byung yang sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs kyi nang na 'dug pa bdag tu lta ba ma brtol zhing khams gsum las ma byung yang sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, a bodhisattva, inside the shell of the egg of ignorance, has not broken out of the view of self, has not come out of the three realms, but he already makes the sound of a buddha, namely,

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i sgra 'byin to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i sgra 'byin to zhes gsungs so //
translated: the sound of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa las kyang /
translated: And the Teaching on the Non-Origination of All Things says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros la sas par mthongs phye nas de 'chi ba'i dus byas pa dang sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros la sas par mthongs phye nas de 'chi ba'i dus byas pa dang sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva Jayamati was in a cave. When the sky opened up, he died and fell into a great hell.

original: de ni stong pa nyid la ma dad cing stong pa nyid @6a * //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid la ma dad cing stong pa nyid @6a * //
translated: They are not faithful to emptiness.🔽

original: du smra ba la khong khro ba byas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: du smra ba la khong khro ba byas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is because they have no faith in emptiness and are hostile to those who teach emptiness.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo las kyang //
translated: The Sūtra on Entering Lanka also says,

original: phyugs kyi shing rta lta bus 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyugs kyi shing rta lta bus 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a bodhisattva who goes like a bullock-cart?”

original: 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing lnga'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'da' bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing lnga'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'da' bar 'dod nas /
translated: It is like this. For example, suppose someone wanted to cross as many worlds as there are atoms in five buddhafields.

original: des phyugs kyi shing rta la zhon te lam du zhugs nas /
analyzed: des phyugs kyi shing rta la zhon te lam du zhugs nas /
translated: They would get into a bullock-cart and set out on the road.

original: de yun ring pos lam ring por dpag tshad brgyar phyin pa las /
analyzed: de yun ring pos lam ring por dpag tshad brgyar phyin pa las /
translated: After a long time, they would travel a long distance of a hundred yojanas.

original: de der rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen pos bzlog nas dpag tshad khrir de da de phyir phul na skyes bu des phyugs kyi shing rtas 'jig rten gyi khams de dag 'da' ba'am bskal pa las brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par yang 'jig rten
analyzed: de der rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen pos bzlog nas dpag tshad khrir de da de phyir phul na skyes bu des phyugs kyi shing rtas 'jig rten gyi khams de dag 'da' ba'am bskal pa las brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par yang 'jig rten
translated: If that person were to pass through those world systems with a cow-drawn cart, or if they were to pass through even one world system for inexpressibly inexpressible eons,

original: gyi khams gcig kyang 'da' bar nus sam gsol ba /
analyzed: gyi khams gcig kyang 'da' bar nus sam gsol ba /
translated: would they be able to pass through it?”🔽“

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: Bhagavān, they would not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: de bzhin du gang la la zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed la theg pa chen po mi 'dzin mi klog par /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la la zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed la theg pa chen po mi 'dzin mi klog par /
translated: “In the same way, if someone generates the mind of awakening but does not hold or read the Mahāyāna,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba rnams la brten cing de dag dang lhan cig tu sten par byed nyan thos kyi theg pa klog cing kha ton byed dpyod cing khong du chud par byed la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba rnams la brten cing de dag dang lhan cig tu sten par byed nyan thos kyi theg pa klog cing kha ton byed dpyod cing khong du chud par byed la /
translated: but relies on those of the Śrāvakayāna and associates with them, reads the Śrāvakayāna, recites it, analyzes it, and comprehends it,

original: gzhan dag kyang klog tu 'jug pa nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang klog tu 'jug pa nas /
translated: and makes others read it,

original: khong du chud par byed pa'i bar du byed pa ni /
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pa'i bar du byed pa ni /
translated: The one who is engaged in the process of understanding

original: de ni des shes rab rtul por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni des shes rab rtul por 'gyur te /
translated: has dull wisdom through that,

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi lam nas slar drangs nas phyir ldog go //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi lam nas slar drangs nas phyir ldog go //
translated: and is drawn back from the path of unsurpassed pristine wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi mig gang yin pa de yang rtul por 'gyur zhing nyams par byed de 'di ni phyugs kyi shing rta lta bus 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi mig gang yin pa de yang rtul por 'gyur zhing nyams par byed de 'di ni phyugs kyi shing rta lta bus 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The faculty of wisdom and the eye of wisdom that arise from the cultivation of the thought of awakening of this bodhisattva become dull and are destroyed. This is the bodhisattva who goes by the vehicle of cattle.

original: de bas na de ltar de dag gi stong pa nyid la mos pa dang theg pa chen po la mngon par dga' ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar de dag gi stong pa nyid la mos pa dang theg pa chen po la mngon par dga' ba ni /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the one who is devoted to emptiness and delights in the Great Vehicle

original: mos pas spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa la yang sbyar bar snang na /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa la yang sbyar bar snang na /
translated: is seen to be engaged in the practice of devotion even when it is incomplete.

original: mos pa rab la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la lta ci zhig smos /
analyzed: mos pa rab la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la lta ci zhig smos /
translated: What need is there to mention the bodhisattva who practices with supreme devotion?

original: de ni dkon mchog sprin las byis pa'i spyod pa dang log par 'jug pa thams cad las 'das /🔽@6b par brjod cing /🔽ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang rnam par thar pa dang mngon par shes pa dang rig pa grangs med pas rnam par rol pa /
analyzed: de ni dkon mchog sprin las byis pa'i spyod pa dang log par 'jug pa thams cad las 'das / @6b par brjod cing / ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang rnam par thar pa dang mngon par shes pa dang rig pa grangs med pas rnam par rol pa /
translated: It is said in the Cloud of Jewels Satra that he has transcended all the activities and errors of a child.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of certain entry, to have attained the illumination of the stage of joy, which is the illumination of the realization of the Dharma, and to have attained the illumination of the stage of expansion, which is the illumination of the increase of the roots of virtue.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of brilliance, which is the illumination of the fire of the wisdom of the Dharma that burns the fuel of the afflictions.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of blazing light, which is the illumination of the light of the Dharma that is like the light of the sun and moon.

original: chos mtha' yas pa la dga' zhing mos pas zang zing med pa phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par rnam par mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub pa'i dga' ba'i shugs kyis snang ba thob pa bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dpag tu med🔽par theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i bsgom pa sna tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa gzhan gyi don gyi nan tan tshar phyin pa /
analyzed: chos mtha' yas pa la dga' zhing mos pas zang zing med pa phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par rnam par mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub pa'i dga' ba'i shugs kyis snang ba thob pa bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dpag tu med par theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i bsgom pa sna tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa gzhan gyi don gyi nan tan tshar phyin pa /
translated: He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of difficult to conquer, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is difficult to conquer by those who have not accumulated the provisions.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa grub pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba brgya stong phun sum tshogs par brjod do //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa grub pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba brgya stong phun sum tshogs par brjod do //
translated: He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of presence, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is like a cloud that rains on the fields of the roots of virtue of all beings.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of far reaching, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is difficult to reach by those who have not accumulated the provisions.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of immovable, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is unshaken by the winds of all the reasons and counter-reasons of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of excellent wisdom, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is like a great cloud of Dharma that rains on the fields of the roots of virtue of all beings.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of cloud of Dharma, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is like a great cloud of Dharma that rains on the fields of the roots of virtue of all beings.🔽He is said to have attained the illumination of the stage of consecration, which is the illumination of the Dharma that is like a great cloud of Dharma that rains on the fields of the roots of virtue of all beings.

original: ci ste 'di drang ba'i don yin na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di drang ba'i don yin na /
translated: If this is an interpretable meaning text,

original: ci'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa gzhan sa 'di la mi 'dod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa gzhan sa 'di la mi 'dod /
translated: why not accept that the other generation of the Thought is on this stage?

original: 'dir 'dod pa tsam gyis drang ba'i don du byed pa'i bye brag gi rtags kyang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa tsam gyis drang ba'i don du byed pa'i bye brag gi rtags kyang mi rnyed do //
translated: And, by mere acceptance, one cannot find a reason for making it interpretable.

original: mos pas spyod pa chen po'i chos nyid du gsungs pa las kyang /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa chen po'i chos nyid du gsungs pa las kyang /
translated: And, from the statement that the Great Vehicle is the reality of the Great Vehicle,

original: mos pas spyod pa 'bring dang chung ngu'i rnam pa yang ci nas yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa 'bring dang chung ngu'i rnam pa yang ci nas yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: one should understand that the aspects of the Medium and Small Vehicles are also present.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: Again, the Tathagata-acintya-avataara-nirdeia-sutra says:

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das byang chub tu sems bskyed pa su'i lags /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das byang chub tu sems bskyed pa su'i lags /
translated: Bhagavat, whose is the generation of the Thought of enlightenment?

original: rgyal po chen po gang gis lhag pa'i bsam pa ma 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gang gis lhag pa'i bsam pa ma 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Great King, it is of one whose superior intention is not disturbed.

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das su'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ma 'khrugs bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das su'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ma 'khrugs bka' stsal pa /
translated: Bhagavat, whose superior intention is not disturbed?

original: rgyal po chen po gang gi snying rje chen po skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gang gi snying rje chen po skye ba'o //
translated: Great King, it is of one whose great compassion arises.

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das su'i snying rje chen po skye /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das su'i snying rje chen po skye /
translated: Bhagavat, whose great compassion arises?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The Lord said:

original: rgyal po chen po gang gi sems can thams cad la yongs su mi gtong ba'i sems skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gang gi sems can thams cad la yongs su mi gtong ba'i sems skye ba'o //
translated: “Great King, it is the arising of a mind that does not give up on any sentient being.”

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba lags /
translated: He asked, “Lord, how is it that one does not give up on any sentient being?”🔽The Lord said, “Great King, when one gives up one’s own happiness.”

original: bka' stsal pa rgyal po chen po nam bdag bde ba btang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa rgyal po chen po nam bdag bde ba btang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention behind this statement?

original: byang chub kyi sems tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnams snying rje la dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir 'di gsungs te /🔽dper na gang la rnal 'byor med pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba ma yin no zhes @7a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnams snying rje la dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir 'di gsungs te / dper na gang la rnal 'byor med pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba ma yin no zhes @7a * //
translated: It was taught in order to generate delight in compassion in those who are satisfied with just the thought of awakening.🔽For example, it is like the statement:

original: gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Those who do not have yoga are not renunciates in the teachings of the Tathāgata.”

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang byang chub kyi sems gzhan smad par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang byang chub kyi sems gzhan smad par rig par bya'i /
translated: Similarly, here too, one should understand that it is the thought of awakening that is being criticized,

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gzhan du mi skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gzhan du mi skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that the thought of awakening does not arise in other ways.

original: ji skad du chos bcu pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du chos bcu pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the Sutra of the Ten Qualities says:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rigs la gnas pa byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rigs la gnas pa byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na /
translated: Son of noble family, if a bodhisattva who is in the lineage has not given rise to the mind of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis bskul zhing skyo bar byas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis bskul zhing skyo bar byas /
translated: then a tathagata or a tathagata’s disciple will exhort and encourage him,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni byang chub kyi sems la mos pa'i rgyu dang po'o//
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni byang chub kyi sems la mos pa'i rgyu dang po'o//
translated: and he will be caused to take up the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment. This is the first cause for aspiring to the mind of awakening.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam byang chub kyi sems kyi bsngags pa brjod pa thos nas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam byang chub kyi sems kyi bsngags pa brjod pa thos nas /
translated: Having heard the praise of perfect awakening or the mind of awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: he gives rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment. This is the second cause.

original: sems can mgon med pa dang skyabs med pa dang dpung gnyen med pa rnams mthong nas snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mgon med pa dang skyabs med pa dang dpung gnyen med pa rnams mthong nas snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: Having seen helpless, unprotected, and defenseless sentient beings, they generate compassion and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. This is the third cause.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog yongs su rdzogs pa mthong nas dga' ba bskyed de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog yongs su rdzogs pa mthong nas dga' ba bskyed de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: Having seen the perfection of the Tathāgata’s supreme qualities, they generate joy and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. This is the fourth cause.”

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That mind of enlightenment is twofold:

original: byang chub tu smon pa'i sems dang byang chub tu chas pa'i sems so //
analyzed: byang chub tu smon pa'i sems dang byang chub tu chas pa'i sems so //
translated: the mind aspiring to enlightenment and the mind set out for enlightenment.

original: ji skad du sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the Gaṇḍavyūha Sūtra says,

original: rigs kyi bu sems can gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon pa de dag ni sems can gyi khams na dkon no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon pa de dag ni sems can gyi khams na dkon no //
translated: Son of noble family, those sentient beings who aspire to unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening are rare in the realm of sentient beings.

original: de bas kyang gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chas pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu dkon no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chas pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu dkon no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Even more rare are those sentient beings who set out for unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: de la byang chub tu smon pa'i sems ni ngas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sems smon pa las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub tu smon pa'i sems ni ngas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sems smon pa las skyes pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, the aspiration to awaken is the thought “I will become a buddha,” which arises from the aspiration.

original: 'phags pa dpa' bar 'gro ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpa' bar 'gro ba'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Sūtra of Heroic Striding says,

original: g-yo byas te byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi rgyur gsungs na dge ba sna 'ga' byas te sems bskyed pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs @7b so ;
analyzed: g-yo byas te byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi rgyur gsungs na dge ba sna 'ga' byas te sems bskyed pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs @7b so ;
translated: “Even if you arouse the thought of awakening with deceit, that is a cause of buddhahood. What need is there to mention doing so with some virtue?”

original: / ji skad du bskal pa bzang po'i mdo las /
analyzed: / ji skad du bskal pa bzang po'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra of the Fortunate Eon says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dbyangs byin zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa skar ma'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ba lang rdzir gyur pas ba gu la'i me tog phul nas dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dbyangs byin zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa skar ma'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ba lang rdzir gyur pas ba gu la'i me tog phul nas dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: The Tathagata called Gandhabhadra first generated the true m ind of enlightenm ent w hen he was a cowherd and offered a vagula flower to the Tathagata known as King of the Stars.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa klog gi sgron ma zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa grags pa thag par gyur pas ras kyi kha tshar phul te /🔽dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa klog gi sgron ma zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa grags pa thag par gyur pas ras kyi kha tshar phul te / dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Similarly, the Tathagata called D hiparid ipaloka first generated the m ind of enlightenm ent w hen he was a weaver and offered a piece of cloth to the Tathagata known as Glorious Renown.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa 'od mtha' yas zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa 'od 'phro can grong khyer gyi sprang por gyur pas rtsa'i sgron ma phul te dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa 'od mtha' yas zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa 'od 'phro can grong khyer gyi sprang por gyur pas rtsa'i sgron ma phul te dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Similarly, the Tathagata called Anantaprabha first generated the m ind of enlightenm ent w hen he was a beggar in a city and offered a lamp of grass to the Tathagata known as Radiant Light.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gnon brten zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thub dka' shing thun du gyur pas so shing phul te dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gnon brten zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thub dka' shing thun du gyur pas so shing phul te dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: The Tathagata called Vikrantadatta first gave rise to bodhichitta when, as a wood gatherer, he offered a tooth stick to the Tathagata known as Difficult to Subdue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jam dpal grags zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan rgyal mtshan sman pa'i rgyal por gyur pas skyu rur cig phul nas dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jam dpal grags zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan rgyal mtshan sman pa'i rgyal por gyur pas skyu rur cig phul nas dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: The Tathagata known as Manjusri Yasha first gave rise to bodhichitta when, as a doctor, he offered a myrobalan fruit to the Tathagata known as Banner of Virtue.

original: des kyang 'khor ba'i bde ba mtha' yas pa bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems spyod pa dang bral ba la yang brnyas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: des kyang 'khor ba'i bde ba mtha' yas pa bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems spyod pa dang bral ba la yang brnyas par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, even if you do not have the bodhisattva deeds, you should not disparage the thought of awakening, because it produces infinite happiness in cyclic existence.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las /
translated: As it says in the Liberation of Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na rdo rje rin po che ni chag kyang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na rdo rje rin po che ni chag kyang /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this. Even if a diamond is broken,

original: gser gyi rgyan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rdo rje rin po che'i ming yang mi 'dor la dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par zlog go //
analyzed: gser gyi rgyan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rdo rje rin po che'i ming yang mi 'dor la dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par zlog go //
translated: It outshines all the other ornaments of gold, and it does not lose the name “vajra gem,” and it removes all poverty.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che nan tan dang bral yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon cing byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang mi 'dor la
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che nan tan dang bral yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon cing byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang mi 'dor la
translated: Son of good family, in the same way, the vajra gem of the thought of awakening, even when it is not accompanied by practice, outshines all the golden ornaments of the qualities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and it does not lose the name “bodhisattva,” and

original: 'khor ba'i dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par zlog go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par zlog go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: it removes all the poverty of cyclic existence.”

original: 'di las kyang spyod pa dang mi ldan yang byang chub kyi sems ni phan par 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las kyang spyod pa dang mi ldan yang byang chub kyi sems ni phan par 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that the thought of awakening is helpful, even when it is not accompanied by practice.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las /🔽rgyal po chen po 'di ltar khyod ni @8a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las / rgyal po chen po 'di ltar khyod ni @8a * //
translated: For the Sūtra on the Advice to a King says,

original: bya ba mang byed pa mang ste /
analyzed: bya ba mang byed pa mang ste /
translated: “Great King, in this way you have many duties and many things to do.

original: nyin mtshan du thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang bslab pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bslab par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyin mtshan du thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang bslab pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bslab par mi nus te /
translated: I am not able to train in the perfection of generosity, and so on up to: I am not able to train in the perfection of wisdom, in any way, at any time, at any place, or at any length.

original: de bas na rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa dang dad pa dang don du gnyer ba dang smon pa /
analyzed: de bas na rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa dang dad pa dang don du gnyer ba dang smon pa /
translated: Therefore, great king, your aspiration, faith, pursuit, and prayer for perfect complete enlightenment

original: 'gro yang rung 'greng yang rung 'dug kyang rung nyal yang rung sad kyang rung za yang rung 'thung yang rung rtag par rgyun du dran par gyis la yid la zung ste sgoms shig / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang ; 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo thams cad dang bdag gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus shing gzhal te rtsis la rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su
analyzed: 'gro yang rung 'greng yang rung 'dug kyang rung nyal yang rung sad kyang rung za yang rung 'thung yang rung rtag par rgyun du dran par gyis la yid la zung ste sgoms shig / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang ; 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo thams cad dang bdag gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus shing gzhal te rtsis la rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su
translated: Gather together all your roots of virtue, past, future, and present, of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, noble disciples and pratyekabuddhas, and all ordinary beings, and having calculated and assessed them, rejoice in them.

original: yi rang ba'i mchog nas /
analyzed: yi rang ba'i mchog nas /
translated: Rejoicing in the supreme...

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mtshungs pa'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rang nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa bya bar phul cig / phul nas sems can thams cad dang thun
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mtshungs pa'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rang nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa bya bar phul cig / phul nas sems can thams cad dang thun
translated: Having made offerings, share them with all sentient beings.

original: mong du gyis shig / de nas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du thob par 'gyur ba dang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang🔽chub tu sngos shig /
analyzed: mong du gyis shig / de nas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du thob par 'gyur ba dang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngos shig /
translated: Then, three times a day, transfer the merit toward unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, so that all sentient beings will obtain omniscience and perfect all the qualities of a buddha.

original: rgyal po chen po khyod de ltar zhugs na rgyal srid kyang byed la rgyal po'i bya ba yang nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod de ltar zhugs na rgyal srid kyang byed la rgyal po'i bya ba yang nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Great King, if you practice in this way, you will rule the kingdom and not neglect your royal duties.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: And the accumulations for enlightenment will be completed.

original: mdo sde de nyid las de'i rnam par smin pa yang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mdo sde de nyid las de'i rnam par smin pa yang gsungs pa ni /
translated: The same sutra also explains the maturation of that:

original: rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
translated: Great King, the maturation of the karma of the roots of virtue of the mind of perfect complete enlightenment

original: lan du mar lha'i nang du skyes lan du mar mi'i nang du skyes te /
analyzed: lan du mar lha'i nang du skyes lan du mar mi'i nang du skyes te /
translated: is that you have been born many times among the gods and many times among humans.

original: lha dang mir skyes pa na thams cad du yang dbang po byed par gyur kyang /
analyzed: lha dang mir skyes pa na thams cad du yang dbang po byed par gyur kyang /
translated: When you were born as a god or human, you became a lord in all places.

original: da dung rgyal po chen po khyod kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @8b byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las la bri ba'am /
analyzed: da dung rgyal po chen po khyod kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @8b byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las la bri ba'am /
translated: Great King, still, the roots of virtue of the mind of perfect complete enlightenment have not diminished

original: gang bar mi mngon no //
analyzed: gang bar mi mngon no //
translated: or been filled up.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te 'on kyang rgyal po chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems gcig gis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te 'on kyang rgyal po chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems gcig gis kyang /
translated: Great King, even with just one mind of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment,

original: sems can thams cad bsgral bar dmigs pa dang / sems thams cad dgrol bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgral bar dmigs pa dang / sems thams cad dgrol bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is focused on liberating all sentient beings, on freeing all minds, on comforting all sentient beings, and on bringing all sentient beings to nirvana.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med dpag tu med pa sogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med dpag tu med pa sogs par 'gyur na /
translated: because it is the basis for the immeasurable, incalculable roots of virtue of all sentient beings, since it is the objective reference for the liberation of all sentient beings, for the release of all minds, for the consolation of all sentient beings, and for the complete nirvana of all sentient beings.

original: gang de ltar mang du byed pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang de ltar mang du byed pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: How much more so for one who acts in this way to a great extent!

original: byang chub kyi sems de yang gzugs kyi sku mthong ba las skyes par de las sngon gyi rtogs pa brjod pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yang gzugs kyi sku mthong ba las skyes par de las sngon gyi rtogs pa brjod pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, that thought of awakening is produced from seeing the body of form, as it is said in the Jataka Tales:

original: de ltan re zhig smon pa byang chub kyi sems su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltan re zhig smon pa byang chub kyi sems su rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood as the aspirational thought of awakening.

original: ca sar ma chud pa la yang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i dbang du bya ba yod dam med ces bya ba 'di brjod par bya'o zhe na yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ca sar ma chud pa la yang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i dbang du bya ba yod dam med ces bya ba 'di brjod par bya'o zhe na yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: But if one does not understand it, should it be said that it is or is not within the scope of the bodhisattva vow? It should be understood as being within that scope.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
translated: For the Akasagarbhasutra says:

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu las rtsa ba'i ltung bar gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu las rtsa ba'i ltung bar gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is said that the root downfall is caused by gain and honor.

original: sa bcu pa'i mdo las ni sa dang po la /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i mdo las ni sa dang po la /
translated: The Sūtra on the Ten Levels says that on the first level:

original: bdag gis sems can 'di dag la yo byad mang po thams cad nye bar sbyin no snyam pa ma gtogs par su las kyang bkur sti ci yang mi 'dod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di dag la yo byad mang po thams cad nye bar sbyin no snyam pa ma gtogs par su las kyang bkur sti ci yang mi 'dod do zhes bstan to //
translated: Except for the thought “I will give all the many things that sentient beings need,” I do not want anything at all from anyone.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis legs par gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la shin du gzhol ba yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis legs par gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la shin du gzhol ba yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: And it also says that bodhisattvas on the first level are unshakable and well established on the Joyous level, and that they are certain to be in the family of the tathāgatas and are fully dedicated to complete enlightenment.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Akṣayamatisūtra says:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa yang de la med na theg pa chen po lta ga la yod ces gsungs la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa yang de la med na theg pa chen po lta ga la yod ces gsungs la /
translated: If the Hearers’ Vehicle is not there, how could the Great Vehicle be there?

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And:

original: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus par /
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus par /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Dragging Out Thorns says:

original: ser snas yongs su dkris pa la yang bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa dang rab tu dga' ba'i sa la bdag tu 'du shes pa dang bral bas bdag la chags pa'ang med na /
analyzed: ser snas yongs su dkris pa la yang bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa dang rab tu dga' ba'i sa la bdag tu 'du shes pa dang bral bas bdag la chags pa'ang med na /
translated: Also, for one completely bound by miserliness, the basis of training is established. Since one is free from the notion of self on the ground of joy, one has no attachment to self.

original: yo byad thams cad la chags pa lta ga la yod ces gsungs so //
analyzed: yo byad thams cad la chags pa lta ga la yod ces gsungs so //
translated: How could there be attachment to all possessions?

original: de bzhin du @9a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du @9a * //
translated: Similarly,

original: mgo la sogs pa sbyin pa yang gsungs te /
analyzed: mgo la sogs pa sbyin pa yang gsungs te /
translated: giving one's head and so on is taught.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa mdo sde dag tu sar ma chud pa la bslab pa bcas par snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa mdo sde dag tu sar ma chud pa la bslab pa bcas par snang ngo //
translated: In such sutras, the training is prescribed for those not yet on the grounds.

original: gang du byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas phyir bstan pa der yang goms par byar mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: gang du byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas phyir bstan pa der yang goms par byar mi rung ba'am /
translated: Where it is taught for the sake of bodhisattvas, it is not suitable to practice it.

original: dgag pa'i ngag gis byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas bslab par mi bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i ngag gis byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas bslab par mi bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, by the words of negation, the beginner bodhisattva should not train.

original: de gnyis med na ni thams cad la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis med na ni thams cad la bslab par bya'o //
translated: If those two do not exist, then one should train in everything.

original: de la yang bslab pa gcig sgrub pa na bslab pa gzhan bsrung ma nus kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang bslab pa gcig sgrub pa na bslab pa gzhan bsrung ma nus kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even there, when accomplishing one training, if one is unable to guard the other trainings, there is no downfall.

original: de skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las ;
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las ;
translated: The Aksayamatinirdesa-sutra says:

original: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims la brtul ba btang snyoms la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims la brtul ba btang snyoms la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: At the time of generosity, one should be indifferent to the practice of discipline and so on.

original: 'di la lhod par yang mi bya ste /🔽lhag ma gzhan la mi sgrub pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la lhod par yang mi bya ste / lhag ma gzhan la mi sgrub pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: But one should not be lax in this.🔽It is not that one does not practice the other perfections, but that one practices them in accordance with one’s ability and as much as one can.

original: ci nus ci 'os su de bzhin nyid du sgrub po zhes sa bcu pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ci nus ci 'os su de bzhin nyid du sgrub po zhes sa bcu pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is stated in the Sutra of the Ten Levels.

original: / sdom pa 'di ni bud med nyon mongs pa chung ngu sems byang chub tu mos pa la'ang 'grub ste /
analyzed: / sdom pa 'di ni bud med nyon mongs pa chung ngu sems byang chub tu mos pa la'ang 'grub ste /
translated: This vow can also be taken by a woman who has few defilements and who is interested in enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las /
translated: For the Bodhisattvapratimoksha says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i bden par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i bden par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “O Shariputra, if a bodhisattva has four qualities, he is a truth-speaker.

original: sh'a / ri'i bu 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: sh'a / ri'i bu 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Śāriputra, here a son or daughter of good lineage, having generated the thought of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: dge ba'i chos yongs su btsal ba'i don du brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas pa dang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yongs su btsal ba'i don du brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas pa dang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: dwells having begun striving for the sake of seeking wholesome dharmas.

original: 'di las brtsams te lung nod pa thams cad dang / sdom pa bzung ba yang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas la goms pa lhur byed pa sdom pa dang ldan pa las bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las brtsams te lung nod pa thams cad dang / sdom pa bzung ba yang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas la goms pa lhur byed pa sdom pa dang ldan pa las bya ste /
translated: Beginning from here, all the recitations and the taking of vows should be done from one who is endowed with the vow, who is intent on being familiar with the points of training of the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar byas na de bslab pa las 'das na rab tu ngo mtshar bar 'gyur zhes bla ma la bslus par dogs pa'i 'jigs pa skye ba'am de la nan tan bya mi dgos par dga' ba dang gus pas grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na de bslab pa las 'das na rab tu ngo mtshar bar 'gyur zhes bla ma la bslus par dogs pa'i 'jigs pa skye ba'am de la nan tan bya mi dgos par dga' ba dang gus pas grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one acts in this way, then if one transgresses the training, one will feel great shame, and fear will arise, fearing that one will deceive the guru. Or, without needing to strive at that, one will accomplish it through joy and respect.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar bslab pa 'di'i nang nas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar bslab pa 'di'i nang nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas, in the presence of the Tathāgatas, from within this training,

original: bslab pa gang yang rung ba grub par 'dod pas yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: bslab pa gang yang rung ba grub par 'dod pas yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: One who wishes to accomplish any of the trainings should take up the vow.

original: de ltar @9b na 'di ni sdom pa'i spyi'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de ltar @9b na 'di ni sdom pa'i spyi'i chos yin no //
translated: This is the general procedure for taking the vow.

original: yang na de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen med na phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon du bsgoms nas /
analyzed: yang na de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen med na phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon du bsgoms nas /
translated: If you do not have a spiritual teacher of that sort, then visualize the buddhas and bodhisattvas who dwell in the ten directions.

original: sdom pa dang bdag gi stobs dang yang sbyar nas blang ste /
analyzed: sdom pa dang bdag gi stobs dang yang sbyar nas blang ste /
translated: Take the vow in their presence, in conjunction with the power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar ma yin na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten bslus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten bslus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, you deceive all the buddhas and bodhisattvas and the world with its gods.

original: gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mdo las /
translated: For the Sutra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma says,

original: chung zad cig bsams nas mi sbyin pa ni yi dags su skye la /
analyzed: chung zad cig bsams nas mi sbyin pa ni yi dags su skye la /
translated: “If you think about giving a little bit but then do not give it, you will be reborn as a hungry ghost.

original: dam bcas nas mi sbyin pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gro'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: dam bcas nas mi sbyin pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gro'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: If you promise to give but then do not give, you will be reborn in the hells.”

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bla na med pa'i don dam bcas nas sgrub par mi byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bla na med pa'i don dam bcas nas sgrub par mi byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much more so if one does not practice after having promised the unsurpassed aim of all beings.

original: de bas na chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Dharmasangiti-sutra says:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' bden pa lhur byed par 'gyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' bden pa lhur byed par 'gyur bar bya ste /
translated: Son of noble family, the bodhisattva should be intent on the truth.

original: rigs kyi bu bden pa yang dag par brjod pa ni chos yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu bden pa yang dag par brjod pa ni chos yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the expression of truth is the expression of Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu de la bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, what is truth?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sems de srog gi phyir yang mi gtong zhing /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sems de srog gi phyir yang mi gtong zhing /
translated: It is that the bodhisattva, having generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, does not abandon that mind even for the sake of his life,

original: sems can rnams la yang log par mi byed pa 'di de byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang log par mi byed pa 'di de byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa'o //
translated: and does not deceive sentient beings. This is the bodhisattva's truth.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la sems de phyis yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la sems de phyis yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: It is that the bodhisattva, having generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, later abandons that mind,

original: sems can rnams la'ang log par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i brdzun du smra ba tha ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la'ang log par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i brdzun du smra ba tha ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the worst kind of lying for a bodhisattva.

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Sāgaramati Sūtra says,

original: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste dper na rgyal po'am rgyal po'i blon pos chen pos grong khyer gyi skye bo thams cad sang zan sbyin no zhes mgron du bos nas yal bar dor te /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste dper na rgyal po'am rgyal po'i blon pos chen pos grong khyer gyi skye bo thams cad sang zan sbyin no zhes mgron du bos nas yal bar dor te /
translated: “Sāgaramati, for example, suppose a king or a king’s minister invites all the people of the city to a meal, and then neglects to provide any food,🔽and so deceives all those people.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba mi sbyar nas des skye ba'i tshogs de dag thams cad bslus pa yin te /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba mi sbyar nas des skye ba'i tshogs de dag thams cad bslus pa yin te /
translated: And they, not getting any food or drink, go away, mocking him.

original: de dag kyang bza' ba dang btung ba ma thob pas 'phya zhing slar 'dong ba de bzhin du blo gros rgya mtsho byang chub sems dpa' ma rgal ba bsgral ba dang / ma grol ba dgrol ba dang dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung ba dang yongs @10a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang bza' ba dang btung ba ma thob pas 'phya zhing slar 'dong ba de bzhin du blo gros rgya mtsho byang chub sems dpa' ma rgal ba bsgral ba dang / ma grol ba dgrol ba dang dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung ba dang yongs @10a * //
translated: In the same way, Sāgaramati, when a bodhisattva does not liberate those who are not liberated, does not release those who are not released, does not give relief to those who are not relieved, and does not bring to complete nirvāṇa those beings who have not made an end to suffering—

original: su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la dbugs phyung la /
analyzed: su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la dbugs phyung la /
translated: He does not comfort any sentient beings who are not yet free from suffering.

original: mang du thos pa dang de las gzhan pa dge ba byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yang brtson par mi byed na /
analyzed: mang du thos pa dang de las gzhan pa dge ba byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yang brtson par mi byed na /
translated: He does not strive for much learning and for the wholesome states of virtue that are the factors of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That bodhisattva does not act in accordance with his words.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la slu ba yin no //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la slu ba yin no //
translated: He deceives the world with its gods.

original: de lta bu sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba'i lha rnams kyis mthong na 'phya zhing gzhogs 'phyas byed la rnam par smod de /
analyzed: de lta bu sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba'i lha rnams kyis mthong na 'phya zhing gzhogs 'phyas byed la rnam par smod de /
translated: When the gods who have seen previous buddhas see him, they ridicule him, criticize him, and condemn him.

original: gang dag mchod sbyin bya bar dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa'i mchod sbyin gyi bdag po de dag ni dkon no //
analyzed: gang dag mchod sbyin bya bar dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa'i mchod sbyin gyi bdag po de dag ni dkon no //
translated: It is rare to find a master of a sacrifice who fails to complete the sacrifice that he has undertaken.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho de lta bas na tshig gang gis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten slu bar 'gyur ba'i tshig de lta bu byang chub sems dpas smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho de lta bas na tshig gang gis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten slu bar 'gyur ba'i tshig de lta bu byang chub sems dpas smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, Sāgaramati, a bodhisattva should not speak words that deceive the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho gzhan yang gang la la zhig gis /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho gzhan yang gang la la zhig gis /
translated: Moreover, Sāgaramati, if someone

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang la chos kyi don bya bar gsol ba btab pa de la byang chub sems dpa' kho bos khyod kyis chos kyi don 'di yongs su thob par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang la chos kyi don bya bar gsol ba btab pa de la byang chub sems dpa' kho bos khyod kyis chos kyi don 'di yongs su thob par bya'o //
translated: asks a bodhisattva to do something for the sake of the Dharma, the bodhisattva should say, ‘I will help you to attain this Dharma goal.🔽’

original: zhes tshig smras par gyur na /
analyzed: zhes tshig smras par gyur na /
translated: But if the bodhisattva does not do it,

original: byang chub sems dpas de la lus ni yongs su gtang bar bya'i sems can slu bar ni mi bya'o zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de la lus ni yongs su gtang bar bya'i sems can slu bar ni mi bya'o zhes gsungs so ;
translated: the bodhisattva should give up his or her body, but should not deceive sentient beings.”

original: / de bas na rang gi mthu dang sbyar te dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tsam yang yang dag par blangs la bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: / de bas na rang gi mthu dang sbyar te dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tsam yang yang dag par blangs la bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in accordance with your abilities, you should undertake and keep even just one root of virtue.

original: 'phags pa sa'i snying po'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa'i snying po'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the noble Kṣitigarbha Sūtra says,

original: dge ba'i lam bcu po 'di dag gis sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi gang gis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tha na dge ba'i las kyi lam gcig tsam yang mi srung la /
analyzed: dge ba'i lam bcu po 'di dag gis sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi gang gis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tha na dge ba'i las kyi lam gcig tsam yang mi srung la /
translated: But if someone does not guard even one virtuous path for as long as he lives,

original: 'on kyang tshig 'di skad du nga ni theg pa chen po pa ste nga bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tshol lo zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig 'di skad du nga ni theg pa chen po pa ste nga bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tshol lo zhes zer na /
translated: and yet says, “I am a Mahayanist. I seek unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,”

original: gang zag de ni shin tu tshul 'chos pa brdzun chen po smra ba /
analyzed: gang zag de ni shin tu tshul 'chos pa brdzun chen po smra ba /
translated: that person is a great hypocrite, a liar,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi spyan sngar 'jig rten la slu bar byad pa chad par smra ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi spyan sngar 'jig rten la slu bar byad pa chad par smra ba ste /
translated: a nihilist who deceives the world in the presence of all the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: de rmongs bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed cing log par ltung bar 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de rmongs bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed cing log par ltung bar 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: That person, while deluded, will die and go to a bad rebirth.

original: dus ji srid du nus pa de srid du yang dge ba yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: dus ji srid du nus pa de srid du yang dge ba yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ste /
translated: For as long as one is able, one should take up and maintain virtue.

original: 'di ni sman gyi bla bee d'urya 'od kyi rgyal po'i mdo las blta @10b bar bya'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni sman gyi bla bee d'urya 'od kyi rgyal po'i mdo las blta @10b bar bya'o ;
translated: This should be understood from the Sūtra of the King of the Quintessential Instructions of the Lapis Lazuli Light Medicine.

original: / sems can chen po gang de lta bu thos nas kyang /
analyzed: / sems can chen po gang de lta bu thos nas kyang /
translated: The great being who, having heard such [teachings],

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dka' ba shes rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dka' ba shes rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
translated: understands the bodhisattva conduct to be difficult and realizes it through wisdom,

original: skye bo ma lus pa sdug bsngal las bskyab par khur khyer bar spro ba des ni phyag bya ba dang mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas la bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang /
analyzed: skye bo ma lus pa sdug bsngal las bskyab par khur khyer bar spro ba des ni phyag bya ba dang mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas la bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang /
translated: and who is enthusiastic about taking on the responsibility of protecting all beings from suffering, should make prostrations and offerings, confess misdeeds, rejoice in merit, request the buddhas to teach, supplicate them,

original: byang chub tu bsngo ba byas la /
analyzed: byang chub tu bsngo ba byas la /
translated: and dedicate [merit] to awakening.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gsol ba gdab ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gsol ba gdab ste /
translated: Then, supplicate the spiritual friend.

original: de'i tshig gi rjes su brjod pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i tshig gi rjes su brjod pa 'am /
translated: Recite his words

original: yang na bdag nyid kyis brjod pas /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyis brjod pas /
translated: or else recite them yourself:

original: slob dpon dgongs su gsol bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes smos la /
analyzed: slob dpon dgongs su gsol bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes smos la /
translated: “Master, please consider me. I, [name],” and so on.

original: ji ltar 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it says in the Sutra of the Array of Qualities of Manjushri’s Buddhafield:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis sngon gyi tshe'i rtogs pa brjod pa las spyod pa dang ldan par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de bzhin du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis sngon gyi tshe'i rtogs pa brjod pa las spyod pa dang ldan par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de bzhin du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Blessed One, just as the noble Manjushri generated the awakening mind in the past, as described in the Jataka Tales, so too should you generate the awakening mind.🔽”

original: des 'di skad ces //
analyzed: des 'di skad ces //
translated: He should say:

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa yis //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa yis //
translated: Since samsara is beginningless,🔽so too is its end.

original: sngon gyi tha ma ji srid pa //🔽de srid sems can phan don du //
analyzed: sngon gyi tha ma ji srid pa // de srid sems can phan don du //
translated: For as long as it lasts,

original: spyod pa dpag yas spyad par bgyi //
analyzed: spyod pa dpag yas spyad par bgyi //
translated: I will engage in infinite bodhisattva conduct for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga 'dir //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga 'dir //
translated: In the presence of the Lord of the World,

original: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de //
analyzed: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de //
translated: I generate the supreme awakening mind.

original: 'gro ba thams cad mgron gnyer nas //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad mgron gnyer nas //
translated: I invite all beings as my guests

original: de dag dbul zhing phongs las dgrol //
analyzed: de dag dbul zhing phongs las dgrol //
translated: and will free them from poverty and want.

original: de ring phan chad gal te yang //
analyzed: de ring phan chad gal te yang //
translated: From this day forward,

original: bdag gis 'dod chags sems bskyed nas //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dod chags sems bskyed nas //
translated: if I generate a thought of desire,🔽I will have deceived all the buddhas

original: phyogs bcu dag na gang bzhugs pa'i //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad bslus par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na gang bzhugs pa'i //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad bslus par 'gyur //
translated: who dwell in the ten directions.

original: byang chub nam zhig thob par du//
analyzed: byang chub nam zhig thob par du//
translated: Until I attain enlightenment,🔽I will not give rise to a mind of anger,🔽A mind of malice,

original: tha ba'i sems dang gnod sems dang // phrag dog dang ni ser sna yang //🔽de ring phan chad mi bya'o //
analyzed: tha ba'i sems dang gnod sems dang // phrag dog dang ni ser sna yang // de ring phan chad mi bya'o //
translated: Jealousy, or miserliness.

original: tshangs pa'i spyod pa bdag gis spyad //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i spyod pa bdag gis spyad //
translated: From this day forth, I will practice pure conduct

original: sdig pa'i 'dod pa yongs su gtang //🔽tshul khrims sdom dang des pa la //
analyzed: sdig pa'i 'dod pa yongs su gtang // tshul khrims sdom dang des pa la //
translated: And abandon sinful desires.🔽I will train in the Buddha's discipline

original: sangs rgyas rjes su bslab par bya //🔽bdag 'dir byang chub rings tshul du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su bslab par bya // bdag 'dir byang chub rings tshul du //
translated: Of ethical conduct, vows, and gentleness.🔽Here, I have no interest in quickly

original: 'tshang rgyar mos shing spro ba med //
analyzed: 'tshang rgyar mos shing spro ba med //
translated: Attaining enlightenment.

original: phyi mthar thug gi bar du yang //
analyzed: phyi mthar thug gi bar du yang //
translated: Until the end of time,

original: sems can gcig phyir spyad par bgyi //
analyzed: sems can gcig phyir spyad par bgyi //
translated: I will practice for the sake of a single sentient being.🔽I will purify the buddha realms

original: tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i //🔽sangs rgyas zhing ni sbyang bar bgyi //
analyzed: tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i // sangs rgyas zhing ni sbyang bar bgyi //
translated: That are inconceivable and immeasurable.

original: phyogs rnams bcu po thams cad du //
analyzed: phyogs rnams bcu po thams cad du //
translated: In all ten directions,

original: bdag gi ming ni @11a * //
analyzed: bdag gi ming ni @11a * //
translated: My name will be renowned.

original: grags par bgyi //
analyzed: grags par bgyi //
translated: I will purify all

original: lus dang ngag gi las rnams kyang //🔽rnam pa kun du bdag gis sbyang //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las rnams kyang // rnam pa kun du bdag gis sbyang //
translated: My physical and verbal actions.

original: yid kyi las kyang sbyang bar bgyi //
analyzed: yid kyi las kyang sbyang bar bgyi //
translated: I will also purify my mental actions.

original: mi dge'i las ni spyad mi bgyi //
analyzed: mi dge'i las ni spyad mi bgyi //
translated: Do not engage in nonvirtuous actions.🔽

original: zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhes brjod do //
translated: One should not perform nonvirtuous actions.

original: 'di la dus thams cad du sdom pa bzung ba las tshe rabs gzhan du ltung ba 'byung ba'i dogs par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la dus thams cad du sdom pa bzung ba las tshe rabs gzhan du ltung ba 'byung ba'i dogs par yang mi bya ste /
translated: Here, one should not fear that a downfall will occur in another life, because of taking the vow at all times.

original: mdo 'di nyid las mi 'khrugs pa'i smon lam snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las mi 'khrugs pa'i smon lam snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the prayer of Akṣayamati appears in this very sūtra.

original: de las 'di skad du /
analyzed: de las 'di skad du /
translated: It says this:

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa de sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na tshig 'di skad du /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa de sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na tshig 'di skad du /
translated: “Just as the Tathāgata Akṣobhya, when he was previously a bodhisattva, said these words:

original: gal te bdag tshe rabs thams cad du rab tu ma byung na bdag gis sangs rgyas thams cad bslus par 'gyur ro zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gal te bdag tshe rabs thams cad du rab tu ma byung na bdag gis sangs rgyas thams cad bslus par 'gyur ro zhes brjod de /
translated: ‘If I do not go forth in all my lives, then I will have deceived all the buddhas.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' mi 'khrugs pa'i rjes su bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' mi 'khrugs pa'i rjes su bslab par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, one should train in accordance with the bodhisattva Akṣobhya.
