original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar bslabs na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe rabs thams cad du rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar bslabs na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe rabs thams cad du rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: Śāriputra, if one trains in that way, then the bodhisattva mahāsattva will go forth in all his lives.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether or not the Tathagatas appear,

original: gdon mi za bar khyim gyi gnas nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar khyim gyi gnas nas 'byung ngo //
translated: there is no doubt that one must leave the household life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnyed pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnyed pa'i mchog go //
translated: Śāriputra, it is like this: leaving the household life is the best gain for bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: chung ma dang bu dang bu mo la de chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chung ma dang bu dang bu mo la de chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: One does not become attached to wife, son, or daughter.

original: ji ltar tshe rabs gzhan du nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur ba de ltar ni 'di nyid du 'chad par 'gyur bas des na re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: ji ltar tshe rabs gzhan du nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur ba de ltar ni 'di nyid du 'chad par 'gyur bas des na re zhig gzhag go //
translated: How this does not become a fault in other lives will be explained right here. Therefore, for now, it is set aside.

original: de ltar sdom pa yang dag par bzung ba la ltung ba'i mtshan nyid gang gis brjod pa'i dngos po bdag nyid kyis brtags te spong ba dang / ltung ba'i gzugs brnyan dang ltung ba ma yin pa'i gzugs brnyan la rmongs par mi 'gyur bar ltung ba spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa yang dag par bzung ba la ltung ba'i mtshan nyid gang gis brjod pa'i dngos po bdag nyid kyis brtags te spong ba dang / ltung ba'i gzugs brnyan dang ltung ba ma yin pa'i gzugs brnyan la rmongs par mi 'gyur bar ltung ba spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod do //
translated: Thus, the general characteristics of the downfalls are stated so that the bodhisattva who has taken the vow may recognize the things that are downfalls and avoid them, and so that he or she will not be confused about what is a semblance of a downfall or what is not a semblance of a downfall.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba thams cad zhi bar bya ba dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba thams cad zhi bar bya ba dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva should avoid all downfalls in order to pacify all the present and future suffering and unhappiness of all sentient beings and in order to generate all their present and future happiness and joy.

original: g-yo med par lus dang ngag dang yid brtson pas nan tan mi byed pa dang / de'i rkyen tshogs pa mi tshol ba dang / de'i bar du gcod pa'i gnyen po la mi 'bad pa dang / sdug @11b bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba chung dus sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chen po'i gnyen por 'gyur ba mi skyed pa dang /
analyzed: g-yo med par lus dang ngag dang yid brtson pas nan tan mi byed pa dang / de'i rkyen tshogs pa mi tshol ba dang / de'i bar du gcod pa'i gnyen po la mi 'bad pa dang / sdug @11b bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba chung dus sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chen po'i gnyen por 'gyur ba mi skyed pa dang /
translated: One incurs a downfall if one does not apply oneself with a sincere effort of body, speech, and mind, if one does not seek the conditions for that, if one does not strive in the antidotes to the obstructions to that, if one does not generate a small suffering and unhappiness as an antidote to a great suffering and unhappiness,

original: don chen po sgrub pa'i phyir don chung ngu nyams par mi byed pas /
analyzed: don chen po sgrub pa'i phyir don chung ngu nyams par mi byed pas /
translated: and if one does not diminish a small goal in order to accomplish a great goal.

original: skad cig gcig tsam yang yal bar bor na ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig tsam yang yal bar bor na ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: One incurs a downfall if one neglects even for a moment.

original: mdor na rang gi nus pa'i yul ma yin pa'i bya ba rnams la ltung ba med de /
analyzed: mdor na rang gi nus pa'i yul ma yin pa'i bya ba rnams la ltung ba med de /
translated: In brief, there is no downfall for actions that are not within the domain of one’s ability.

original: don dam pa nyid kyis de la bslab pa bcas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid kyis de la bslab pa bcas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no precept to train in that.

original: gzhan la ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid du gzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid du gzung ba kho na'o //
translated: But for others, it is to be understood that there is natural evil.

original: rang gi nus pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa gang zhig la brtson par byed na ltung bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rang gi nus pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa gang zhig la brtson par byed na ltung bar 'gyur te ;
translated: If one strives for something that is not within one's power, one falls.

original: de ni bsam mi dgos par spyir sdig pa bshags pa'i nang du 'dus pas de las grol bar 'gyur ro //🔽de dag ni mdor na /
analyzed: de ni bsam mi dgos par spyir sdig pa bshags pa'i nang du 'dus pas de las grol bar 'gyur ro // de dag ni mdor na /
translated: This is not to be considered, since it is generally included in the confession of evil.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i khog pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i khog pa yin te /
translated: In brief, these are the main points of the bodhisattva training.

original: rgyas par ni bskal pa dpag tu med pa mtha' yas par bshad du yod do //
analyzed: rgyas par ni bskal pa dpag tu med pa mtha' yas par bshad du yod do //
translated: If explained extensively, they would be explained as limitless for infinite eons.

original: yang mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of bodhisattva downfalls:

original: ci nus par rigs pa dang ma rigs pa ma brtags par rtsom pa'am rtog pa'am btang snyoms su 'jog pa ni ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: ci nus par rigs pa dang ma rigs pa ma brtags par rtsom pa'am rtog pa'am btang snyoms su 'jog pa ni ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: If one undertakes what is proper or improper without examining it to the best of one's ability, or if one is indifferent, one has a downfall.

original: brtags te gar 'os pa las 'da' bar byed na /
analyzed: brtags te gar 'os pa las 'da' bar byed na /
translated: If one transgresses what is appropriate after examination,

original: tha na gdol pa'i bran gyis dpyas na yang ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: tha na gdol pa'i bran gyis dpyas na yang ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: then even if one is criticized by a low-caste servant, one has a downfall.

original: 'di gang las shes she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las gsungs pa las shes te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las gsungs pa las shes te /
translated: This is known from the sutra that incites superior intention.

original: byams pa rgyu bzhis sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i spobs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa rgyu bzhis sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i spobs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that the eloquence of all buddhas is due to four causes.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: byams pa 'di la spobs pa don dang ldan pa yin te don med pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / chos dang ldan pa yin te chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'bri bar byed pa yin te nyon mongs pa 'phel bar byed pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa 'di la spobs pa don dang ldan pa yin te don med pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / chos dang ldan pa yin te chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'bri bar byed pa yin te nyon mongs pa 'phel bar byed pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Maitreya, here eloquence is meaningful, not meaningless, it is Dharma, not non-Dharma, it decreases afflictions, not increases afflictions,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang phan yon ston pa yin te 'khor ba'i yon tan dang phan yon ston pa ma yin pa ste 'di bzhis so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang phan yon ston pa yin te 'khor ba'i yon tan dang phan yon ston pa ma yin pa ste 'di bzhis so //
translated: it teaches the qualities and benefits of nirvana, not the qualities and benefits of samsara. It is due to these four.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te byams pa gang la la rgyu 'di bzhis spobs sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te byams pa gang la la rgyu 'di bzhis spobs sam /
translated: Maitreya, whoever has eloquence due to these four causes,

original: spobs par 'gyur ba de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dad pa dag gis sangs rgyas su 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: spobs par 'gyur ba de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dad pa dag gis sangs rgyas su 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Sons and daughters of good lineage who have faith in that eloquence should arouse the perception that it is the Buddha.

original: ston par @12a * //
analyzed: ston par @12a * //
translated: They should arouse the perception that it is the Teacher.

original: 'du shes byas te dam pa'i chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes byas te dam pa'i chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: They should listen to the true doctrine.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byams pa gang cung zad legs par smras pa de thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin no //🔽byams pa de la su spobs pa 'di dag la sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byams pa gang cung zad legs par smras pa de thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin no // byams pa de la su spobs pa 'di dag la sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: Maitreya, whatever is well spoken, all of that is spoken by the Buddha.

original: zhes spong ba dang gang zag de la zhe sdang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes spong ba dang gang zag de la zhe sdang ba'i phyir /
translated: Maitreya, whoever rejects these kinds of eloquence, saying, “This is not spoken by the Buddha,” and because of hostility toward those people,

original: de dag la ri mo mi byed na /
analyzed: de dag la ri mo mi byed na /
translated: does not respect them,

original: des sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'i spobs pa thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'i spobs pa thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: by that they reject all the eloquence spoken by the Buddha.

original: chos spangs pas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i las kyis ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: shin tu ma rungs las byas te //
translated: And so they do very terrible actions.🔽They fall under the power of evil,

original: sdig pa'i dbang du song ba dang // mi mkhas 'chi bdag bzhon pas song //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dbang du song ba dang // mi mkhas 'chi bdag bzhon pas song //
translated: And the unwise are carried away by the horse of the Lord of Death.

original: de dag mi bzad sems dmyal 'gro //🔽zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag mi bzad sems dmyal 'gro // zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: They go to the unbearable hells.

original: de skad du sgo mtha' yas pa bsgrub pa'i gzungs las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du sgo mtha' yas pa bsgrub pa'i gzungs las kyang /
translated: The Dharani for Attaining Boundless Doors to the Way of the Great Vehicle also says:

original: sems can gang dag kha cig rtsod 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: sems can gang dag kha cig rtsod 'gyur ba ;
translated: Those sentient beings who are in conflict

original: / de yi gzhi rtsa yongs su 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: / de yi gzhi rtsa yongs su 'dzin pa ste //
translated: Have a basis and root in clinging.

original: de ltas gang la sred par 'gyur ba spongs //
analyzed: de ltas gang la sred par 'gyur ba spongs //
translated: Therefore, give up craving for anything.

original: sred pa spangs ba byas na gzungs su 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa spangs ba byas na gzungs su 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you give up craving, you will attain the dhāraṇī.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las kyang /
translated: The Vows of Individual Liberation for Bodhisattvas also says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni chos @14a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni chos @14a * //
translated: Śāriputra, moreover, bodhisattvas

original: thams cad la gzhan gyi 'du shes bskyed de dngos po ci yang mi len to //
analyzed: thams cad la gzhan gyi 'du shes bskyed de dngos po ci yang mi len to //
translated: do not take up any thing at all, but develop the perception of others toward all things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: len pa ni 'jigs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: len pa ni 'jigs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Taking is fear.

original: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Questions of Householder Ugra Sutra:

original: gang byin pa de ni yang bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni yang bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: What is given is not something to be guarded.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni bsrung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni bsrung bar bya ba'o //
translated: What is kept in the house is something to be guarded.

original: gang byin pa de ni srid pa zad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni srid pa zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What is given leads to the end of existence.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni srid pa rnam par 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni srid pa rnam par 'phel ba'o //
translated: What is kept in the house increases existence.

original: gang byin pa de ni yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: What is given is not held on to.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: What is kept in the house is held on to.

original: gang byin pa de ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: What is given is free from fear.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: What is kept in the house is full of fear.

original: gang byin pa de ni byang chub kyi lam nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni byang chub kyi lam nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: What is given shows the way to awakening.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni bdud kyi phyogs nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni bdud kyi phyogs nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: What is kept in the house shows the way to Māra’s realm.

original: gang byin pa de ni zad mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni zad mi shes pa'o //
translated: What is given is inexhaustible.

original: gang khyim na gzhag par gyur pa de ni zad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag par gyur pa de ni zad par gyur pa'o //
translated: What is kept in the house is exhausted.

original: gang byin pa de ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni bde ba'o //
translated: What is given is happiness.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni kun bsrung dgos pas sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni kun bsrung dgos pas sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: What is kept in the house is suffering, because it must be guarded.

original: gang byin pa de ni nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What is given is the relinquishing of afflictions.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni nyon mongs pa 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni nyon mongs pa 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: What is kept in the house increases afflictions.

original: gang byin pa de ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What is given leads to great wealth.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni longs spyod chen por mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni longs spyod chen por mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What is kept in the house does not lead to great wealth.

original: gang byin pa de ni skyes bu dam pa'i las so //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni skyes bu dam pa'i las so //
translated: What is given is the action of a holy being.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni skyes bu dam pa'i las so //
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni skyes bu dam pa'i las so //
translated: What is kept in the house is the action of an unholy being.

original: gang byin pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: gang byin pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa'o //
translated: What is given is praised by all the buddhas.

original: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni byis pa'i skye bos bsngags pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang khyim na gzhag pa de ni byis pa'i skye bos bsngags pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What is kept in the house is praised by childish beings.

original: gal te des bu la lhag par sdug pa bskyed la de bzhin du sems can gzhan la ma yin na des spyo ba gsum gyis rang gi sems la spyo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te des bu la lhag par sdug pa bskyed la de bzhin du sems can gzhan la ma yin na des spyo ba gsum gyis rang gi sems la spyo bar bya ste /
translated: If he generates excessive affection for his son, but not for other sentient beings, he should reproach his own mind with three reproaches.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: byang chub ni sems snyoms nga'i byang chub sems dpa' yin gyi sems me snyoms pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub ni sems snyoms nga'i byang chub sems dpa' yin gyi sems me snyoms pa'i ma yin no //
translated: Enlightenment is for the bodhisattva who has an equal mind, not for the one who does not have an equal mind.

original: byang chub ni yang dag par sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yin gyi ldog par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //🔽byang chub ni tha dad pa med par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin gyi tha dad du spyod pa ni ma yin pa ste spyo ba gsum po 'di dag gis rang gi sems @14b la spyos nas /
analyzed: byang chub ni yang dag par sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yin gyi ldog par sbyor ba ni ma yin no // byang chub ni tha dad pa med par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin gyi tha dad du spyod pa ni ma yin pa ste spyo ba gsum po 'di dag gis rang gi sems @14b la spyos nas /
translated: Enlightenment is for the bodhisattva who is correctly applied, not for the one who is applied with reversal.🔽Enlightenment is for the bodhisattva who practices without distinction, not for the one who practices with distinction.

original: bu de la mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bu de la mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Having reproached his own mind with these three reproaches, he should generate the perception of unattractiveness toward his son.

original: 'di ni mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi sdug pa ste /
translated: This is unattractiveness.

original: bdag gi snying du sdug pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi snying du sdug pa yin na /
translated: If it is attractive to me,

original: gang bdag gis de'i don du bu de la ni lhag par sdug pa bskyed la sems can gzhan la ni de lta ma yin pas sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'i bslab pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bdag gis de'i don du bu de la ni lhag par sdug pa bskyed la sems can gzhan la ni de lta ma yin pas sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'i bslab pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For the sake of that child, I have generated a special affection, but not for other sentient beings. Thus, I would be violating the precepts taught by the Buddha.

original: bdag gis de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang gnod pa byas srog la yang bag med de gnod par 'gyur bas 'di ni bdag la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang gnod pa byas srog la yang bag med de gnod par 'gyur bas 'di ni bdag la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: For that reason, I would be harming my roots of virtue and would be heedless with respect to my life. Thus, he is harming me.

original: bdag de'i phyir byang chub kyi lam dang mi mthun pa'i lam la spyod pas /
analyzed: bdag de'i phyir byang chub kyi lam dang mi mthun pa'i lam la spyod pas /
translated: For that reason, I am engaging in a path that is incompatible with the path to enlightenment.

original: 'di ni bdag la phyir rgol ba'o snyam du 'du shes gsum po de dag bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag la phyir rgol ba'o snyam du 'du shes gsum po de dag bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Thus, he is my adversary.

original: des bu de rgyur byas te /
analyzed: des bu de rgyur byas te /
translated: Having taken that child as the basis,

original: ji lta ji lta bur bu de la sdug par sems pa dang ldan pa bzhin du sems can thams cad la byams pa bskyed pa dang / bdag phangs par sems pa dang ldan pa bzhin du byams pa bskyed pa /
analyzed: ji lta ji lta bur bu de la sdug par sems pa dang ldan pa bzhin du sems can thams cad la byams pa bskyed pa dang / bdag phangs par sems pa dang ldan pa bzhin du byams pa bskyed pa /
translated: just as he has generated affection for that child, he should generate love for all sentient beings, and just as he has generated affection for himself, he should generate love for all sentient beings.🔽 🔽Just as he would protect his only son from all harm, in the same way, he should generate love for all sentient beings.

original: de lta de lta bur de sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta de lta bur de sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In this way, he should generate the thought.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'di yang gud nas 'ongs la bdag kyang gud nas 'ongs mod kyi sems can thams cad kyang sngon bdag gi bur gyur la bdag kyang sems can thams cad kyi pur gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'di yang gud nas 'ongs la bdag kyang gud nas 'ongs mod kyi sems can thams cad kyang sngon bdag gi bur gyur la bdag kyang sems can thams cad kyi pur gyur te /
translated: And he should think: “In this way, I have come from somewhere else, and they have come from somewhere else. All sentient beings have been my child before, and I have been the child of all sentient beings.

original: 'di la ni bdag gi'am gzhan gyi'am su'i sems can gang yang med do snyam du tshul bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni bdag gi'am gzhan gyi'am su'i sems can gang yang med do snyam du tshul bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
translated: There is no sentient being here who is mine, or who belongs to someone else, or who belongs to anyone at all.”

original: khyim bdag de ltar byang chub sems dpas dngos po gang la yang bdag gi snyam du yongs su gzung bar mi bya chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag de ltar byang chub sems dpas dngos po gang la yang bdag gi snyam du yongs su gzung bar mi bya chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Householder, in this way, the bodhisattva should not grasp at anything as “mine” or become attached to anything.

original: g-yo dang sred pa'i bag la nyal mi bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo dang sred pa'i bag la nyal mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be inclined to deceit or craving.

original: khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i drung du slob pa 'ongs la /🔽dngos po zhig bslangs pa las /
analyzed: khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i drung du slob pa 'ongs la / dngos po zhig bslangs pa las /
translated: Householder, if a student comes to the bodhisattva householder and asks for something,🔽and

original: gal te des dngos po ma btang na /
analyzed: gal te des dngos po ma btang na /
translated: if he does not give it to him,

original: des 'di ltar dngos po 'di btang yang rung ma btang yang rung ste /
analyzed: des 'di ltar dngos po 'di btang yang rung ma btang yang rung ste /
translated: He should think, “Whether I give this thing away or not,

original: bdag ni dngos po 'di dang gdon mi za bar 'bral bar yang gyur te /
analyzed: bdag ni dngos po 'di dang gdon mi za bar 'bral bar yang gyur te /
translated: I will certainly be separated from it.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du 'chi bar yang 'gyur zhing dngos po 'dis bdag 'dor /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du 'chi bar yang 'gyur zhing dngos po 'dis bdag 'dor /
translated: I will die without wanting to, and this thing will be abandoned by me.

original: bdag gis kyang dngos po 'di 'dor gyis /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang dngos po 'di 'dor gyis /
translated: I will also abandon this thing.

original: dngos po 'di btang la yid dga' ba dang / snying po blangs te 'chi ba'i dus bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'di btang la yid dga' ba dang / snying po blangs te 'chi ba'i dus bya'o //
translated: I will give away this thing, and I will die having taken its essence and having been gladdened by it.

original: 'di yongs su btang na bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe sems kun nas zin te gnas par mi 'gyur te /🔽'dis ni @15a * //
analyzed: 'di yongs su btang na bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe sems kun nas zin te gnas par mi 'gyur te / 'dis ni @15a * //
translated: If I give it away, I will not be seized by regret at the time of death.

original: bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang rangs pa dang 'gyod pa med pa skye bar 'gyur snyam du sems nges par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang rangs pa dang 'gyod pa med pa skye bar 'gyur snyam du sems nges par bsam par bya'o //
translated: I will think, ‘This will give rise to joy, supreme joy, delight, and no regret at the time of my death.’

original: gal te de ltar bsams kyang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bsams kyang /
translated: If, having thought in this way,

original: dngos po de gtong ma nus na des slong ba la kun go bar bya ba gsum gyis go bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po de gtong ma nus na des slong ba la kun go bar bya ba gsum gyis go bar bya ste /
translated: he is still unable to give away that thing, then he should make the supplicant understand by means of the three kinds of understanding.

original: bdag ni da dung mthu chung zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin te /
analyzed: bdag ni da dung mthu chung zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin te /
translated: I am still weak and my roots of virtue are not fully ripened.

original: theg pa chen po la las dang po ba dang bdag ni ma gtong ba la sems kyi dbang du gyur pa dang bdag nyid ni nye bar len pa'i lta ba dang bcas pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la gnas pa lags kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la las dang po ba dang bdag ni ma gtong ba la sems kyi dbang du gyur pa dang bdag nyid ni nye bar len pa'i lta ba dang bcas pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la gnas pa lags kyi /
translated: I am a beginner in the Great Vehicle. I am under the power of the view of self, which is not to be abandoned. I am caught up in the view of self and in grasping at “mine.”

original: skyes bu dam pa bzod par mdzad cing yongs su gdung bar mi mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa bzod par mdzad cing yongs su gdung bar mi mdzad du gsol /
translated: Noble sir, please be patient. Please do not be distressed.

original: ji ltar khyod dang sems can thams cad kyi bdam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis bgyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod dang sems can thams cad kyi bdam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis bgyi'o //
translated: I will do whatever I can to fulfill your wishes and those of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar bsgrub po //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub po //
translated: I will accomplish it.🔽I will strive with perseverance.’

original: de ltar brtson 'grus brtsam mo zhes khyim bdag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas slong ba la kun go bar bya ba gsum gyis go bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus brtsam mo zhes khyim bdag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas slong ba la kun go bar bya ba gsum gyis go bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this way, a lay bodhisattva should make himself understood through these three statements to the petitioner.”

original: slong ba la kun go bar byed pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' de la ma dad pa'am byang chub sems dpa' la slong ba ma dad par gyur pa'i nyes pa gzhan spang ba'i phyir gsungs par zad kyi /
analyzed: slong ba la kun go bar byed pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' de la ma dad pa'am byang chub sems dpa' la slong ba ma dad par gyur pa'i nyes pa gzhan spang ba'i phyir gsungs par zad kyi /
translated: This explanation of the bodhisattva's giving to beggars is stated in order to eliminate the faults of lack of faith in the bodhisattva and lack of faith in the beggar.

original: ser sna'i kha na ma tho ba med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ser sna'i kha na ma tho ba med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no fault of stinginess.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di smod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di smod do //
translated: The Lord has criticized this.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Bodhisattva-pratimoksa says,

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos 'di bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la med do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos 'di bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la med do //
translated: “ Sariputra, there are four things that do not exist for bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams la g-yo med do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ser sna med do //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la g-yo med do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ser sna med do //
translated: What are the four?🔽There is no deceit for bodhisattvas.🔽There is no stinginess for bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phrag dog dang phra ma med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phrag dog dang phra ma med do //
translated: There is no envy or slander for bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus snyam pa'i zhum pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus snyam pa'i zhum pa'i sems med do //
translated: Bodhisattvas do not have a discouraged mind, thinking, “I am not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang la chos bzhi po 'di dag yod pa de la ni mkhas pa rnams kyis /🔽kye ma'o 'di ni tshul 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang la chos bzhi po 'di dag yod pa de la ni mkhas pa rnams kyis / kye ma'o 'di ni tshul 'chos pa'o //
translated: Śāriputra, those who have these four dharmas should be known by the wise🔽as, “Alas, this one is a hypocrite!”

original: kye ma'o 'di ni kha gsag can no //🔽kye ma'o 'di ni chos las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma'o 'di ni kha gsag can no // kye ma'o 'di ni chos las nyams pa'o //
translated: “Alas, this one is a flatterer!”🔽“Alas, this one has fallen from the Dharma!”

original: kye ma'o 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @15b chos can no //
analyzed: kye ma'o 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @15b chos can no //
translated: “Alas, this one is a person with afflictions!”

original: kye ma'o 'di ni 'jig rten gyi zang zing lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma'o 'di ni 'jig rten gyi zang zing lhur byed pa'o //
translated: “Alas, this one is intent on worldly material things!”

original: kye ma'o 'di ni zas dang gos ched cher byed pa'o zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kye ma'o 'di ni zas dang gos ched cher byed pa'o zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: “Alas, this one is intent on food and clothing!”

original: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems dpa' ba yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems dpa' ba yin te /
translated: Śāriputra, in the same way, bodhisattvas are courageous

original: lag pa'i bar du yongs su gtong ba yin /
analyzed: lag pa'i bar du yongs su gtong ba yin /
translated: and give up even their hands and feet.

original: rkang pa yongs su gtong ba dang / sna yongs su gtong ba dang / mgo yongs su gtong ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong ba dang / bu yongs su gtong ba dang / bu mo yongs su gtong ba dang / chung ma yongs su gtong ba dang /
analyzed: rkang pa yongs su gtong ba dang / sna yongs su gtong ba dang / mgo yongs su gtong ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong ba dang / bu yongs su gtong ba dang / bu mo yongs su gtong ba dang / chung ma yongs su gtong ba dang /
translated: They give away their feet, their hands, their eyes, their ears, their nose, their head, their limbs and appendages, their sons, their daughters, their wives,

original: dga' ba yongs su gtong ba dang / nor yongs su gtong ba dang ; bde ba yongs su gtong ba dang / khyim yongs su gtong ba dang / gnas yongs su gtong ba dang / yul yongs su gtong ba dang / rin po che yongs su gtong ba dang /

analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa gang la spang pa'i sems mi skye pa'i / yongs su 'dzin pa de yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: gang slong ba de dag gis bslangs na yongs su gtong ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba'i g-yog de lta bu bcang bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: rgyal srid de gzung bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: longs spyod de dag dang rin po che de dag bcang bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /

analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di yang sems can thams cad la byin zhing yongs su btang na /
translated: ‘I have given away and turned over to all sentient beings this body of mine,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams lta ci smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams lta ci smos te /

analyzed: mig 'dod pa la mig sbyin no // sha 'dod pa la sha // khrag 'dod pa la khrag //

analyzed: rkang 'dod pa la rkang / yan @16a * //

analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dag 'di lta ste /
translated: I will give away external things such as

analyzed: sems can gang dang gang la gang dang gang gis ci dang ci dgos par 'gyur pa /

analyzed: sems can de dang de dag la de dang de yod pa sbyin no //

original: ci nas sems can 'di dag yongs su bsdus pas /
analyzed: ci nas sems can 'di dag yongs su bsdus pas /

original: chags pa med par sbyin no //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: chags pa med par sbyin no // de bzhin du sbyar te /

original: rigs kyi bu dper na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med bzhin du sems can rab 'bring tha ma rnams kyi nad med par byed do //
translated: Even without such thoughts, the tree will heal the illnesses of sentient beings, whether of the highest, middling, or least type.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i lus 'di la rtsi'i sdong po bzhin du 'du shes bskyed cing sems can gang dang gang dag la ci dang ci dgos pa khyer te /

translated: Noble son, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings should regard this body, which is composed of the four great elements, as a wish-fulfilling tree. Whatever sentient beings need, they should take from it.

translated: Just as the four great elements—the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the air element—are used by sentient beings in various ways, through various avenues, with various aims, various implements, and various enjoyments,

original: bdag nyid sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sbyin par smon lam 'debs pa dang / skye dgu thams cad la bdag nyid pha dang 'dra bar 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du yo byad thams cad ma tshang ba med par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid rab tu gnas pas yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sbyin par smon lam 'debs pa dang / skye dgu thams cad la bdag nyid pha dang 'dra bar 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du yo byad thams cad ma tshang ba med par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid rab tu gnas pas yin no //
translated: to pray that they themselves may give the enlightenment of buddhahood to all sentient beings; to engage with all beings as if they were their own parents; and to remain themselves as the means for all beings to obtain all that they need without any deficiency.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid g-yog tu sbyin par byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid g-yog tu sbyin par byed pa na /
translated: Thus, when bodhisattvas give themselves as servants,

original: slong ba dag la dga' ba yid la byed pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: slong ba dag la dga' ba yid la byed pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: they do so with a mind that is imbued with a joyful attitude.

original: sa la stan 'ding ba'i stan lta bu'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: sa la stan 'ding ba'i stan lta bu'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: They should have a mind that is like a seat on the ground.

original: sa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa yid la byed pa bsgrub cing /
analyzed: sa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa yid la byed pa bsgrub cing /
translated: They should cultivate the attitude of mind that is like the earth, which is to endure all sufferings.

original: sems @17b can thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba la ngal ba med pa'i yid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems @17b can thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba la ngal ba med pa'i yid dang ldan pa /
translated: They should have a mind that is tireless in serving all sentient beings.

original: byis pa'i skye bos sbyar ba'i nyes byas dang du blang ba la brtan zhing sran thub pa'i rang bzhin can legs par gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la mngon par brtson zhing sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba la rab tu zhugs pas yin
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bos sbyar ba'i nyes byas dang du blang ba la brtan zhing sran thub pa'i rang bzhin can legs par gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la mngon par brtson zhing sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba la rab tu zhugs pas yin
translated: They should be steadfast and patient in accepting the faults of childish beings. They should be intent on the roots of virtue that are well established. They should be engaged in serving the realms of sentient beings.

original: no // slong ba 'ongs pa dag la rna ba'am sna yongs su gtong ba na /
analyzed: no // slong ba 'ongs pa dag la rna ba'am sna yongs su gtong ba na /
translated: When they give their ears and noses to beggars who come to them,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas zin cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis rigs mtho ba las byung ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su dran pa'i gnas pa las byung ba dang / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad snying po med pa las snying por rtog pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas zin cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis rigs mtho ba las byung ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su dran pa'i gnas pa las byung ba dang / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad snying po med pa las snying por rtog pa dang /
translated: It is because they are sustained by the bodhisattva activities, because they have the attitude that comes from the high birth of the Tathāgata family, because they come from the state of recollecting all bodhisattvas, because they consider the essence of the three worlds to be insubstantial,

original: rang gi lus la ma chags pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa dang / gnas med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su dran pa la gnas pa dang / snying po med pa'i lus las snying po blang ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas yin no //
analyzed: rang gi lus la ma chags pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa dang / gnas med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su dran pa la gnas pa dang / snying po med pa'i lus las snying po blang ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas yin no //
translated: because they have the cause of not being attached to their own bodies, because they abide in the recollection of all the Buddha’s teachings that are without abode, and because they have the intention of taking the essence from their insubstantial bodies.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lce blangs ma thag tu tshig 'jam zhing dga' bar 'gyur ba byams par spyod pa'i sems kyis rgyal po la 'os pa'i seng ge'i khri bzang po la bzhag nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lce blangs ma thag tu tshig 'jam zhing dga' bar 'gyur ba byams par spyod pa'i sems kyis rgyal po la 'os pa'i seng ge'i khri bzang po la bzhag nas /
translated: In this way, as soon as the bodhisattvas had taken their tongues, with a mind that was loving, gentle, and delightful, they placed them on the excellent lion throne fit for a king.

original: slong ba de la mngon par smra ste /
analyzed: slong ba de la mngon par smra ste /
translated: He did not become angry.🔽He did not become depressed. He did not become discouraged. He did not become arrogant. He did not become proud. He did not become attached to his body.🔽He did not become attached to his face.🔽He did not become attached to his teeth. He did not become attached to his eyes. He did not become attached to his tongue. He did not become attached to his lips. He did not become attached to his ears. He did not become attached to his nose. He did not become attached to his hair. He did not become attached to his skin. He did not become attached to his nails. He did not become attached to his hands. He did not become attached to his feet. He did not become attached to his fingers. He did not become attached to his toes. He did not become attached to his body.

original: sems ma khros par byas /🔽sems ma smas pa dang / sems ma nyams pa dang / sems bdag nyid chen po'i rigs kyis mtho ba dang / sems sangs rgyas kyi gdung las byung ba dang / sems ma rnyogs pa'i rgyud dang mthu stobs chen po bskyed pa dang / sems lus la ma chags pa dang /
analyzed: sems ma khros par byas / sems ma smas pa dang / sems ma nyams pa dang / sems bdag nyid chen po'i rigs kyis mtho ba dang / sems sangs rgyas kyi gdung las byung ba dang / sems ma rnyogs pa'i rgyud dang mthu stobs chen po bskyed pa dang / sems lus la ma chags pa dang /
translated: He did not become attached to his face.🔽He did not become attached to his teeth. He did not become attached to his eyes. He did not become attached to his tongue. He did not become attached to his lips. He did not become attached to his ears. He did not become attached to his nose. He did not become attached to his hair. He did not become attached to his skin. He did not become attached to his nails. He did not become attached to his hands. He did not become attached to his feet. He did not become attached to his fingers. He did not become attached to his toes. He did not become attached to his body.

original: sems kha bzhin la mngon par ma zhen cing /
analyzed: sems kha bzhin la mngon par ma zhen cing /
translated: He did not become attached to his face.🔽He did not become attached to his teeth. He did not become attached to his eyes. He did not become attached to his tongue. He did not become attached to his lips. He did not become attached to his ears. He did not become attached to his nose. He did not become attached to his hair. He did not become attached to his skin. He did not become attached to his nails. He did not become attached to his hands. He did not become attached to his feet. He did not become attached to his fingers. He did not become attached to his toes. He did not become attached to his body.

original: pus mo'i lha nga btsugs pa'i lus su byas te /
analyzed: pus mo'i lha nga btsugs pa'i lus su byas te /
translated: He did not become attached to his face.

original: rang gi kha nas lce phyung la slong ba'i lus la gtad de tshig 'jam zhing mnyen la dga' bar 'gyur ba byams pa nye bar spyod pa 'byin cing /
analyzed: rang gi kha nas lce phyung la slong ba'i lus la gtad de tshig 'jam zhing mnyen la dga' bar 'gyur ba byams pa nye bar spyod pa 'byin cing /
translated: He did not become attached to his teeth. He did not become attached to his eyes. He did not become attached to his tongue. He did not become attached to his lips. He did not become attached to his

original: khyod nga'i lce khyer la ji ltar khyod dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yid dga' ba dang ; yid bde ba dang / rab tu dga' zhing rangs pa dang / mos pa skye bar 'gyur bar ci 'dod pa bzhin gyis shig ces zer ro //
analyzed: khyod nga'i lce khyer la ji ltar khyod dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yid dga' ba dang ; yid bde ba dang / rab tu dga' zhing rangs pa dang / mos pa skye bar 'gyur bar ci 'dod pa bzhin gyis shig ces zer ro //
translated: You may take my tongue as you wish, and be happy, delighted, joyful, and satisfied.

original: de mgo yongs su gtong ba na chos thams cad kyi mchog mgo lta bu'i ye shes la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de mgo yongs su gtong ba na chos thams cad kyi mchog mgo lta bu'i ye shes la 'jug cing /
translated: When giving away his head, the bodhisattva should think, “May I attain the wisdom that is like a head, the best of all things.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yongs su bskyab pa'i mgos @18a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yongs su bskyab pa'i mgos @18a * //
translated: May I attain the head that is the protector of all sentient beings.🔽May I attain the head that is the unexcelled wisdom of all beings.

original: byang chub khong du chud par byed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi mchog dpe med pa'i ye shes mgo lta bu mngon par 'dod pa dang / kun mkhyen pa'i mgo thob pa /
analyzed: byang chub khong du chud par byed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi mchog dpe med pa'i ye shes mgo lta bu mngon par 'dod pa dang / kun mkhyen pa'i mgo thob pa /
translated: May I attain the head of omniscience.🔽May I attain the head of the king of wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rgyal po la mos par byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi mgo mtha' yas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod cing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rgyal po la mos par byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi mgo mtha' yas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod cing /
translated: May I attain the head of the lord of all phenomena.

original: slong ba mtha' yas pa dga' bas yongs su khyab pa'i sems kyis yin no //
analyzed: slong ba mtha' yas pa dga' bas yongs su khyab pa'i sems kyis yin no //
translated: With a mind filled with joy, I give this to the beggar.”

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' slong ba dag la lag pa dang rkang pa yongs su gtong ba na dad pa'i lag pa dang ldan pa dang / rjes su phan 'dogs par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rtsal gyis gtong ba'i lag pa brkyang zhing /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' slong ba dag la lag pa dang rkang pa yongs su gtong ba na dad pa'i lag pa dang ldan pa dang / rjes su phan 'dogs par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rtsal gyis gtong ba'i lag pa brkyang zhing /
translated: “When bodhisattvas give away their hands and feet to beggars, they do so with the hand of faith, with the hand of benefiting others, and with the power of the bodhisattvas.

original: sbyin pa la mngon par dga' bar lag pa yongs su gtong ba dang / rten chen po la rkang pa 'dor ba dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mos pa dang / chor bas ma nyams pa'i sbyin pa'i mthus sems bskyed pa dri ma med par gnas shing /
analyzed: sbyin pa la mngon par dga' bar lag pa yongs su gtong ba dang / rten chen po la rkang pa 'dor ba dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mos pa dang / chor bas ma nyams pa'i sbyin pa'i mthus sems bskyed pa dri ma med par gnas shing /
translated: They give away their hands with joy in generosity, and they give away their feet with great support. They are dedicated to the bodhisattva conduct, and through the power of generosity that is not impaired by craving, they maintain the stainless generation of bodhicitta.

original: ye shes yongs su dkris pa med pa dang / chos kyi lus rgyun mi 'chad pa mi shigs pa mi chod pa'i lus dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ye shes yongs su dkris pa med pa dang / chos kyi lus rgyun mi 'chad pa mi shigs pa mi chod pa'i lus dang ldan pa /
translated: They have the body of wisdom that is free of the bonds, the body that is uninterrupted, indestructible, and indivisible.

original: bdud thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa /
translated: They are unshakable by any māras.

original: sems dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis nye bar brtan zhing 'phel ba /
analyzed: sems dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis nye bar brtan zhing 'phel ba /
translated: Their minds are firm and growing through the spiritual friend.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / spyod pa gcig tu gnas shing gtong ba gcig pus nges par 'byung bas yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / spyod pa gcig tu gnas shing gtong ba gcig pus nges par 'byung bas yin no //
translated: because he is in the same practice as all the bodhisattvas, and because he is definitely released by giving alone.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rang gi lus dral te slong ba dag la khrag 'byin pa na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rang gi lus dral te slong ba dag la khrag 'byin pa na /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva pierces his own body and gives his blood to the petitioners,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis rab tu dga' ba dang / sems byang chub kyi spyod pa 'dod pa dang / sems tshor bas yongs su ma zin pa dang / sems slong ba thams cad 'dod pa dang / sems yongs su len pa thams cad la mi sdang ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis rab tu dga' ba dang / sems byang chub kyi spyod pa 'dod pa dang / sems tshor bas yongs su ma zin pa dang / sems slong ba thams cad 'dod pa dang / sems yongs su len pa thams cad la mi sdang ba dang /
translated: his mind is joyful through the thought of awakening; his mind is intent on the practice of awakening; his mind is not overwhelmed by the experience; his mind desires all the requests; his mind is not averse to any recipient;

original: sems byang chub sems dpa'i gtong ba'i lam thams cad du zhugs pa dang / sems rang gi lus la mi lta zhing mi ldog la rgyun mi 'chad pas rang gi lus kyi khrag sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems byang chub sems dpa'i gtong ba'i lam thams cad du zhugs pa dang / sems rang gi lus la mi lta zhing mi ldog la rgyun mi 'chad pas rang gi lus kyi khrag sbyin par byed do //
translated: his mind is engaged in all the bodhisattva’s paths of giving; and his mind, not looking back or turning back, is intent on giving the blood of his own body.

original: ye shes kyi skye mched kyi sems theg pa chen po la zhugs pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi skye mched kyi sems theg pa chen po la zhugs pa /
translated: His mind is engaged in the Great Vehicle, the source of pristine awareness.

original: yid ches pa dang / yid 'dod pa dang / yid tshim pa dang / yid rangs pa dang / yid mgu ba dang / yid dga' ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid dang bar gyur te /
analyzed: yid ches pa dang / yid 'dod pa dang / yid tshim pa dang / yid rangs pa dang / yid mgu ba dang / yid dga' ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid dang bar gyur te /
translated: He is confident, pleased, satisfied, delighted, happy, joyful, and serene.

original: @18b rab tu dga' zhing mos pa dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pas yin no //
analyzed: @18b rab tu dga' zhing mos pa dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pas yin no //
translated: He is very happy, and he is inspired, pleased, and delighted.

original: slong ba rnams la rang gi lus las sha yongs su gtong ba na dge bar gtong ste /🔽slong bar 'dod pa'i tshig gis khyed nga'i lus las sha dang rkang cig dgos pa sbyin /
analyzed: slong ba rnams la rang gi lus las sha yongs su gtong ba na dge bar gtong ste / slong bar 'dod pa'i tshig gis khyed nga'i lus las sha dang rkang cig dgos pa sbyin /
translated: When he gives flesh from his own body to beggars, he gives it as a virtuous act.🔽With the words of a beggar, he says to them, “I will give you flesh and blood from my body.

original: khyer cig ces slong ba de dag la smra zhing ;
analyzed: khyer cig ces slong ba de dag la smra zhing ;
translated: Take it!”

original: dga' ba mtshungs pa med pa rnam par spel ba'i gtong ba'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa'i tshogs kyis bsten pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi grogs su gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dri ma bsal ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mchog rab dang /
analyzed: dga' ba mtshungs pa med pa rnam par spel ba'i gtong ba'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa'i tshogs kyis bsten pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi grogs su gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dri ma bsal ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mchog rab dang /
translated: He has a generous mind that increases incomparable joy, he is a companion for all virtuous qualities that are relied upon by the assembly of wise bodhisattvas, and he has the highest, excellent, superior intention that removes the stains of the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis zin pa'i sbyin pa rtsom pa chen po yid kyis 'dod par gyur pa dang / slong ba thams cad yi mi chad par sbyin pa btang ba'i dngos po dag gis shin tu so sor brtags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rkyen dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis zin pa'i sbyin pa rtsom pa chen po yid kyis 'dod par gyur pa dang / slong ba thams cad yi mi chad par sbyin pa btang ba'i dngos po dag gis shin tu so sor brtags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rkyen dang /
translated: The great mental desire to begin generosity embraced by the bodhisattva’s equanimity, the condition of the ripening of the karma of the individual who gives gifts without disappointing any beggars,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mngon du 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan bkod pa'i mchod pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du phyogs pa'i snying rje chen pos yongs su skyob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon du gyur pa'i stobs bcu rnam par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mngon du 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan bkod pa'i mchod pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du phyogs pa'i snying rje chen pos yongs su skyob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon du gyur pa'i stobs bcu rnam par spyod pa dang /
translated: the worship of the array of the adornments of the buddhafield that manifests in all world systems, the protection of all beings through the great compassion that faces all beings, the conduct of the ten powers that manifests the enlightenment of buddhahood,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig gis rim gror bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i khyu mchog dang seng ge'i sgrar sgrogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig gis rim gror bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i khyu mchog dang seng ge'i sgrar sgrogs pa dang /
translated: It is to proclaim the lion’s roar of the fearless leader in the presence of all.🔽It is to know that all times are the same in the present, in the three times.🔽It is to have the bodhisattva’s aspiration that reaches to the end of time in the presence of all worlds.

original: dus gsum mngon du gyur pa'i dus thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / yongs su yi ma chad pa mngon du gyur pa'i mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pas yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum mngon du gyur pa'i dus thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / yongs su yi ma chad pa mngon du gyur pa'i mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pas yin no //
translated: It is to generate the thought of indefatigability in the presence of those who are not discouraged.

original: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba dag la rang gi snying gtong ba na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba dag la rang gi snying gtong ba na /
translated: When bodhisattvas give their own hearts to beggars,

original: sems sbyin pa'i rigs la bslabs pa dang / sems pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa dang / sems byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa thams cad la mi rgod par shin tu gnas pa dang / sems rten du gyur bas slong ba thams cad la ri mor byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems sbyin pa'i rigs la bslabs pa dang / sems pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa dang / sems byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa thams cad la mi rgod par shin tu gnas pa dang / sems rten du gyur bas slong ba thams cad la ri mor byed pa dang /
translated: It is the mind that is trained in the types of generosity, the mind that is dedicated to the perfections, the mind that is not agitated by any of the bodhisattva’s acts of generosity, the mind that is well established, the mind that is respectful to all beggars because it is the support,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba dang / @19a * //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba dang / @19a * //
translated: the mind that is purified of higher intention,

original: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir smon lam chen po la zhugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug cing smon lam ma btang bas yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir smon lam chen po la zhugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug cing smon lam ma btang bas yin no //
translated: the mind that is dedicated to the great vow in order to ripen all beings, the mind that is dedicated to the bodhisattva way of life, and the mind that is dedicated to omniscience without giving up its vow.

original: de slong ba dag la rgyu ma dang / mkhal ma dang ; mchin pa dang / glo ba sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: de slong ba dag la rgyu ma dang / mkhal ma dang ; mchin pa dang / glo ba sbyin pa ni /
translated: “When he gives his liver, kidneys, heart, and lungs to beggars,

original: slong ba la rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba'i rnam pa'i mig dang / byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba'i byams pa dang / ming la ba'i yid la byed pa'i gtong ba dang / snying po me dpa'i lus las legs par brtags pa'i snying po len pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: slong ba la rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba'i rnam pa'i mig dang / byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba'i byams pa dang / ming la ba'i yid la byed pa'i gtong ba dang / snying po me dpa'i lus las legs par brtags pa'i snying po len pa'i sems dang /
translated: It is giving with eyes of delight and with a joyful expression to those who are begging, with love born from bodhisattvas, with attention to the name of the gift, with the intention of taking the essence from a body that is devoid of essence,

original: mthar dur khrod du 'gro bar lus rjes su dran pa'i yid la byed pa dang / lus gzhan la rag las par yid la bya ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis zin pa'i lus dang / gzhan gyi zas su sems pas lus la sbyang ki dang /
analyzed: mthar dur khrod du 'gro bar lus rjes su dran pa'i yid la byed pa dang / lus gzhan la rag las par yid la bya ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis zin pa'i lus dang / gzhan gyi zas su sems pas lus la sbyang ki dang /

original: khams 'khrugs pa snyoms par byed pa /
analyzed: khams 'khrugs pa snyoms par byed pa /

original: lus dang sems kyi stobs ston pa /

original: gser gyi dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba 'khrol ba'i sgra yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs 'byung ba /
analyzed: gser gyi dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba 'khrol ba'i sgra yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs 'byung ba /
translated: It is hung with golden bells and tinkling ornaments that make a pleasant sound.

original: rin po che'i 'bru bye ba khrag khrig phrag bcus kun nas bskor te rnam par phye bas shing tu 'phags shing blta na mdzes pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i 'bru bye ba khrag khrig phrag bcus kun nas bskor te rnam par phye bas shing tu 'phags shing blta na mdzes pa /
translated: It is surrounded by a hundred thousand quintillion jewels, and it is very lofty and beautiful to behold.

original: srog chags bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pas kun nas blta ba /
analyzed: srog chags bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pas kun nas blta ba /
translated: It is looked at by countless quintillions of living beings.

original: gdugs kheb gcig gis sa chen po thams cad skyong bar dbang bskur ba rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad la dbang ba'i stan du bya ba /
analyzed: gdugs kheb gcig gis sa chen po thams cad skyong bar dbang bskur ba rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad la dbang ba'i stan du bya ba /
translated: It is the seat of the consecration of the sovereignty of the entire kingdom, which is the protection of the entire great earth with a single parasol.

original: de la 'dug cing 'khor lo thogs pa med pas bskyad ba dang chis bya ba la rgyal po'i bka' thams cad nyams pa med par nyan pa de lta bu'i sten gyi rnam pa sbyin par byed do //

translated: It is the seat of the performance of all the king’s activities, which are carried out by the unimpeded turning of the wheel, and the listening to all the king’s commands without fail.

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gdugs rnams sbyin ba na /
translated: “In this way, when the bodhisattvas give parasols,

original: rin po che chen po'i bkod pas rab tu brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che chen po'i bkod pas rab tu brgyan pa /
translated: they give them in such a way that they are adorned with the arrays of great jewels.

original: rin po che'i yu ba can dril bu g-yer kha'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa rin po che'i srad bu dang rna rgyan dang mgul rgyan gyi phreng bas khugs can du gyur pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i yu ba can dril bu g-yer kha'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa rin po che'i srad bu dang rna rgyan dang mgul rgyan gyi phreng bas khugs can du gyur pa /
translated: It was covered with a net of small bells and had a handle made of jewels.🔽It was adorned with strings of jewels, earrings, and necklaces.

original: nor bu dang bee d'urya'i phreng ba mngon par dpyangs pa /
analyzed: nor bu dang bee d'urya'i phreng ba mngon par dpyangs pa /
translated: It was hung with garlands of jewels and beryl.

original: nye 'khor na dga' ba'i dbyangs dang yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byung ba /
analyzed: nye 'khor na dga' ba'i dbyangs dang yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byung ba /
translated: It emitted delightful sounds and pleasant voices.

original: gser gyi dra ba rnam par dag pas nang logs khebs par byas pa /
analyzed: gser gyi dra ba rnam par dag pas nang logs khebs par byas pa /
translated: It was covered inside with a pure golden net.

original: rin po che'i thur ma'i rgyan brgya stong bres pa nor bu rin po che'i mdzod kun du 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i thur ma'i rgyan brgya stong bres pa nor bu rin po che'i mdzod kun du 'dzin pa /
translated: It was adorned with hundreds of thousands of jewel handles and held a treasure of precious jewels.

original: aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / spos kyi dam pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas nye 'khor dri zhim por bsgos shing bdugs pa /
analyzed: aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / spos kyi dam pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas nye 'khor dri zhim por bsgos shing bdugs pa /
translated: It was perfumed with myriads of the finest aloe, sandalwood, and incense.

original: 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser ltar 'od gsal zhing dag pa /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser ltar 'od gsal zhing dag pa /
translated: It was as bright and pure as the gold of the Jambū River.

original: rgyan bye ba khrag khrig mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i gdugs de 'dra ba rnams dang / de bas kyang ches lhag pa'i gdugs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang // kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sems kyis sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: rgyan bye ba khrag khrig mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i gdugs de 'dra ba rnams dang / de bas kyang ches lhag pa'i gdugs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang // kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sems kyis sbyin par byed cing /
translated: He gives with a pure mind,

original: sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo mngon du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo mngon du gyur pa'am /
translated: to the foremost of all sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten brgyan pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten brgyan pa'i phyir ram /
translated: or to adorn the stūpas of Tathāgatas who have entered parinirvāṇa,

original: chos btsal ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam /
analyzed: chos btsal ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam /
translated: or for the sake of seeking the Dharma, to bodhisattvas, kalyāṇamitras,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba btsun par bya ba dag gam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba btsun par bya ba dag gam /
translated: or to bodhisattva Dharma teachers who are worthy of respect,

original: pha dang ma'am dge 'dun dkon mchog gam sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstan pa nas /
analyzed: pha dang ma'am dge 'dun dkon mchog gam sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstan pa nas /
translated: or to his father, mother, the Saṅgha Jewel, or all Buddhas,

original: len @21b pa po thams cad kyi bar dag la 'bul ba dang yongs su gtong ba dang ster bar byed pa dang / sbyin par byed pa na /
analyzed: len @21b pa po thams cad kyi bar dag la 'bul ba dang yongs su gtong ba dang ster bar byed pa dang / sbyin par byed pa na /
translated: up to all recipients. When he offers, gives, bestows, and gives gifts,

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba ste zhes gsungs pa dang / re zhig ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba dang por /
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba ste zhes gsungs pa dang / re zhig ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba dang por /
translated: And how do they dedicate them?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi skabs nas ji skad du /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi skabs nas ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the section on all wholesome roots in the first dedication:

original: smon lam 'di lta bu yang 'debs te /
analyzed: smon lam 'di lta bu yang 'debs te /
translated: They make this kind of aspiration:🔽“May these wholesome roots be purified and be of use to all beings, for as long as the end of the Dharma lasts.

original: ci nas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag rnam par dag par chos kyi mtha' klas par 'gro ba thams cad la nye bar 'tsho ba dang phan par gyur cig / des na dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag gis sems can thams cad kyi sems can dmyal ba'i ngan
analyzed: ci nas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag rnam par dag par chos kyi mtha' klas par 'gro ba thams cad la nye bar 'tsho ba dang phan par gyur cig / des na dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag gis sems can thams cad kyi sems can dmyal ba'i ngan
translated: By means of these wholesome roots, may the hells of all sentient beings be cut off.

original: song rgyun chad par gyur cig / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal ba'i phung po rnam par log par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs so //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba na /
analyzed: song rgyun chad par gyur cig / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal ba'i phung po rnam par log par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs so // dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba na /
translated: May the mass of suffering of those in the animal world and in the world of the Lord of Death be reversed.”🔽When they dedicate those wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: they dedicate those wholesome roots in this way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag sdug bsngal gyi phung po bzlog pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gyur cig / nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi skyob par gyur cig /'jigs pa thams cad las bsung ba'i
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag sdug bsngal gyi phung po bzlog pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gyur cig / nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi skyob par gyur cig /'jigs pa thams cad las bsung ba'i
translated: By this root of virtue, may I become a refuge for all sentient beings, in order to turn back the mass of suffering.🔽May I become a protector for all sentient beings, in order to liberate them from all afflictions.🔽May I become an island for all sentient beings, in order to rescue them from all fears.

original: phyir sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur cig / sa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur cig / shin tu grub pa dang bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dpung gnyen du gyur
analyzed: phyir sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur cig / sa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur cig / shin tu grub pa dang bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dpung gnyen du gyur
translated: May I become a light for all sentient beings, in order to show them the path to peace.🔽May I become a lamp for all sentient beings, in order to dispel the darkness of ignorance.

original: cig / rab rib med pa'i ye shes kun du bstan pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la snang bar gyur cig / ma rig pa'i mun pa bzlog pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi sgron mer gyur cig / shin tu rnam par dag pa la rab tu dgod
analyzed: cig / rab rib med pa'i ye shes kun du bstan pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la snang bar gyur cig / ma rig pa'i mun pa bzlog pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi sgron mer gyur cig / shin tu rnam par dag pa la rab tu dgod
translated: May I become a torch-bearer for all sentient beings, in order to lead them to the city of fearlessness.🔽May I become an illuminator for all sentient beings, in order to show them the path to complete purity.

original: pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la gsal bar byed par gyur cig / chos nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gzud pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi 'dren par gyur cig / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po nye bar bstan pa'i phyir sems can
analyzed: pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la gsal bar byed par gyur cig / chos nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gzud pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi 'dren par gyur cig / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po nye bar bstan pa'i phyir sems can
translated: May I be a lamp for all beings.🔽May I be a guide for all beings, in order to introduce them to the inconceivable Dharma-nature.

original: thams cad kyi yongs su 'dren par gyur cig / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi yongs su 'dren par gyur cig / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: May I be a protector for all beings, in order to reveal to them the aggregate of wisdom free from obscurations.🔽And so on.

original: de yang bsam pa thag pa nas yongs su bsngo ba'i tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no //🔽de yang dga' ba'i @22a * //
analyzed: de yang bsam pa thag pa nas yongs su bsngo ba'i tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no // de yang dga' ba'i @22a * //
translated: And this is not done with mere words of dedication, but with a sincere intention.

original: sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: And this is done with a joyful mind.

original: mgu ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //🔽dang ba'i sems dang / rab tu dga' ba'i sems dang / mnyen pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: mgu ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o // dang ba'i sems dang / rab tu dga' ba'i sems dang / mnyen pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: It is done with a satisfied mind.🔽It is done with a clear mind, a delighted mind, a tender mind.

original: byams pa'i sems dang / mdza' ba'i sems dang / phan gdags pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang / mdza' ba'i sems dang / phan gdags pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: It is done with a loving mind, a friendly mind, a helpful mind, a beneficial mind, a blissful mind.

original: de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: He dedicates it in the following way:🔽“By this root of merit of mine, may all beings have pure destinies, pure births, and a pure greatness of merit.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi 'gro ba rnam par dag par gyur cig / skye ba rnam par dag par gyur cig / bsod nams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid yongs su dag par gyur cig / zil gyis mi non par gyur cig
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi 'gro ba rnam par dag par gyur cig / skye ba rnam par dag par gyur cig / bsod nams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid yongs su dag par gyur cig / zil gyis mi non par gyur cig
translated: May they be invincible,🔽inexhaustible, and have invincible minds. May they be without forgetfulness, and have understanding, intelligence, and certainty.

original: / yongs su zad pa med par gyur cig / thub par dka' ba'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / brjed pa med par gyur cig / rtogs pa dang blo gros dang / nges pa dang ldan par gyur cig / blo tshad med pa dang ldan par gyur cig / lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las yon tan gyi rgyan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba
analyzed: / yongs su zad pa med par gyur cig / thub par dka' ba'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / brjed pa med par gyur cig / rtogs pa dang blo gros dang / nges pa dang ldan par gyur cig / blo tshad med pa dang ldan par gyur cig / lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las yon tan gyi rgyan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba
translated: May they have immeasurable intelligence, and may their physical, verbal, and mental actions be endowed with the complete adornment of all good qualities.🔽By this root of merit of mine, may all beings have the adornment of the major and minor marks of a buddha.

original: 'dis sems can de dag thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed par gyur cig / mnyes par byas nas kyang mi mnyes par mi byed par gyur cig / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa thob par gyur cig
analyzed: 'dis sems can de dag thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed par gyur cig / mnyes par byas nas kyang mi mnyes par mi byed par gyur cig / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa thob par gyur cig
translated: May they attain undivided faith in all the blessed buddhas.🔽May they listen to the teachings of the Dharma from those thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas. Having listened, may they eliminate all doubts.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag las chos bstan pa nyan par gyur cig / mnyan nas kyang the tshom thams cad rnam par ldog par gyur cig / ji ltar thos pa bzhin 'dzin par gyur cig / bzung
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag las chos bstan pa nyan par gyur cig / mnyan nas kyang the tshom thams cad rnam par ldog par gyur cig / ji ltar thos pa bzhin 'dzin par gyur cig / bzung
translated: May they retain what they have heard.🔽Having retained it, may they complete the practice.

original: nas kyang sgrub pa rdzogs par byed par gyur cig / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad sten par byed par gyur cig / sems las su rung ba yang thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: nas kyang sgrub pa rdzogs par byed par gyur cig / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad sten par byed par gyur cig / sems las su rung ba yang thob par gyur cig /
translated: May they serve all those thus-gone ones. May they attain mental flexibility.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las rnams yang dag par sgrub par byed par gyur cig / bdag nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po rnams la 'jog par gyur cig / shin tu dbul ba thams cad rnam par bzlog par gyur cig / nor bdun rnyed pa
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las rnams yang dag par sgrub par byed par gyur cig / bdag nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po rnams la 'jog par gyur cig / shin tu dbul ba thams cad rnam par bzlog par gyur cig / nor bdun rnyed pa
translated: May I attain the seven riches.🔽May I follow the example of all the buddhas.🔽May I realize the attainment of the faculties of virtue.

original: yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / sangs rgyas @22b thams cad kyi rjes su slob par gyur cig / dge ba'i dbang po thob pa rtogs par gyur cig / rgya chen po la mos pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su sgrub par gyur cig / thams cad mkhyen pa'i
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / sangs rgyas @22b thams cad kyi rjes su slob par gyur cig / dge ba'i dbang po thob pa rtogs par gyur cig / rgya chen po la mos pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su sgrub par gyur cig / thams cad mkhyen pa'i
