translated: Whatever roots of virtue I have generated in the past, whatever I am generating now, and whatever I will generate in the future, by the power of my intention, I dedicate all of them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i sred pa'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba la grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i sred pa'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba la grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, through the power of the mind that is habituated in this way, having perfected the aspiration to give away everything, the power of the mind of giving is connected with the giving away of the body. Giving away all possessions is called “liberation” because it is liberated from the suffering of craving that arises from the root of grasping.

original: bar du yang bskal pa gzhal du med cing grangs med par 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar du yang bskal pa gzhal du med cing grangs med par 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the middle, he experiences the various kinds of infinite, excellent, mundane and transcendental happiness for immeasurable, incalculable eons.

original: rang gi lus la sogs pa mchil pa'i gzan lta bur bdag longs spyod par mi 'dod pa des kyang gzhan dag drangs nas sgrol lo //
analyzed: rang gi lus la sogs pa mchil pa'i gzan lta bur bdag longs spyod par mi 'dod pa des kyang gzhan dag drangs nas sgrol lo //
translated: Even if he does not want to enjoy his own body, etc. like a piece of chewed food, he attracts others and liberates them.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang sbyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang sbyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub po zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the noble Cloud of Jewels says, “Giving is the enlightenment of the bodhisattva.”

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the perfection of generosity, the first chapter in the Bodhisattvabhūmi.

original: // / de ltar lus la sogs pa btang ba 'di dag kyang bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar lus la sogs pa btang ba 'di dag kyang bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, these gifts of the body, etc. should be protected.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar // sems can rnams kyis longs spyad phyir //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar // sems can rnams kyis longs spyad phyir //
translated: Because:🔽The body, etc. are given to sentient beings

original: lus la sogs pa sbyin par bya //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa sbyin par bya //
translated: so that they can use them.

original: ma bsrungs longs spyod ga las 'ongs //
analyzed: ma bsrungs longs spyod ga las 'ongs //
translated: How can there be enjoyment without protection?

original: gang mi spyod pas ci zhig sbyin //
analyzed: gang mi spyod pas ci zhig sbyin //
translated: What can be given by one who does not enjoy it?

original: de bas sems can longs spyod phyir//
analyzed: de bas sems can longs spyod phyir//
translated: Therefore, in order to enjoy the wealth of sentient beings,

original: @25a * // lus la sogs pa bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: @25a * // lus la sogs pa bsrung bar bya //
translated: one should protect one’s body and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las /
translated: The Bodhisattvapratimoksha says,

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan bsrung ngo snyam na bdag ba srung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan bsrung ngo snyam na bdag ba srung bar bya'o //
translated: “Sharिपuत्र, if you think ‘I will protect others,’ you should protect yourself.

original: de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phan pa 'dod pa dang ldan pas srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phan pa 'dod pa dang ldan pas srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, Sharिपuत्र, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with the desire to benefit does not commit evil actions even for the sake of his life.”

original: khyim bdag dpal phyin gyis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: khyim bdag dpal phyin gyis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Gṛhapatidhanapāramitā-sūtra also says,

original: khur gyi don du shing rta ltar chos kyi blo 'ba' zhig gis gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khur gyi don du shing rta ltar chos kyi blo 'ba' zhig gis gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Like a chariot for the sake of a load, it should be grasped only with the thought of Dharma.”

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Akṣayamatisūtra says,🔽“Bhagavat, how should a bodhisattva regard his body?”

original: sems can la lta bas lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi skye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can la lta bas lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi skye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And by looking at sentient beings, he is not overwhelmed by physical suffering.

original: lus la sogs pa de ltar bskyang zhe na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa de ltar bskyang zhe na /
translated: How should one care for the body, etc.?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtang zhing /🔽sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtang zhing / sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: Do not abandon the spiritual teacher.🔽As the Gaṇḍavyūha Sūtra says,

original: 'phags pa dpal 'byung gis ji skang bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpal 'byung gis ji skang bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: Noble Shrīsaṃbhava declared,

original: rigs kyi bu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ngan 'gror mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ngan 'gror mi ltung ngo //
translated: “Noble sir, bodhisattvas who are supported by spiritual teachers do not fall into bad rebirths.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are sustained by spiritual teachers do not violate the bodhisattva training.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten las mngon par 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten las mngon par 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are sustained by spiritual teachers rise above the worldly.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni spyod pa thams cad la mi brjed par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni spyod pa thams cad la mi brjed par spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who honor the spiritual friend practice all the practices without forgetting.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis thub par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis thub par dka' ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are protected by the spiritual friend are difficult to overcome by actions and afflictions.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: The spiritual friend makes one understand what should and should not be done.

original: bag med pa'i gnas las yang dag par bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas las yang dag par bzlog pa'o //
translated: He turns one away from the state of heedlessness.

original: 'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o ;
translated: He leads one out of the city of cyclic existence.

original: / rigs kyi bu de lta bas na de ltar yid la bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: / rigs kyi bu de lta bas na de ltar yid la bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of noble family, one should go into the presence of the spiritual friend with uninterrupted mental activity.

original: khur thams cad bkur bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir sa lta bu'i sems dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad @25b kyis mi bsgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang / las thams cad nyams su blang ba la mi smod pas 'jig rten gyi bran lta bu'i sems dang /
analyzed: khur thams cad bkur bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir sa lta bu'i sems dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad @25b kyis mi bsgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang / las thams cad nyams su blang ba la mi smod pas 'jig rten gyi bran lta bu'i sems dang /
translated: The mind is like the earth, for it is not at all discouraged by bearing all burdens. The mind is like a diamond, for it is unbreakable. The mind is like a mountain range, for it is unshaken by any suffering. The mind is like a servant of the world, for it does not complain about doing any task.

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal rnam par spang bas phyag dar blta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba bkur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong bas yongs su mi skyo bas gru lta bu'i sems dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal rnam par spang bas phyag dar blta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba bkur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong bas yongs su mi skyo bas gru lta bu'i sems dang /
translated: The mind is like a sweeper, for it has abandoned pride and arrogance. The mind is like a vehicle, for it bears heavy burdens. The mind is like a dog, for it does not get angry. The mind is like a boat, for it is not discouraged by going and coming.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor lta bas bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor lta bas bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: The mind is like a good son, for it looks at the spiritual teacher with the same attitude as the spiritual teacher has toward the student.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rang la ni nad pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rang la ni nad pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o ;
translated: Noble sir, you should think of yourself as a patient,

original: / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni sman pa'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bsten pa la ni sman gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan nyams su blangs pa la ni nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni sman pa'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bsten pa la ni sman gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan nyams su blangs pa la ni nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: of the spiritual teacher as a doctor, of the instructions as medicine, and of the practice of the instructions as a cure.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rang la ni 'jigs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rang la ni 'jigs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Noble sir, you should think of yourself as a coward,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni dpa' bo'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni mtshon cha'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni dgra sel ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni dpa' bo'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni mtshon cha'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni dgra sel ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: of the spiritual teacher as a hero, of the instructions as weapons and armor, and of the practice of the instructions as the destruction of the enemy.

original: yang de nyid las dge bsnyen ma mi g-yo ma'i rnam par thar pa las kyang /
analyzed: yang de nyid las dge bsnyen ma mi g-yo ma'i rnam par thar pa las kyang /
translated: And the same text, the Liberation of the Laywoman Acalā, says,

original: rigs kyi bu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rjes su bstan pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thugs mnyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rjes su bstan pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thugs mnyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, the blessed buddhas are pleased with bodhisattvas who follow the instructions of their spiritual masters.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig dang mi 'gal bar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la thams cad mkhyen pa nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig dang mi 'gal bar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la thams cad mkhyen pa nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The omniscience of bodhisattvas who do not contradict the words of their spiritual masters becomes manifest.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi chag la the tshom med pa la dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi chag la the tshom med pa la dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Spiritual masters become manifest to bodhisattvas who have no doubts about the words of their spiritual masters.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba la don thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs se //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba la don thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs se //
translated: All goals become manifest to bodhisattvas who are never separated from the attention of their spiritual masters.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: For this very reason, the noble Sudhana bowed his head to the feet of the monk Sāgaramegha.

original: lan brgya stong du mar bskor ba byas nas dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan la bdud de phyag 'tshal nas /🔽yang dang yang blta zhing yang dang yang mngon par blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / rab tu 'dud pa dang / gus par bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang @26a * //🔽yid la bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su bsgom pa dang / ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang / ngo mtshar du bya ba dang / yon tan mngon du bya ba dang / rjes su bsngags pa dang /
analyzed: lan brgya stong du mar bskor ba byas nas dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan la bdud de phyag 'tshal nas / yang dang yang blta zhing yang dang yang mngon par blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / rab tu 'dud pa dang / gus par bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang @26a * // yid la bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su bsgom pa dang / ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang / ngo mtshar du bya ba dang / yon tan mngon du bya ba dang / rjes su bsngags pa dang /

original: mthong bas dga' ba dang / dbyangs kyi mtshan ma gzung ba dang / gzugs kyi rjes su bsam pa dang / ming yongs su gzung ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan par bya ba dang / kha dog dang dbyibs rjes su dran par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mthong bas dga' ba dang / dbyangs kyi mtshan ma gzung ba dang / gzugs kyi rjes su bsam pa dang / ming yongs su gzung ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan par bya ba dang / kha dog dang dbyibs rjes su dran par bya ba dang /
translated: He was to remember the sound of his voice, to think of his form, to keep his name in mind, to remember his color and shape,

original: ye shes kyi yul rjes su bsam pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la rjes su 'jug par bya ba dang / smon lam gyi yul la rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / spyod yul gyi yul rnam par dpyad par bya ba dang ;
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul rjes su bsam pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la rjes su 'jug par bya ba dang / smon lam gyi yul la rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / spyod yul gyi yul rnam par dpyad par bya ba dang ;
translated: to think of the domain of his wisdom, to enter the domain of his samādhi, to follow the domain of his aspirations, to analyze the domain of his conduct,

original: ye shes kyi snang ba yongs su gzung bar byed cing dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba yongs su gzung bar byed cing dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi drung nas song ngo //
translated: and to keep in mind the light of his wisdom. He then took leave of the bhikṣu Sāgara­dhvaja.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen las 'ongs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par blta zhing gdang mchi mas gang bar dus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen las 'ongs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par blta zhing gdang mchi mas gang bar dus te /
translated: In the same way, he looked at omniscience, which had come from the kalyāṇamitras, and he was filled with tears.

original: dra byi la sprin la lan brgya stong du mar bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te phyag 'tshal zhing dra byi la sprin gyi drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: dra byi la sprin la lan brgya stong du mar bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te phyag 'tshal zhing dra byi la sprin gyi drung nas song ngo //
translated: He circumambulated Megha the Dravidian many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping him to his right, and, looking back again and again, he departed from Megha the Dravidian.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las kyang /🔽sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las kyang / sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: In the Bodhisattvapratimoksha it is said:

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon la gus pas gang yongs su mi gtong pa'i rin po che de 'jig rten na med do //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon la gus pas gang yongs su mi gtong pa'i rin po che de 'jig rten na med do //
translated: “Here, Shariputra, there is nothing in the world that a bodhisattva would not give out of respect for his teacher and preceptor.

original: gang lus kyis rim gro mi bya ba de med do //
analyzed: gang lus kyis rim gro mi bya ba de med do //
translated: There is nothing that he would not give with his body.

original: gang rkang pas gtong ba la mi spro ba de med do //
analyzed: gang rkang pas gtong ba la mi spro ba de med do //
translated: There is nothing that he would not give with his feet.

original: gang ngag gi las la mi spro ba de med do //
analyzed: gang ngag gi las la mi spro ba de med do //
translated: There is nothing that he would not give with his speech.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos 'di ni 'ching ba thams cad gcad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di ni 'ching ba thams cad gcad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This Dharma cuts through all bonds.

original: chos 'di ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba gcod par 'gyur ba'o snyam nas rin po che'i sems bskyed do //

analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / de nas tshong dpon gyi bu mo des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and having trained in that, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will become a support for all sentient beings.”

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di ltar chos rgya chen po 'di dag yongs su brjod pa ni ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di ltar chos rgya chen po 'di dag yongs su brjod pa ni ngo mtshar te /
translated: Then the merchant’s daughter said to the bodhisattva great being Sadāprarudita, “Noble sir, it is amazing how much you have explained about the vast Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu chos 'di lta bu re re'i phyir yang bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed ngu lus yongs su gtang bar bya ba yin na gcig lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos 'di lta bu re re'i phyir yang bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed ngu lus yongs su gtang bar bya ba yin na gcig lta ci smos te /
translated: Noble sir, for the sake of each of these dharmas, you should give up your body as many times as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, not to mention just one.”

original: de tsam du khyod kyis chos 'di dag rgya cher yongs su brjod na rigs kyi bu khyod gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la bkur sti bya ba'i gser ram nor bu'am mu tig gam bee d'urya'am zhes bya ba nas bdag kyang khyed
analyzed: de tsam du khyod kyis chos 'di dag rgya cher yongs su brjod na rigs kyi bu khyod gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la bkur sti bya ba'i gser ram nor bu'am mu tig gam bee d'urya'am zhes bya ba nas bdag kyang khyed
translated: If you were to explain these phenomena in detail, then, son of noble family, what would you use to show respect to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata? Gold? Jewels? Pearls? Beryls?🔽

original: kyis stsal ba'i g-yog mo lnga brgya 'di dag dang lhan cig tu chos 'phags la mchod pa bgyi ba'i slad du mchi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher sbyar ro //
analyzed: kyis stsal ba'i g-yog mo lnga brgya 'di dag dang lhan cig tu chos 'phags la mchod pa bgyi ba'i slad du mchi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher sbyar ro //
translated: If you were to explain these things in detail, then, son of a good family, you would have gold, or jewels, or pearls, or beryl, or…” and so on up to “I will go with these five hundred servant girls that you have given me in order to worship Dharmodgata.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags stan las langs te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva great being Dharmodgata rose up from his seat,

original: bdag gi khyim du zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag gi khyim du zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and entered his own house, and so on up to

original: lo bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba'i bar dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu yang lo bdun gyi bar du 'dod pa'i rtog pa ma byung /🔽gnod sems kyi rtog pa ma byung /
analyzed: lo bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba'i bar dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu yang lo bdun gyi bar du 'dod pa'i rtog pa ma byung / gnod sems kyi rtog pa ma byung /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, for seven years, did not have thoughts of desire,🔽did not have thoughts of malice,

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa ma byung /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa ma byung /
translated: did not have thoughts of violence,

original: ro la brkam pa ma skyes te /
analyzed: ro la brkam pa ma skyes te /
translated: and did not give rise to craving for tastes.

original: gzhan du ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags nam ldang bar gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags nam ldang bar gyur /
translated: Otherwise, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata rose up,

original: bdag cag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi chos kyi khri gang la rigs kyi bu de 'dug nas chos ston par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khri bshams na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi chos kyi khri gang la rigs kyi bu de 'dug nas chos ston par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khri bshams na /
translated: we would prepare the Dharma seat on which the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata would sit and teach the Dharma.

original: bdag gis sa phyogs 'di chag chag @28b ma btab kyis legs par byugs la me tog sna tshogs gtor te /
analyzed: bdag gis sa phyogs 'di chag chag @28b ma btab kyis legs par byugs la me tog sna tshogs gtor te /
translated: I would sprinkle and sweep this place well, scatter various flowers,

original: sa phyogs gang du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa rab tu ston par 'gyur ba der legs par byug par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: sa phyogs gang du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa rab tu ston par 'gyur ba der legs par byug par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will anoint the ground where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will teach the perfection of wisdom and skill in means.”

original: tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgya de dag dang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu'i rjes su slob cing spyod lam gnyis kyis dus 'da' bar byed pa bya ba thams cad kyang de'i rjes su 'jug go de nas
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgya de dag dang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu'i rjes su slob cing spyod lam gnyis kyis dus 'da' bar byed pa bya ba thams cad kyang de'i rjes su 'jug go de nas
translated: The five hundred girls, with the merchant’s daughter at their head, following the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, spent their time in two activities: they did all their work following him, and they asked him questions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus lha'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus lha'i sgra thos te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita heard a divine voice:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags ni zhag bdun na ting nge 'dzin las langs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags ni zhag bdun na ting nge 'dzin las langs te /
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will rise from his samādhi after seven days.

original: langs nas kyang grong khyer gyi dbus su 'dug ste chos stan par 'gyur ro zhes grag nas /
analyzed: langs nas kyang grong khyer gyi dbus su 'dug ste chos stan par 'gyur ro zhes grag nas /
translated: When he rises, he will sit in the middle of the city and teach the Dharma.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu lha'i sgra de thos pa dang / dga' mgu yid rangs rab tu mgu zhing dga' ba dang yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu lha'i sgra de thos pa dang / dga' mgu yid rangs rab tu mgu zhing dga' ba dang yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: he was delighted, pleased, and overjoyed.

original: tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgya dang / sa phyogs de phyags nas /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgya dang / sa phyogs de phyags nas /
translated: He swept the area together with the merchant’s daughter and the five hundred girls,

original: chos kyi khri rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa bshams so //
analyzed: chos kyi khri rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa bshams so //
translated: and set up a Dharma seat adorned with all jewels.

original: de nas bu mo de dag gis rang rang gi bla gos phud de stan gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags 'dug nas chos ston par 'gyur ba der bting ngo //
analyzed: de nas bu mo de dag gis rang rang gi bla gos phud de stan gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags 'dug nas chos ston par 'gyur ba der bting ngo //
translated: Then those girls each took off their upper garments and spread them on the seat where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata would sit and teach the Dharma.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus sa phyogs der chag chag gdab par 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus sa phyogs der chag chag gdab par 'dod na /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, wishing to sprinkle that area with water,

original: bdud sdig can gyis chu thams cad mi snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyis chu thams cad mi snang bar byas nas /
translated: but the evil Māra made all the water disappear.

original: ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus chu ma rnyed nas yid mi dga' zhing sems sdug bsngal te sems gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nub par 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa de yang mi mdzes par bya ba'i phyir chu de dag mi snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus chu ma rnyed nas yid mi dga' zhing sems sdug bsngal te sems gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nub par 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa de yang mi mdzes par bya ba'i phyir chu de dag mi snang bar byas nas /
translated: In order to make the Bodhisattva Sadaprarudita not find water, and to make his mind unhappy, to make him suffer, to make him change his mind, to make his wholesome roots disappear, and to make that offering site ugly, they made the water disappear.

original: kun du chu btsal na ma rnyed do //
analyzed: kun du chu btsal na ma rnyed do //
translated: They searched everywhere for water, but did not find any.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sadaprarudita thought this:

original: bdag gi lus phug la khrag gis sa phyogs 'di chag chag gdab po //
analyzed: bdag gi lus phug la khrag gis sa phyogs 'di chag chag gdab po //
translated: I will pierce my body and sprinkle this place with my blood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa phyogs 'di ni rdul che ste /🔽rdul gyi khams 'di nas byung bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos @29a * //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di ni rdul che ste / rdul gyi khams 'di nas byung bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos @29a * //
translated: This place is very dusty,

original: 'phags kyi lus la phog na mi rung na /
analyzed: 'phags kyi lus la phog na mi rung na /
translated: and if this dust from the earth were to get on the body of the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata, it would not be right.

original: bdag gi lus gdon mi za bar 'jig pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bdag gi lus gdon mi za bar 'jig pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: This body of mine will surely perish anyway, so what is the use of it?

original: bdag gi lus 'di lta bu'i bya ba la zhig pa ni bla'i /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di lta bu'i bya ba la zhig pa ni bla'i /
translated: It is better that this body of mine be destroyed in such a way,

original: nus pa med pa'i bya ba la 'dod pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i gzhis 'khor ba dag na bdag gi lus brgya stong mang po de lta bu'i gnas su zhig pa ni cir yang mi rung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i bya ba la 'dod pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i gzhis 'khor ba dag na bdag gi lus brgya stong mang po de lta bu'i gnas su zhig pa ni cir yang mi rung ngo snyam mo //
translated: than that I should desire to do something that I am incapable of doing. It is not right that I should destroy my body in such a way, for the sake of desire, in the midst of cyclic existence.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus mtshon rnon po blangs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngus mtshon rnon po blangs te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita took a sharp knife

original: bdag gi lus kun du phug nas rang gi khrag gis sa phyogs de khor yug tu chag chag btab bo //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kun du phug nas rang gi khrag gis sa phyogs de khor yug tu chag chag btab bo //
translated: and cut his own body all over, and with his own blood he sprinkled that place all around.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu'i rjes su slob pa tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgya po de dag thams cad kyis kyang mtshon rnon po blangs te rang rang gi lus phug nas rang rang gi khrag gis sa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu'i rjes su slob pa tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgya po de dag thams cad kyis kyang mtshon rnon po blangs te rang rang gi lus phug nas rang rang gi khrag gis sa
translated: And all those five hundred girls, the merchant’s daughter and so on, who were following the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita as his students, took sharp knives, cut their own bodies, and with their own blood

original: phyogs de chag chag btab ste /
analyzed: phyogs de chag chag btab ste /
translated: sprinkled that place all around.

original: gang de dag la bdud sdig can gyis dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad bya bar glags rnyed par mi 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu dang bu mo de dag sems gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang de dag la bdud sdig can gyis dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad bya bar glags rnyed par mi 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu dang bu mo de dag sems gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: And since Māra the wicked one cannot find an opportunity to create an obstacle to their virtue, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita and those daughters had no change of mind.

original: de bas na chos bzhi pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na chos bzhi pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Sūtra on the Four Qualities also says,

original: dge slong dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i bshes gnyen srog gi phyir yang yongs su gtang bar mi bya ba dang / zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i bshes gnyen srog gi phyir yang yongs su gtang bar mi bya ba dang / zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Bhikṣus, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should not abandon a spiritual teacher even for the sake of his life.”

original: de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi btang bas bdag la sogs pa bsrung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi btang bas bdag la sogs pa bsrung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, by not abandoning the spiritual teacher, you should protect yourself and so on.

original: mdo sde dag la blta bas kyang ste /
analyzed: mdo sde dag la blta bas kyang ste /
translated: Also, by studying the sūtras.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams ni phal cher mdo sde dag las snang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams ni phal cher mdo sde dag las snang ste /
translated: The bases of bodhisattva training appear for the most part in the sūtras.

original: mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i kun du sbyang pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bcas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i kun du sbyang pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bcas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this and that sutra, the bodhisattva's trainings and the bases of the bodhisattva training have been established.

original: de lta bas na de ma bltas na ltung ba 'byung ba yang mi shes pas mi spong bar 'gyur bas rtag tu mdo sde blta ba la gus par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ma bltas na ltung ba 'byung ba yang mi shes pas mi spong bar 'gyur bas rtag tu mdo sde blta ba la gus par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if one does not read them, one will not know what the downfalls are, and so one will not avoid them. Thus one should always respect reading the sutras.

original: des na 'dis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtang ba dang / mdo sde blta bas dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtang ba dang / mdo sde blta bas dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this verse shows that one should not abandon the spiritual teacher and that one should uphold the holy Dharma by reading the sutras.

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Sagaramati Sūtra says,

original: rigs kyi bu 'on kyang yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig gang dag gis brjod du med @29b pa 'dus ma byas kyi chos de bsnyad pa'i yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig de dag gang len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu shes par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'on kyang yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig gang dag gis brjod du med @29b pa 'dus ma byas kyi chos de bsnyad pa'i yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig de dag gang len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu shes par byed pa dang /
translated: “Noble sir, but those who take up, hold, teach, and understand the letters of the alphabet by which that inexpressible, unconditioned Dharma is expressed,

original: 'jog pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par rab tu ston pa 'di ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //🔽rigs kyi bu gzhan yang chos smra ba gang dag mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang sgrub pa snying por byed pa'i chos smra ba de dag la gang bsnyen pa dang brten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa dang ldan pa dang rim gro byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jog pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par rab tu ston pa 'di ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o // rigs kyi bu gzhan yang chos smra ba gang dag mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang sgrub pa snying por byed pa'i chos smra ba de dag la gang bsnyen pa dang brten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa dang ldan pa dang rim gro byed pa dang /
translated: This is called upholding the sublime Dharma.🔽“Moreover, noble sir, those who approach, rely upon, attend, and associate with Dharma teachers who uphold, teach, and practice such sūtras as these, and who provide Dharma teachers with Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicines for illness,

original: gus par byed pa dang / zhes byed pa dang / bsti stang byed pa dang / kun tu srung ba dang / sbed pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gos dang zas dang mal cha dang na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: gus par byed pa dang / zhes byed pa dang / bsti stang byed pa dang / kun tu srung ba dang / sbed pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gos dang zas dang mal cha dang na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad sbyin pa dang /
translated: and who protect, conceal, and uphold those who are frightened, thinking, ‘In the future there will be those who uphold the holy Dharma,’ and who provide them with all necessities,

original: legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa dang / rje bo ltar kun tu bsrung ba dang / dge ba kun tu bsrung ba dang ; bsngags pa brjod pa dang / mi snyen pa 'chab pa 'di yang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa dang / rje bo ltar kun tu bsrung ba dang / dge ba kun tu bsrung ba dang ; bsngags pa brjod pa dang / mi snyen pa 'chab pa 'di yang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: to protect like a master, to protect virtue, to speak praise, and to conceal faults.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang rtsod pa med pa lhur len pa dang / chos ma yin pas rtsod pa rnams chos dang mthun par tshar gcod pa 'di yang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang rtsod pa med pa lhur len pa dang / chos ma yin pas rtsod pa rnams chos dang mthun par tshar gcod pa 'di yang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, it is also upholding the holy Dharma to be without dispute, to be intent on non-dispute, and to overcome those who dispute unrighteously with a Dharma that is in accord with Dharma.🔽 In the same way, it is also upholding the holy Dharma to have a mind that is free from anger, to have the intention to gather and liberate all sentient beings, and to give the gift of Dharma to others with a mind free from desire for material possessions.🔽 In the same way, it is also upholding the holy Dharma to have a mind that is free from pride, to have a mind that is free from deceit, and to have a mind that is free from hypocrisy.🔽 In the same way, it is also upholding the holy Dharma to have a mind that is free from jealousy, to have a mind that is free from stinginess, and to have a mind that is free from miserliness.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang zhe sdang med pa'i rgyud dang / sems can thams cad bsdu ba dang rab tu thar bar bya ba'i blo dang zong zing med pa'i sems kyis gzhan dag la chos sbyin pa 'di yang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang zhe sdang med pa'i rgyud dang / sems can thams cad bsdu ba dang rab tu thar bar bya ba'i blo dang zong zing med pa'i sems kyis gzhan dag la chos sbyin pa 'di yang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /

translated: Similarly, in a country or village

original: la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin du mkhan po dang slob dpon dang pha ma dang blon po dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams yid la byed pa dang / de bzhin du chom rkun yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin du mkhan po dang slob dpon dang pha ma dang blon po dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams yid la byed pa dang / de bzhin du chom rkun yid la byed pa dang /
translated: and so on, and likewise thoughts of preceptors, teachers, parents, ministers, relatives, and family members, and likewise thoughts of thieves,

original: de bzhin du gos la sogs pa yid la byed pa 'byung ngo //🔽gzhan yang chos smra ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yi ger bri ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gos la sogs pa yid la byed pa 'byung ngo // gzhan yang chos smra ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yi ger bri ba nas /
translated: and likewise thoughts of clothes and so on.

original: bklag pa'i bar la 'dun par gyur la /🔽chos nyan pa ni le lo can du gyur pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / chos smra ba ni yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod la chos nyan pa ni de lta ma yin pa yang de bzhin du sbyar ro ;
analyzed: bklag pa'i bar la 'dun par gyur la / chos nyan pa ni le lo can du gyur pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / chos smra ba ni yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod la chos nyan pa ni de lta ma yin pa yang de bzhin du sbyar ro ;
translated: Moreover, the Dharma teacher is eager to write out, and to read, this deep perfection of wisdom,🔽but the Dharma student is lazy, and the opposite, and the Dharma teacher wants to go to another place, but the Dharma student does not, and likewise,

original: / chos smra ba ni 'dod pa che la chos nyan pa ni 'dod pa chung ba yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: / chos smra ba ni 'dod pa che la chos nyan pa ni 'dod pa chung ba yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: the Dharma teacher is greedy, but the Dharma student is not greedy.

original: mdor na chos smra ba dang chos nyan pa gnyis kyis mi 'dzom par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad bdud kyi las yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdor na chos smra ba dang chos nyan pa gnyis kyis mi 'dzom par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad bdud kyi las yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In brief, all of these are the works of Māra that prevent the Dharma teacher and the Dharma student from coming together.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Gaganagañja Sūtra also says,

original: de ltar mi dge ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang dge ba'i chos spong ba de dag thams cad ni bdud kyi las so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar mi dge ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang dge ba'i chos spong ba de dag thams cad ni bdud kyi las so zhes gsungs so //
translated: “All of these—following unwholesome dharmas and rejecting wholesome dharmas—are the works of Māra.”

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Sāgaranāgarājaparipṛcchā Sūtra also says,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dgon pa par gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dgon pa par gyur te /
translated: “Blessed One, furthermore, when bodhisattvas live in the wilderness,

original: pas mthar gnas mal bca' bar mngon par dga' zhing 'dod pa chung la chog shes pa ste rab tu dben pa /
analyzed: pas mthar gnas mal bca' bar mngon par dga' zhing 'dod pa chung la chog shes pa ste rab tu dben pa /
translated: they delight in making their bed in remote places. They have few desires and are content. They are secluded.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre la de don nyung ba dang bgyi ba nyung bas bde bar gnas te g-yo ma mchis kyang /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre la de don nyung ba dang bgyi ba nyung bas bde bar gnas te g-yo ma mchis kyang /
translated: They do not associate with householders or monastics. They live happily with few concerns and few activities, and they are not deceitful.

original: mang du thos pa yongs su btsal ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / chos nyan pa la brtson pa mi gnas pa dang / chos kyi gtam dang don rnam par nges pa'i gtam gyi bar la rgyun dgum par sems te yongs su 'dri ba'i rang bzhin can ma lags /
analyzed: mang du thos pa yongs su btsal ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / chos nyan pa la brtson pa mi gnas pa dang / chos kyi gtam dang don rnam par nges pa'i gtam gyi bar la rgyun dgum par sems te yongs su 'dri ba'i rang bzhin can ma lags /
translated: They do not seek to listen to much, to ripen beings, to be diligent in listening to the Dharma, or to be diligent in the Dharma talk and the talk of ascertaining the meaning.

original: dge ba ci zhig tshol ba la mi brtson /
analyzed: dge ba ci zhig tshol ba la mi brtson /
translated: They do not strive to seek any virtue.

original: de dgon pa la gnas pa dang / gcig pur dga' pas nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi rgyu ste /
analyzed: de dgon pa la gnas pa dang / gcig pur dga' pas nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi rgyu ste /
translated: They do not dwell in the wilderness, and they do not delight in solitude, so the afflictions do not arise.

original: de kun nas ldang ba gnon pa tsam gyis dga' ba thob cing bag la nyal yang dag par gzhom pa'i slad du lam bsgom par mi bgyid de /
analyzed: de kun nas ldang ba gnon pa tsam gyis dga' ba thob cing bag la nyal yang dag par gzhom pa'i slad du lam bsgom par mi bgyid de /
translated: They are content with merely suppressing the afflictions, and they do not cultivate the path in order to destroy the latent tendencies.

original: de ni bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don gyi slad du brtson par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: de ni bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don gyi slad du brtson par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: They do not strive for their own benefit or the benefit of others.

original: bcom ldan 'das @33b byang chub sems dpa'i dgon pa la gnas pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i bdud kyi lcags kyu ste bdun pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @33b byang chub sems dpa'i dgon pa la gnas pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i bdud kyi lcags kyu ste bdun pa'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Blessed One, these are the seven hooks of Māra that are related to a bodhisattva’s dwelling in the wilderness.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen ltar bcos pa'i sdig pa'i grogs po gang dag de la bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen ltar bcos pa'i sdig pa'i grogs po gang dag de la bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang /
translated: “Blessed One, moreover, there are counterfeit spiritual teachers, bad friends who discourage bodhisattvas from the four means of attraction, from bringing sentient beings to maturity,🔽from upholding the sublime Dharma, and from gathering the accumulations of merit.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / rab tu dben pa la sbyor ba dang / don chung zhing bgyid pa nyung ba la sbyor ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i bka' mched de la rgyun du mang du ston pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / rab tu dben pa la sbyor ba dang / don chung zhing bgyid pa nyung ba la sbyor ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i bka' mched de la rgyun du mang du ston pa dang /
translated: They encourage them to be solitary, to have few activities, and to have few concerns. They constantly teach them the scriptures of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid de la mi ston pa dag la bsnyen cing ba sten te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid de la mi ston pa dag la bsnyen cing ba sten te /
translated: They are: not teaching the discourses that are associated with the Great Vehicle to those who are not students;

original: bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dben par gnas pas theg pa chen po las ldang ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dben par gnas pas theg pa chen po las ldang ba'i tshe /
translated: and when a bodhisattva, having lived in solitude, rises from the Great Vehicle,🔽to apply a bodhisattva to service, saying, “A bodhisattva must certainly do service.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' gdon mi za bar zhal ta byed par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' zhal ta bgyid pa'i dri ma la sbyor ba dang / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal ta bgyid pa'i dri ma la sbyor ba de'i tshe dben pa la sbyor zhing de la 'di skad du byang chub ni byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin gyi le lo can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gdon mi za bar zhal ta byed par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' zhal ta bgyid pa'i dri ma la sbyor ba dang / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal ta bgyid pa'i dri ma la sbyor ba de'i tshe dben pa la sbyor zhing de la 'di skad du byang chub ni byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin gyi le lo can ni ma yin no //
translated: When a bodhisattva is applying himself to service, at that time he should apply himself to solitude, and he should be told, “Awakening is for a bodhisattva who is energetic, not for a lazy person.

original: gal te khyod bskal pa brgyad dam bcus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas na phyis khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so zhes
analyzed: gal te khyod bskal pa brgyad dam bcus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas na phyis khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so zhes
translated: If you do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in eight or ten eons, then later you will not be able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: mchi la / bcom ldan 'das de la byang chub sems dpa' gang sgyid lug nas 'bras bu thob par bgyid pa'i gnas mchis nas /
analyzed: mchi la / bcom ldan 'das de la byang chub sems dpa' gang sgyid lug nas 'bras bu thob par bgyid pa'i gnas mchis nas /
translated: Bhagavān, if a bodhisattva becomes lazy and there is a possibility of attaining the fruit,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ltar bcos pa'i bdud kyi lcags kyu ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ltar bcos pa'i bdud kyi lcags kyu ste bcu pa'o //
translated: Bhagavān, this is the tenth iron hook of Māra, which is a counterfeit spiritual teacher for a bodhisattva.

original: de las gzhan pa byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i gang zag dag bdud kyi lcags kyus zin pa chos ngan pa la spyod pa de dag la dga' ba rnyed pa dang de dag kyang de bzhin du de'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / de dman pa la bsten cing khyad par dang bral bas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i gang zag dag bdud kyi lcags kyus zin pa chos ngan pa la spyod pa de dag la dga' ba rnyed pa dang de dag kyang de bzhin du de'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / de dman pa la bsten cing khyad par dang bral bas 'di lta ste /
translated: Other than that, the persons of the Bodhisattva Vehicle who are seized by the hook of Mara, who practice evil dharmas, find pleasure in them, and also engage in them accordingly,

original: zhan pa'i 'gro ba blun pa 'on pa lkugs pa'i 'gro ba 'gro ba dman @34a * //
analyzed: zhan pa'i 'gro ba blun pa 'on pa lkugs pa'i 'gro ba 'gro ba dman @34a * //
translated: and who, because of relying on the inferior and being devoid of distinction, go to a low rebirth,

original: pa nyid du mchi bar 'gyur te 'di ni bdud kyi lcags kyu bcu gcig pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: pa nyid du mchi bar 'gyur te 'di ni bdud kyi lcags kyu bcu gcig pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: namely, the rebirth of a stupid, deaf, mute, or inferior being. This is the eleventh hook of Mara.

original: gang gis de ltar brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pa skyo bar gyur pas /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pa skyo bar gyur pas /
translated: By means of that, one who has undertaken striving in that way becomes weary.

original: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one does not always become a Bodhisattva.

original: de bas na dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: de bas na dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: Thus, the Ratnamegha says,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod lam thams cad du brtson 'grus rtsom pa na /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod lam thams cad du brtson 'grus rtsom pa na /
translated: “Here, when the Bodhisattva strives with effort in all his behavior,

original: ci nas lus skyo bar mi 'gyur ba dang sems skyo ba mi 'gyur ba de ltar rtsom ste 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci nas lus skyo bar mi 'gyur ba dang sems skyo ba mi 'gyur ba de ltar rtsom ste 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: He begins in such a way that his body and mind do not become weary. This is called the bodhisattva’s constant effort.

original: gang gis skyo bar 'gyur pa'i brtson 'grus te ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis skyo bar 'gyur pa'i brtson 'grus te ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the effort that leads to weariness?

original: gang 'di stobs chung ba las lci ba'am dus ring por rtsom pa'am mos pa yongs su ma smin pa rnams bya dka' ba'i las rtsom pa ste dper na rang gi sha sbyin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang 'di stobs chung ba las lci ba'am dus ring por rtsom pa'am mos pa yongs su ma smin pa rnams bya dka' ba'i las rtsom pa ste dper na rang gi sha sbyin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is when the weak undertake something heavy, or when those whose aspiration is immature undertake something that takes a long time. For example, it is like giving one’s own flesh, and so on.

original: 'dis sems can rnams la lus byin zin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dis sems can rnams la lus byin zin mod kyi /
translated: Even though the bodhisattva has already given his body to sentient beings,

original: 'on kyang dus ma yin par yongs su spyad pa las bzlog par zad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus ma yin par yongs su spyad pa las bzlog par zad de /
translated: nevertheless, he prevents them from using it at the wrong time.

original: gzhan du na sems can de dag la byang chub sems dpa' skyo bar gyur pas /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can de dag la byang chub sems dpa' skyo bar gyur pas /
translated: Otherwise, those sentient beings would cause the bodhisattva to become weary.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon chud za ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i phung po chen po chud za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon chud za ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i phung po chen po chud za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the seed of the thought of awakening would be destroyed, the great mass of fruit would be lost.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las ;
translated: Therefore, the noble Cloud of Jewels says,

original: dus ma yin par 'dod pa ni bdud kyi las so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'dod pa ni bdud kyi las so zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Inappropriate desire is the work of Māra.”🔽“Inappropriate” means that you should not give your body at the wrong time.

original: dus ma yin zhes te lus gtang ba'i sems mi bskyed pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus ma yin zhes te lus gtang ba'i sems mi bskyed pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that you should not arouse the intention to give your body at all.

original: goms pa ma brtsams pa'i phyir nam yang sbyin par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa ma brtsams pa'i phyir nam yang sbyin par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For if you do not begin to practice, you will never give.

original: de lta bas na de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag nas byang chub kyi sems yongs su smin ba dang 'gal ba dang gti mug gis rang gi don la gnod pa dang / sha za ba dang las byed pa rnams la lus bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag nas byang chub kyi sems yongs su smin ba dang 'gal ba dang gti mug gis rang gi don la gnod pa dang / sha za ba dang las byed pa rnams la lus bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having established mindfulness in this way, you should protect your body for the sake of maturing the spirit of enlightenment, for the sake of your own welfare, and for the sake of those who are ignorant, who are your parents, and who are your disciples.

original: dper na sman shing ljon pa blta sdug pa //
analyzed: dper na sman shing ljon pa blta sdug pa //
translated: For example, a medicinal tree, beautiful to behold,

original: rtsa ba la sogs spyad 'os sa bon ni //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs spyad 'os sa bon ni //
translated: is a source of seeds and fruits that are useful for roots and so on.

original: sbyin yang dus min spyad las bsrung bya ba ;
analyzed: sbyin yang dus min spyad las bsrung bya ba ;
translated: But it must be protected from inappropriate use.

original: / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sman shing de bzhin no //
analyzed: / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sman shing de bzhin no //
translated: The perfect Buddha is like that medicinal tree.

original: mdor bsdu na bdud kyi las 'di ni gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bdud kyi las 'di ni gnod pa yin no //
translated: In brief, this work of Māra is harmful.

original: 'di rnam par spang ba ni dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las /
analyzed: 'di rnam par spang ba ni dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las /
translated: Abandoning these is taught in the Cloud of Jewels Sutra:

original: rigs kyi bu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las yongs su spong ba'i thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las yongs su spong ba'i thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Child of a good family, how is it that bodhisattvas are skilled in the means to abandon the works of Māra?

original: @34b 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: @34b 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
translated: Here, bodhisattvas completely and totally abandon all spiritual teachers who are not good.

original: mi mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa dang 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gsang tshig bsten cing sgom pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang mchod pa dang rim gro la chags pa thams cad nas thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa dang 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gsang tshig bsten cing sgom pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang mchod pa dang rim gro la chags pa thams cad nas thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
translated: They completely and totally abandon all attachment to living in places that are not conducive, to studying and meditating on the secret doctrines of the Lokāyatas, and to gain, honor, offerings, and respect.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gzhan dag byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam gyi bar du gcod pa de dag kyang thams cad nas thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gzhan dag byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam gyi bar du gcod pa de dag kyang thams cad nas thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
translated: They completely and totally abandon whatever other secondary afflictions obstruct the path of the factors for awakening.

original: de dag gi gnyen po yang bsten to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po yang bsten to zhes gsungs so //
translated: They also rely on their antidotes.”

original: de nyid las mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid las mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The same text states the characteristics of a nonvirtuous spiritual friend:

original: tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag rnam par spangs pas sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag rnam par spangs pas sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that by avoiding people who have faulty ethics, you avoid bad friends.

original: de bzhin du lta ba nyams pa dang cho ga nyams pa dang 'tsho ba nyams pa'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / 'du 'dzi la dga' ba'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / le lo can gyi gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba nyams pa dang cho ga nyams pa dang 'tsho ba nyams pa'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / 'du 'dzi la dga' ba'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / le lo can gyi gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang /
translated: Similarly, you should know that by avoiding people who have faulty views, faulty conduct, and faulty livelihood, by avoiding people who delight in social interactions, by avoiding lazy people,

original: 'khor ba la dga' ba'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / byang chub la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / khyim pa dang bsten pa rnam par spangs pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba la dga' ba'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / byang chub la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i gang zag rnam par spangs pa dang / khyim pa dang bsten pa rnam par spangs pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: by avoiding people who delight in cyclic existence, by avoiding people who turn their backs on awakening, by avoiding socializing with householders, and by avoiding bad friends,

original: rigs kyi bu des de dag yongs su spong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu des de dag yongs su spong ba'i tshe /
translated: when that child of a good family avoids them,

original: gang zag de dag la sdang ba'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de dag la sdang ba'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give rise to a hostile mind toward those persons.🔽One should not give rise to a mind of anger or a mind of contempt.

original: khong khro ba'i sems dang brnyas pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o des 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sems can rnams ni //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i sems dang brnyas pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o des 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sems can rnams ni //
translated: For the Blessed One has said, “Sentient beings are lost

original: khams so so ba bsten te /🔽bsten par gyur nas chud za bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: khams so so ba bsten te / bsten par gyur nas chud za bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: because they rely on the various elements.

analyzed: de bas na bdag gis bsten pa yongs su spangs par sems nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan byang chub kyi sems brjed par 'gyur te /

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma dang / sbyin gnas la slu ba dang / gzhan 'gyod pa med par dag la 'gyod pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / theg pa chen po @35a * //
translated: deceiving preceptors, masters, gurus, and those worthy of offerings;🔽causing others to regret what they have done well;🔽

original: la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la bsngags pa ma yin pa dang mi snyan pa dang brjod pa ma yin pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa 'byin pa dang / sgyu dang g-yos gzhan la nye bar spyod kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la bsngags pa ma yin pa dang mi snyan pa dang brjod pa ma yin pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa 'byin pa dang / sgyu dang g-yos gzhan la nye bar spyod kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is to deceive preceptors, instructors, gurus, and those worthy of honor. It is to cause regret in those who have no regret. It is to speak unfavorably, unpleasantly, unjustifiably, and uncharitably about beings who have entered the Great Vehicle. It is to deal with others through deceit and flattery, not with a higher motivation.

original: 'di rnam par spang pa yang de nyid las /🔽'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na skye ba thams cad du skyes ma thag tu byang chub kyi sems mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di rnam par spang pa yang de nyid las / 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na skye ba thams cad du skyes ma thag tu byang chub kyi sems mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: The avoidance of these is also described in the same text:

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du bar ma dor brjed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du bar ma dor brjed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Kāśyapa, if bodhisattvas have four qualities, they will actualize the thought of awakening in all their lives, and until they sit on the seat of awakening, they will not forget it in the interim.

original: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four?

original: srog gi phyir ram tha na bzhad gang gi phyir yang shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba dang / sgyu dang g-yo med par sems can thams cad kyi drung na lhag pa'i bsam pas gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston par 'du shes skyed cing de dag gi yang dag pa'i bsngags pa phyogs bzhir brjod pa dang /
analyzed: srog gi phyir ram tha na bzhad gang gi phyir yang shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba dang / sgyu dang g-yo med par sems can thams cad kyi drung na lhag pa'i bsam pas gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston par 'du shes skyed cing de dag gi yang dag pa'i bsngags pa phyogs bzhir brjod pa dang /
translated: They generate the perception that all bodhisattvas are teachers and proclaim their true praises in the four directions.

original: sems can gang rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de dag thams cad kyang nyi tshe ba'i theg pa mi 'dod par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gang rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de dag thams cad kyang nyi tshe ba'i theg pa mi 'dod par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa ste /
translated: They cause all those sentient beings whom they bring to full maturity to aspire to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening without desiring the limited vehicles.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po de dag go zhes gsung so //
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po de dag go zhes gsung so //

analyzed: seng ges zhus pa las kyang / gang zhig chos kyi sbyin pa las //
translated: The Sūtra of the Questions of Siṃha also says:🔽Those who never create obstacles

analyzed: nam yang bar chad mi byed pa //

analyzed: de ni des na rab myur ba dang // 'jig rten mgon dang phyad par 'gyur //

analyzed: de bzhin du /

analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pas skye ba dran //

original: gzhon nu de ltar shes par gyis //
analyzed: gzhon nu de ltar shes par gyis //

original: skye ba kun du byang chub sems //
analyzed: skye ba kun du byang chub sems //

analyzed: rmi lam na yang sems de ni // 'dor mi 'gyur na ma nyal tshe //

analyzed: smros ci 'tshal bar gang gis 'gyur //

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: It says:

analyzed: grong dang grong khyer rnams su yang //

analyzed: gang du gnas pa'i yul rnams su //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las kyang /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na smon lam mi 'dor ro // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Bodhisattvas who have four qualities do not lose their aspiration.🔽They are:

original: nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: nga rgyal bcom pa yin /

original: phrag dog dang ser sna yongs su @35b spangs pa yin /
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna yongs su @35b spangs pa yin /
translated: They are completely free of envy and stinginess.🔽When they see the wealth of others, they are delighted.

analyzed: pha rol gyi 'byor pa mthong na yid dga' ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / dkon mchog pa rtsegs pa de nyid las /

analyzed: de skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang /

analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du mir gyur pas ni byang chub thog par dka' la /

analyzed: byang chub ni mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du bskal pa mang po bskal pa brgya phrag mang po bskal pa stong phrag mang po bskal pa brgya stong phrag mang por bsgrub dgos pas bdag ni de lta bu'i khur bkur bar mi spro'o snyam du sems
translated: Enlightenment must be accomplished for many eons, for many hundreds of eons, for many thousands of eons, for many hundreds of thousands of eons, like putting out a fire on one’s head and clothes. I am not enthusiastic about carrying such a burden.”

original: mi bskyed de /
analyzed: mi bskyed de /

translated: However, bodhisattvas think, “Those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly complete buddhas who have attained complete buddhahood, those who will attain complete buddhahood,

analyzed: gang dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang /

analyzed: tshul 'di 'dra ba dang lam 'di 'dra ba dang brtson 'grus 'di 'dra bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /

analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa sha stag las mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin gyis /
translated: Those thus-gone ones will not have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood only after becoming thus-gone ones.

original: bdag kyang ci nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong gi brtson 'grus dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bdag gis kyang de lta de ltar brtsal lo 'bad do zhes @36a * //
analyzed: bdag kyang ci nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong gi brtson 'grus dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bdag gis kyang de lta de ltar brtsal lo 'bad do zhes @36a * //
translated: I too will strive and exert myself in this way, through diligence that is shared with all sentient beings and through diligence that focuses on all sentient beings, so that I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.”

original: gsungs so // gzhan yang gnod pa ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las mthong ste /
analyzed: gsungs so // gzhan yang gnod pa ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las mthong ste /
translated: Furthermore, harm is seen in the Heap of Jewels:

original: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa rnams la yid rton pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang / sems can snod du ma gyur pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa dman pa ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa rnams la yid rton pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang / sems can snod du ma gyur pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa dman pa ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang /
translated: “To trust those who have not ripened sentient beings is a bodhisattva’s error. To teach the vast Dharma of the Buddhas to sentient beings who are not suitable vessels is a bodhisattva’s error. To teach the Lesser Vehicle to sentient beings who are interested in the Great Vehicle is a bodhisattva’s error.

original: yang dag par nye bar gnas pa'i sems can tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can rnams la brnyas shing tshul khrims 'chal pa sdig pa'i chos can sdud pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //

translated: To despise sentient beings who are abiding in reality, who have ethical discipline, and who have virtuous qualities, and to favor those who are unethical and have non-virtuous qualities is a bodhisattva’s error.”

original: mos pa med pa yang gnod pa yin te //
analyzed: mos pa med pa yang gnod pa yin te //
translated: Lack of interest is also harmful.

original: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gi mdo las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gi mdo las kyang //

original: sangs rgyas la yang mos pa yod min la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la yang mos pa yod min la //

original: chos dang tshogs la de ni mos pa med //
analyzed: chos dang tshogs la de ni mos pa med //

original: bslab dang sbyang ba rnams la de mi mos //
analyzed: bslab dang sbyang ba rnams la de mi mos //
translated: They have no interest in training or purification.

original: sdig pa'i blo can ngan song gsum phyogs pa //
analyzed: sdig pa'i blo can ngan song gsum phyogs pa //
translated: They are evil-minded, oriented toward the three lower realms.

original: de ni mi nang 'di nas shi 'phos nas //
analyzed: de ni mi nang 'di nas shi 'phos nas //
translated: When they die and leave this human world,

original: las kyi dbang gis mi mkhas rnam par rmongs //🔽dmyal ba'am 'on te dud 'gro'i 'gro rnams sam //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis mi mkhas rnam par rmongs // dmyal ba'am 'on te dud 'gro'i 'gro rnams sam //
translated: They are confused and unskilled due to the power of karma.🔽They will find suffering in the realms of hell,

original: yi dags 'gro ba rnams su sdug bsngal rnyed //
analyzed: yi dags 'gro ba rnams su sdug bsngal rnyed //
translated: Or as animals, or hungry ghosts.

original: ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it says,

original: de rnam par spangs pa ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las mthong ste /
analyzed: de rnam par spangs pa ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las mthong ste /
translated: And their abandonment is seen in the Heap of Jewels Sūtra:

original: chos zab mo gang dag de'i blos mi rtogs pa de la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni mtha' yas shing /
analyzed: chos zab mo gang dag de'i blos mi rtogs pa de la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni mtha' yas shing /
translated: The Buddha’s enlightenment is infinite,

original: sems can mos pa tha dad pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: sems can mos pa tha dad pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa 'jug ste /
translated: And the teachings of the Tathāgatas are directed toward sentient beings with different interests.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mkhyen gyi bdag gis ni mi shes te /
translated: The Tathāgatas themselves know this, but I do not.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dbang du gyur pa yin no zhes byas nas mi spong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the Tathāgata himself is under your control.

original: zhal ta byed pa'i tshe don ma yin pa rnam par spang ba la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa'i tshe don ma yin pa rnam par spang ba la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: When you are an attendant, you should be skilled in avoiding what is useless.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las /
translated: The Vows of Individual Liberation for Bodhisattvas

analyzed: chos dang mthun pa dang chos nyan pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa la zhal ta bya bar bstan to //
translated: teaches that you should be an attendant for the sake of the Dharma, for listening to the Dharma, and for worshiping the Tathāgatas.

original: de la zhal ta bya ba gang yin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'i mdo las gsungs te /🔽de la dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad kyi sems mgu bar @36b bya'o ;
analyzed: de la zhal ta bya ba gang yin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'i mdo las gsungs te / de la dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad kyi sems mgu bar @36b bya'o ;
translated: As for what it means to be an attendant, the Heap of Jewels Sūtra says:🔽“The monk who is an attendant should please the minds of all the monks.

original: / de la dge slong dgon pa ba bas mtha'i gnas mal bsten pa gang yin pa de dag ni dge slong zhal ta byed pas thams cad du las su bsko bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: / de la dge slong dgon pa ba bas mtha'i gnas mal bsten pa gang yin pa de dag ni dge slong zhal ta byed pas thams cad du las su bsko bar mi bya'o //
translated: The monk who is an attendant should not assign all the difficult tasks to the monks who live in the wilderness and who use the gifts of the faithful only as needed.”

original: gal te dge slong dgon pa ba la dge 'dun gyi bya bar gtogs pa slob pa'i las res bab na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dgon pa ba la dge 'dun gyi bya bar gtogs pa slob pa'i las res bab na /
translated: If a monk who lives in the wilderness is assigned a task by the saṅgha,
