analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des las de bdag gis bya'o //
translated: the monk who is the steward should do that task himself.

original: yang na dge slong gzhan zhig bskos la las de byed du gzhug ste /
analyzed: yang na dge slong gzhan zhig bskos la las de byed du gzhug ste /
translated: Or he should appoint another monk to do that task.

original: dge slong dgon pa ba la gnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa ba la gnod par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not cause trouble for the monk who lives in the wilderness.

original: de la dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa gang yin pa de la dge slong zhal ta byed pa des kha zas bsod pa bgo bsha' bya'o //🔽'od srungs de la dge slong gang rnal 'byor spyod pa gang yin pa de dag la /
analyzed: de la dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa gang yin pa de la dge slong zhal ta byed pa des kha zas bsod pa bgo bsha' bya'o // 'od srungs de la dge slong gang rnal 'byor spyod pa gang yin pa de dag la /
translated: “Kāśyapa, the monk who is the steward should distribute good food to the monk who goes for alms.🔽Kāśyapa, the monk who is the steward should give to the monks who are spiritual practitioners

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas mthun pa'i 'tshog chas dang na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas mthun pa'i 'tshog chas dang na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: the provisions and medicines they need to be comfortable.

original: dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa des phyogs gang la gnas pa'i sa phyogs der dge slong zhal ta byed pa des sgra chen po dang skad drag po mi dbyung zhing byed du'ang mi gzhug go //
analyzed: dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa des phyogs gang la gnas pa'i sa phyogs der dge slong zhal ta byed pa des sgra chen po dang skad drag po mi dbyung zhing byed du'ang mi gzhug go //
translated: The monk who is a spiritual practitioner should not make loud noises or sounds in the place where he is staying.

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa de bsrung zhing mal cha yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa de bsrung zhing mal cha yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the manager should protect the monk who is a spiritual practitioner and should provide him with bedding.

original: kha zas bsod pa dang yi gar 'ong pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: kha zas bsod pa dang yi gar 'ong pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: He should give him good, wholesome food, and food and drink that are suitable for a spiritual practitioner.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: dge slong gang dag mang du thos par byed pa la brtson pa de dag spro ba bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong gang dag mang du thos par byed pa la brtson pa de dag spro ba bskyed par bya zhing /
translated: he should encourage those monks who are striving to become learned.

original: de dag la bsrung ba'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la bsrung ba'i bar du bya'o //
translated: He should protect them,

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de dag las su mi bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de dag las su mi bsko bar bya'o //
translated: and he should not assign work to those monks who are expounding the Dharma.

original: chos nyan pa la brtson par 'gyur pa'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa la brtson par 'gyur pa'i bar du bya'o //
translated: He should encourage those who are striving to listen to the Dharma.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor bsham par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor bsham par bya'o //
translated: He should set up the maṇḍala of the retinue.

original: 'bel ba'i gtam gyis dkyil 'khor rnam par sbyang bar bya ba nas de la legs so zhes bya ba mang bar 'gyur ba'i bar du bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'bel ba'i gtam gyis dkyil 'khor rnam par sbyang bar bya ba nas de la legs so zhes bya ba mang bar 'gyur ba'i bar du bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He should purify the maṇḍala with a discourse, and so on, up to: ‘There will be much that is excellent in this.’

original: dngos po gang la yang dbang bya ba'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang la yang dbang bya ba'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not arouse the notion that he is in control of any object.

original: bya ba ji tsam du chung ba yang dge 'dun gyi gros bzhin bya zhing rang dgar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba ji tsam du chung ba yang dge 'dun gyi gros bzhin bya zhing rang dgar mi bya'o //
translated: He should do even the smallest task in accordance with the agreement of the saṅgha, and not on his own.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang mi bsre ba'i bar du bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang mi bsre ba'i bar du bya ste /
translated: He should not mix up the saṅgha’s property of the four directions.

original: bzlog pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The opposite of this is also so.

original: de bzhin du mchod rten gyi dang phan tshun bsre ba yang bkag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod rten gyi dang phan tshun bsre ba yang bkag go //
translated: In the same way, he should not mix up the stūpa’s property with that of others.

original: gal te phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bre yongs su gyur la dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa @37a * //
analyzed: gal te phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bre yongs su gyur la dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa @37a * //
translated: If the saṅgha of the four directions has a surplus, and the saṅgha’s property

original: che bar gyur na dge slong zhal ta byed pa des dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus la gros mthun par bgyis te /
analyzed: che bar gyur na dge slong zhal ta byed pa des dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus la gros mthun par bgyis te /
translated: is great, then that monk official, having gathered the saṅgha of monks, should make a unanimous decision.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa las phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bshug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa las phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bshug par bya'o //
translated: If there is a gain for the Saṅgha, he should distribute it to the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: mchod rten zhig ral du gyur na yang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: mchod rten zhig ral du gyur na yang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If a stūpa is in ruins, he should do the same.

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag la gsol ba thob la mchod rten gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag la gsol ba thob la mchod rten gso bar bya'o //
translated: He should request the donors and benefactors to restore the stūpa.

original: 'od srungs gal te mchod rten gyi rnyed pa ji ltar mang du gyur du zin kyang de dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge 'dun dang phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bshu par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs gal te mchod rten gyi rnyed pa ji ltar mang du gyur du zin kyang de dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge 'dun dang phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bshu par mi bya ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, even if the gain for the stūpa is very great, the monk who is the steward should not distribute it to the Saṅgha or to the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dad cing dang ba mang po dag gis mchod rten 'phul ba ni tha na ras kyi kha tshar gcig tsam gang yin pa de yang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten yin na /
analyzed: dad cing dang ba mang po dag gis mchod rten 'phul ba ni tha na ras kyi kha tshar gcig tsam gang yin pa de yang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten yin na /
translated: Whatever is offered to the stūpa by many faithful and pure people, even if it is just a single thread, is a stūpa for the world with its gods.

original: rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention precious substances or things considered precious?

original: mchod rten la gos phul ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten de nyid du rlung dang nyi ma dang char pas dengs kyang bla'i mchod rten la phul ba'i gos dang zong gser du bsgyur du mi rung ste /
analyzed: mchod rten la gos phul ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten de nyid du rlung dang nyi ma dang char pas dengs kyang bla'i mchod rten la phul ba'i gos dang zong gser du bsgyur du mi rung ste /
translated: As for the cloth offered to the stūpa, it is better for it to be destroyed by wind, sun, and rain than for it to be turned into gold and then used.

original: mchod rten la ni mchod rten gyi zong cis kyang brel phongs pa med do //
analyzed: mchod rten la ni mchod rten gyi zong cis kyang brel phongs pa med do //
translated: The stūpa has no need for anything.

original: 'od srungs dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa gang la la zhig tshul khrims dang ldan pa sbyin pa'i gnas rnams la sems khros sam dbang byed cing bsgo blag byed na de mi dge ba'i las des sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srungs dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa gang la la zhig tshul khrims dang ldan pa sbyin pa'i gnas rnams la sems khros sam dbang byed cing bsgo blag byed na de mi dge ba'i las des sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, if a monk who is in charge of the affairs of the saṅgha is angry with and domineering toward those who are morally disciplined and worthy of gifts, and if he is contemptuous of them, then because of that unwholesome action he will go to a bad rebirth, to the hells.

original: gal te mi'i 'jig rten du 'ongs na yang bran dang gzhan gyi las byed par 'gyur pa dang khu tshur dang thal lcag dang lag cha ba snyems pas brdegs pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi'i 'jig rten du 'ongs na yang bran dang gzhan gyi las byed par 'gyur pa dang khu tshur dang thal lcag dang lag cha ba snyems pas brdegs pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he comes to the human world, he will be a slave, working for others, and will be beaten with fists, whips, and sticks.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: dge slong la chad pas gcod pa dang / 'jigs par byed pa dang bsdigs pa dang / dus ma yin par mngag pa dang dus ma yin par bsgo bar byed na /
analyzed: dge slong la chad pas gcod pa dang / 'jigs par byed pa dang bsdigs pa dang / dus ma yin par mngag pa dang dus ma yin par bsgo bar byed na /
translated: If a monk is punished, threatened, or ordered around at inappropriate times,

original: de mi dge ba des nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba phur pa mang po zhes bya ba der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de mi dge ba des nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba phur pa mang po zhes bya ba der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: he will be reborn in the ephemeral hell called “Many Stakes” due to that unwholesome action.

original: phur pa stong gi bar dag gis lus la zug cing /🔽'bar rab tu 'bar la /
analyzed: phur pa stong gi bar dag gis lus la zug cing / 'bar rab tu 'bar la /
translated: Up to a thousand stakes will pierce his body,

original: kun tu rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: burning, blazing, and fully ablaze.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: lce'i tshad dpag tshad brgya bar 'gyur zhing de'i lce'i dbang po de la lcags phur brgya stong kun tu 'bar ba dag gis 'bugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lce'i tshad dpag tshad brgya bar 'gyur zhing de'i lce'i dbang po de la lcags phur brgya stong kun tu 'bar ba dag gis 'bugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: His tongue will be a hundred leagues long, and a hundred thousand burning iron stakes will pierce that tongue.

original: 'od srungs dge slong zhal ta byed pa gang la las dge 'dun @37b gyi rnyed pa 'dus shing 'dus pa gzhag ste dus dus su mi sbyin zhing mtho ba tsam sa la gces nas sbyin pa dang kha cig la ma byin na de mi dge ba'i rtsa ba
analyzed: 'od srungs dge slong zhal ta byed pa gang la las dge 'dun @37b gyi rnyed pa 'dus shing 'dus pa gzhag ste dus dus su mi sbyin zhing mtho ba tsam sa la gces nas sbyin pa dang kha cig la ma byin na de mi dge ba'i rtsa ba
translated: because of the unwholesome actions of that monk,

original: des yi dags kyi skye gnas rgyag 'jim byin pa nub ces bya ba der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des yi dags kyi skye gnas rgyag 'jim byin pa nub ces bya ba der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be reborn in the hungry ghost realm called “Covered with Dirt.”

original: der yi dags gzhan gyis kha zas blangs te de la bstan na /
analyzed: der yi dags gzhan gyis kha zas blangs te de la bstan na /
translated: If other hungry ghosts take food and show it to him,

original: de bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: when it is shown to him,

original: mig gnyi ga mi 'dzums par zas de la blta zhing bkres pa dang skom pas nyen pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong gi lo brgya stong du yang zas de ni thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gnyi ga mi 'dzums par zas de la blta zhing bkres pa dang skom pas nyen pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong gi lo brgya stong du yang zas de ni thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he looks at the food with both eyes wide open, and he experiences the suffering of being tormented by hunger and thirst. Even in a hundred thousand years he will not obtain that food.

original: ji ste brgya la brgya lam na zas de thob kyang ngan skyugs dang rnag khrag tu 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ste brgya la brgya lam na zas de thob kyang ngan skyugs dang rnag khrag tu 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even if he were to obtain that food after a hundred thousand years, it would turn into vomit and pus and blood.

original: dge 'dun bsrungs kyi rtogs pa brjod pa las kyang gnod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun bsrungs kyi rtogs pa brjod pa las kyang gnod pa gsungs te /
translated: The Avadana of Sanghavarman also states the harm:

original: dge 'dun bsrungs khyod kyis sems can rtsig pa lta bu gang dag mthong ba de rnams ni sngon dge slong yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun bsrungs khyod kyis sems can rtsig pa lta bu gang dag mthong ba de rnams ni sngon dge slong yin te /
translated: Sanghavarman, those sentient beings whom you saw who were like walls were previously monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi rtsig ngos la ngar snabs kyis ma rungs par byam pas las de'i rnam par smin pas rtsig pa dang 'dra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi rtsig ngos la ngar snabs kyis ma rungs par byam pas las de'i rnam par smin pas rtsig pa dang 'dra bar gyur to //
translated: Because they defiled the walls of the monastery with their mucus, as a result of that karma they became like walls.

original: dge 'dun bsrungs khyod kyis sems can ka ba 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de rnams kyang sngon dge slong yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun bsrungs khyod kyis sems can ka ba 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de rnams kyang sngon dge slong yin te /
translated: Sanghavarman, those sentient beings whom you saw who were like pillars were also previously monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi ka ba ngar snabs kyis ma rungs par byas pas de'i phyir ka ba 'dra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi ka ba ngar snabs kyis ma rungs par byas pas de'i phyir ka ba 'dra bar gyur to //
translated: Because they defiled the pillars of the monastery with their mucus, they became like pillars.

original: dge 'dun bsrungs khyod kyis sems can shing lta bu dang lo ma lta bu dang me tog lta bu dang 'bras bu lta bu gang dag mthong ba de rnams kyang sngon dge slong yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun bsrungs khyod kyis sems can shing lta bu dang lo ma lta bu dang me tog lta bu dang 'bras bu lta bu gang dag mthong ba de rnams kyang sngon dge slong yin te /
translated: Sanghavarman, those sentient beings whom you saw who were like trees, leaves, flowers, and fruit were also previously monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi shing dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams gang zag gis yongs su spyad par spyad pas na de'i phyir shing dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi shing dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams gang zag gis yongs su spyad par spyad pas na de'i phyir shing dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu lta bur gyur to //
translated: Because they used the saṅgha’s wood, leaves, flowers, and fruits for their own use, they became like wood, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: khyod kyis sems can thag pa lta bu dang phyags ma lta bu gang dag mthong ba de rnams kyang sngon dge slong yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can thag pa lta bu dang phyags ma lta bu gang dag mthong ba de rnams kyang sngon dge slong yin te /
translated: “Those sentient beings that you saw looking like ropes and brooms were also previously monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi thag pa dang phyags ma gang zag gis yongs su spyad par spyad pas na de'i phyir thag pa lta bu dang phyags ma lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi thag pa dang phyags ma gang zag gis yongs su spyad par spyad pas na de'i phyir thag pa lta bu dang phyags ma lta bur gyur to //
translated: Because they used the saṅgha’s ropes and brooms for their own use, they became like ropes and brooms.

original: khyod kyis sems can gzhong pa lta bu gang mthong ba de sngon dge tshul ba yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can gzhong pa lta bu gang mthong ba de sngon dge tshul ba yin te /
translated: “The sentient being that you saw looking like a bowl was previously a novice monk.

original: de gzhong pa 'khru zhing 'dug pa dang / dge slong dag cig glo bur du lhags te /
analyzed: de gzhong pa 'khru zhing 'dug pa dang / dge slong dag cig glo bur du lhags te /
translated: While he was washing a bowl, some monks arrived unexpectedly.

original: de dag gis de mthong nas dris pa dge tshul pha ci deng dge 'dun la skom lta @38a * //
analyzed: de dag gis de mthong nas dris pa dge tshul pha ci deng dge 'dun la skom lta @38a * //
translated: When they saw him, they asked, “Novice monk, is there any drink for the saṅgha today?”

original: yod dam / de ser snas non pa'i sems kyis smas pa /
analyzed: yod dam / de ser snas non pa'i sems kyis smas pa /
translated: Overcome by stinginess, he said,

original: ci gzhong pa bkrus pa'ang ma mthong ngam skom 'thungs zin to //
analyzed: ci gzhong pa bkrus pa'ang ma mthong ngam skom 'thungs zin to //
translated: “Don’t you see that the bowl has been washed? The drink is finished.”

original: de dag gis dus yol zin pa lta snyam du bsams nas re ba chad de dman zhing yi bsad pa'i bzhin gyis dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis dus yol zin pa lta snyam du bsams nas re ba chad de dman zhing yi bsad pa'i bzhin gyis dong ngo //
translated: Thinking, “The time has passed,” they lost hope. With downcast faces, they left in despair.

original: de ni las de'i rnam par smin pas gzhong pa lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: de ni las de'i rnam par smin pas gzhong pa lta bur gyur to //
translated: As the result of that action, he was born in a womb that resembled a bowl.

original: khyod kyis sems can gtun lta bu gang mthong ba de yang sngon dge slong yin te /🔽de la lhung bzed kyi las shig byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can gtun lta bu gang mthong ba de yang sngon dge slong yin te / de la lhung bzed kyi las shig byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: “You may wonder, ‘What kind of sentient being was the mortar?’ He was also a monk.🔽Once, when he had to do some work with a begging bowl,🔽a novice monk who was an arhat was on duty to administer the vows.

original: dge tshul pha dgra bcom pa gcig cig la dam gzhag pa'i las res bab nas de la des smras pa /
analyzed: dge tshul pha dgra bcom pa gcig cig la dam gzhag pa'i las res bab nas de la des smras pa /
translated: He said to him,

original: dge tshul pha tshigs ma cung zhig rdungs la kho bo la byin /
analyzed: dge tshul pha tshigs ma cung zhig rdungs la kho bo la byin /
translated: ‘Novice monk, grind some sesame seeds and give them to me.’

original: nges smras pa gnas brtan bdag brel gyis cung zhig gzhes shig / slad kyis brdungs te gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / de khros nas smras pa /
analyzed: nges smras pa gnas brtan bdag brel gyis cung zhig gzhes shig / slad kyis brdungs te gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / de khros nas smras pa /
translated: I’ll pound it later and give it to you.”

original: dge tshul pha gal te kho bo gtun la reg tu rung na ni /
analyzed: dge tshul pha gal te kho bo gtun la reg tu rung na ni /
translated: The novice monk said, “Elder, if I were allowed to touch the mortar,🔽I would pound it myself, let alone a little bit of grain.”🔽The elder became angry and said, “Novice monk, if I were allowed to touch the mortar,

original: khyod nyid kho bos gtun gyi nang du bcug ste brdungs na tshigs ma nyung zad brdungs pa lta ci smos //
analyzed: khyod nyid kho bos gtun gyi nang du bcug ste brdungs na tshigs ma nyung zad brdungs pa lta ci smos //
translated: I would put you in the mortar and pound you, let alone a little bit of grain.”

original: dge tshul pha des de kun nas dkris pa drag pos dkris par rig nas /
analyzed: dge tshul pha des de kun nas dkris pa drag pos dkris par rig nas /
translated: The novice monk knew that the elder was bound by a strong fetter,

original: gal te bdag gis de la lan blan na de bas kyang khros par 'gyur ro snyam nas kha rog ste 'dug go //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis de la lan blan na de bas kyang khros par 'gyur ro snyam nas kha rog ste 'dug go //
translated: and he thought, “If I respond to him, he will become even angrier.” So he remained silent.

original: gang gi tshe de kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe de'i gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe de'i gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: When the elder was free from his fetter, the novice monk went to him and said,🔽“Elder, do you know who I am?”

original: gnas brtan khyod kyis kho bo su lags mkhyen tam /
analyzed: gnas brtan khyod kyis kho bo su lags mkhyen tam /
translated: “Elder, do you know who I am?”🔽

original: des smras pa shes te khyod ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba'i dge tshul lo //
analyzed: des smras pa shes te khyod ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba'i dge tshul lo //
translated: “I know,” he said. “You were a novice monk in the doctrine of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: kho bo ni dge slong gnas brtan no //
analyzed: kho bo ni dge slong gnas brtan no //
translated: I was an elder monk.”

original: dge tshul phas smras pa /
analyzed: dge tshul phas smras pa /
translated: The novice monk said,

original: de lta yin du zin kyang kho bos ni rab tu byung nas bya ba gang yin pa de byas so //
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang kho bos ni rab tu byung nas bya ba gang yin pa de byas so //
translated: “Even so, I have done what I had to do as a monk.

original: ci zhig byas /
analyzed: ci zhig byas /
translated: What have you done?”

original: nyon mongs pa spangs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs so //
translated: “I have abandoned the afflictions.”

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag bcad do //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag bcad do //
translated: “I have cut all bonds.”

original: bcings pa las rnam par grol lo //🔽khyod kyis ni zhe gcod pa'i ngag gi las smras kyi nyes pa la nyes par mthol cig /'on tang las de yongs su byang zhing bsrabs te /
analyzed: bcings pa las rnam par grol lo // khyod kyis ni zhe gcod pa'i ngag gi las smras kyi nyes pa la nyes par mthol cig /'on tang las de yongs su byang zhing bsrabs te /
translated: “I am liberated from bondage.”🔽“You have spoken harsh words. Confess your fault as a fault,

original: yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that karma will be purified, reduced, and diminished.”

original: des kyang nyes pa la nyes par bshags so //
analyzed: des kyang nyes pa la nyes par bshags so //
translated: He confessed his fault as a fault,

original: las das na gtun lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: las das na gtun lta bur gyur to //
translated: and because of that karma, he became a mortar.

original: khyod kyis sems can phru chen lta bu gang dag mthong ba de dag ni sngon dge slong rnams kyi @38b rim gro ba rung ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can phru chen lta bu gang dag mthong ba de dag ni sngon dge slong rnams kyi @38b rim gro ba rung ba byed pa yin te /
translated: Those you saw who were like large gourds were formerly attendants of monks.

original: de dag sman 'tshed pa'i tshe dge slong rnams kyis mi snyan pa smras pas de dag sems 'khrugs nas phru chen bcag pas de'i phyir phru chen lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: de dag sman 'tshed pa'i tshe dge slong rnams kyis mi snyan pa smras pas de dag sems 'khrugs nas phru chen bcag pas de'i phyir phru chen lta bur gyur to //
translated: When they were preparing medicine, the monks spoke unpleasantly to them. They became angry, broke the gourds, and were reborn as creatures like large gourds.

original: khyod kyis sems can rked par chad la skud pas thogs par gang mthong ba de yang sngon dge slong yin te ;
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can rked par chad la skud pas thogs par gang mthong ba de yang sngon dge slong yin te ;
translated: Those you saw who were cut in half at the waist and held together with string were formerly monks.

original: / rnyed pa 'dzin par byed pa ni //
analyzed: / rnyed pa 'dzin par byed pa ni //
translated: They were greedy for profit.

original: de ser snas non pas dus bsnor te dbyar gyi gang yin pa de ni dgun gyir byas dgun gyi gang yin pa de ni dbyar gyir byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas rked par chad la skud pas thogs shing 'gro'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ser snas non pas dus bsnor te dbyar gyi gang yin pa de ni dgun gyir byas dgun gyi gang yin pa de ni dbyar gyir byas pas las de'i rnam par smin pas rked par chad la skud pas thogs shing 'gro'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they were overcome by stinginess, they switched the winter and summer robes. Because of that action, they were reborn cut in half at the waist and held together with string.

original: chos smra ba la sogs pa bsrung ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: chos smra ba la sogs pa bsrung ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on protecting the Dharma teachers and so on, the third chapter in the Ornament of Precious Liberation.

original: // / gzhan yang mdo sde dag las gnod pa chen po dag gsungs te /🔽re zhig 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
analyzed: // / gzhan yang mdo sde dag las gnod pa chen po dag gsungs te / re zhig 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the sutras mention great harms.

original: rigs kyi bu rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga ste /
translated: The noble Akasagarbhasutra mentions five root downfalls for a king of the universal monarch caste.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad thal bar rlog ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad thal bar rlog ste /
translated: These root downfalls reduce to ashes all the roots of virtue created by a king of the universal monarch caste.

original: pham par gyur cing lha dang mi'i bde ba'i gnas thams cad las lhung nas ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham par gyur cing lha dang mi'i bde ba'i gnas thams cad las lhung nas ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is defeated and falls from all the states of happiness of gods and humans, and goes to the miserable realms.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rigs kyi bu rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas mchod rten gyi rdzas 'phrog gam dge 'dun gyi dang phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la phul ba 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas mchod rten gyi rdzas 'phrog gam dge 'dun gyi dang phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la phul ba 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po'o //
translated: Noble son, if a king of the universal monarch caste steals property from a stupa or from the community of monks or nuns, or if he steals property that has been offered to the community of the four directions, this is the first root downfall.

original: gang yang chos spong zhing 'gog tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang yang chos spong zhing 'gog tu 'jug ste /
translated: It is also to abandon the Dharma and to cause others to abandon it.

original: nyan thos nges par 'byung ba bshad pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos nges par 'byung ba bshad pa'am /
translated: It is to abandon the teachings on the liberation of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas nges par 'byung ba bshad pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas nges par 'byung ba bshad pa'am /
translated: the teachings on the liberation of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba bshad pa spong zhing 'gog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba bshad pa spong zhing 'gog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: and the teachings on the liberation of the Mahāyāna, and to cause others to abandon them. This is the second root downfall.

original: gang yang nga'i phyir rab tu byung ste skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos ngur smrig gyon pa /
analyzed: gang yang nga'i phyir rab tu byung ste skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos ngur smrig gyon pa /
translated: It is to cause those who have gone forth for my sake, who have shaved their heads and faces and donned saffron robes,

original: bslab pa gzung yang rung ma gzung yang rung /
analyzed: bslab pa gzung yang rung ma gzung yang rung /
translated: whether they uphold the precepts or not,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa yang rung tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa yang rung tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang rung ste /
translated: whether they are immoral or have good conduct,

original: de'i gos ngur smrig 'phrog gam khyim na gnas par byed du 'jug gam lus la lag chas bsnun nam btson rar 'jug gam srog dang bral bar byed du 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gos ngur smrig 'phrog gam khyim na gnas par byed du 'jug gam lus la lag chas bsnun nam btson rar 'jug gam srog dang bral bar byed du 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba gsum pa'o //
translated: to give up their saffron robes and to make them live as householders, to beat them with weapons on their bodies, to throw them in prison, or to kill them. This is the third root downfall.

original: rgyal rigs gang yang ched du bsams te /🔽ma'i @39a * //
analyzed: rgyal rigs gang yang ched du bsams te /🔽ma'i @39a * //
translated: It is for a kṣatriya king to intentionally

original: srog gcod pa dang pha dang bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dgra bcom pa'i srog gcod pa dang / dge 'dun mthun pa 'byed pa dang / ched du bsams te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa ste /🔽mtshams med pa'i las lnga po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba'i las byed pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang pha dang bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dgra bcom pa'i srog gcod pa dang / dge 'dun mthun pa 'byed pa dang / ched du bsams te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa ste / mtshams med pa'i las lnga po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba'i las byed pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: Killing one’s father, killing an arhat, killing a member of the Buddha’s community of monks, causing a Buddha to bleed, and causing a schism in the community.🔽To commit any of these five heinous acts is the fourth root downfall.

original: rgyal rigs gang yang rgyu med par smra bar gyur la /
analyzed: rgyal rigs gang yang rgyu med par smra bar gyur la /
translated: To be a member of the ruling class who denies cause and effect,

original: 'jig rten pha rol pa g-yel te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol pa g-yel te /
translated: to be heedless about the world to come,

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par bzung nas gnas shing sems can gzhan mang po dag kyang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par bzung nas gnas shing sems can gzhan mang po dag kyang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: to take up the path of the ten unwholesome actions and to encourage others to do the same,

original: 'dul zhing 'dzud la 'god pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul zhing 'dzud la 'god pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga pa'o //
translated: to train others in this and establish them in it—this is the fifth root downfall.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te gang yang grong 'joms pa dang ljongs 'joms pa dang grong khyer 'joms pa dang / yul 'khor 'joms par byed pa 'di yang rtsa ba'i ltung ba'o ;🔽/ de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te gang yang grong 'joms pa dang ljongs 'joms pa dang grong khyer 'joms pa dang / yul 'khor 'joms par byed pa 'di yang rtsa ba'i ltung ba'o ; / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Likewise, it is a root downfall to destroy a village, a country, a city, or a kingdom.🔽“Son of noble family, these are the eight root downfalls for beginners who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa las dang po pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba brgyad de rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa las dang po pa 'khrul
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa las dang po pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba brgyad de rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa las dang po pa 'khrul
translated: These root downfalls cause beginners who have entered the Great Vehicle and who are confused

original: pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad thal bar rlog ste pham par gyur cing /
analyzed: pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad thal bar rlog ste pham par gyur cing /
translated: to burn away all the roots of virtue they have previously created, and they are defeated.

original: lha dang mi'i theg pa chen po'i bde ba'i gnas las lhung nas ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i theg pa chen po'i bde ba'i gnas las lhung nas ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: They fall from the state of happiness in the Great Vehicle of gods and humans and go to the lower realms.

original: yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur /
translated: They will wander in cyclic existence for a long time.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be separated from spiritual teachers.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: sems can gang dag sngon nyes par spyad pa'i rgyus snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa nyon mongs pa can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir skyes pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag sngon nyes par spyad pa'i rgyus snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa nyon mongs pa can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir skyes pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who were born in this world of afflictions, endowed with the five degenerations due to the cause of previous bad conduct, have little root of virtue.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas theg pa chen po mchog tu zab pa 'di nyan to //🔽rigs kyi bu blo chung du de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed la de dag gi nang nas byang chub sems dpa'i las dang po gang dag stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde mchog tu zab
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas theg pa chen po mchog tu zab pa 'di nyan to // rigs kyi bu blo chung du de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed la de dag gi nang nas byang chub sems dpa'i las dang po gang dag stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde mchog tu zab
translated: Relying on a spiritual friend, they listen to this supreme vehicle of the Mahāyāna, which is extremely profound.🔽Those of little intelligence, son of noble family, arouse the mind set on unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: pa 'di nyan pa dang lung nod pa dang klog pa dang kha ton byed pa de dag ji ltar thos pa dang ji ltar chub @39b par byas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa 'di nyan pa dang lung nod pa dang klog pa dang kha ton byed pa de dag ji ltar thos pa dang ji ltar chub @39b par byas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Among them, those bodhisattvas who are beginners, who listen to this sūtra endowed with emptiness, which is extremely profound, and who receive the transmission, read, and recite it, just as they have heard it and understood it,

original: snga ma'i blo dang 'dra ba gzhan dag gi mdun du /
analyzed: snga ma'i blo dang 'dra ba gzhan dag gi mdun du /
translated: in the presence of others whose intelligence is like their own,

original: don bzang po dang tshig 'bru bzang po rgyas par dran par byed cing rab tu ston la /
analyzed: don bzang po dang tshig 'bru bzang po rgyas par dran par byed cing rab tu ston la /
translated: They are not trained in the profound and vast Dharma of the Great Vehicle, and they do not remember and teach extensively the good meaning and good words of the Great Vehicle.

original: de dag ni nan tan tu ma sbyangs pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nan tan tu ma sbyangs pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo dag ste /
translated: They are childish ordinary beings who have not trained in the profound and vast Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: mnyan nas skrag cing dngang ste dngang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mnyan nas skrag cing dngang ste dngang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Having heard it, they will be frightened, terrified, and become terrified.🔽Having become frightened, they will turn back from the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and aspire to the awakening of the śrāvakas.

original: de dag dngangs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems las phyir log ste nyan thos kyi byang chub la smon na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po ste /
analyzed: de dag dngangs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems las phyir log ste nyan thos kyi byang chub la smon na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po ste /
translated: This is the first root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba des rigs kyi bu de dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon skyes pa thams cad thal bar rlog ste pham par gyur cing mtho ris dang thar pa'i bde ba'i gnas las ltung ba dang de'i byang chub kyi sems kyang bslus shing ngan song du 'gro bar
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba des rigs kyi bu de dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon skyes pa thams cad thal bar rlog ste pham par gyur cing mtho ris dang thar pa'i bde ba'i gnas las ltung ba dang de'i byang chub kyi sems kyang bslus shing ngan song du 'gro bar
translated: By that root downfall, that son of a good family destroys all the roots of virtue he has previously produced, is defeated, falls from the state of happiness of the higher realms and liberation, and is deceived about his mind of awakening. He goes to the lower realms.

original: 'gyur ro // de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes par byas la /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes par byas la /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should know the thoughts and underlying intentions of other sentient beings and other persons.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la bags kyis chos bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la bags kyis chos bstan par bya ste /
translated: He should gradually teach the Dharma to sentient beings according to their thoughts,

original: dper na rgya mtsho chen por bags kyis 'jug pa bzhin du bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chen por bags kyis 'jug pa bzhin du bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: just as one gradually enters the great ocean.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa kha cig la 'di skad du khyod kyis pha rol tu sbyin pa drug la spyod pa spyad par mi nus /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa kha cig la 'di skad du khyod kyis pha rol tu sbyin pa drug la spyod pa spyad par mi nus /
translated: Moreover, some beginner bodhisattvas may be told, “You are not able to practice the six perfections.

original: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus kyi /
translated: You are not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: khyod nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par myur du sems skyed cig dang / des na khyod 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ngo zhes smras pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis pa ste /🔽gong du ji ltar smos pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: khyod nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par myur du sems skyed cig dang / des na khyod 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ngo zhes smras pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis pa ste / gong du ji ltar smos pa'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the second root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa kha cig la 'di skad du kye so sor thar pa dang 'dul ba'i tshul khrims la legs par bsrungs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa kha cig la 'di skad du kye so sor thar pa dang 'dul ba'i tshul khrims la legs par bsrungs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Moreover, to some beginner bodhisattvas one might say, What is the use of properly guarding the ethics of the code of conduct for individual liberation?

original: khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la theg pa chen po lhogs shig dang / des na khyod kyis nyon mongs pa'i rkyen gyis lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis mi dge ba'i las gang bsgrubs pa de dag rnam par smin par mi 'gyur bar dag par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni byang chub @40a * //
analyzed: khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la theg pa chen po lhogs shig dang / des na khyod kyis nyon mongs pa'i rkyen gyis lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis mi dge ba'i las gang bsgrubs pa de dag rnam par smin par mi 'gyur bar dag par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni byang chub @40a * //
translated: In that way, whatever non-virtuous karma you have accomplished with body, speech, and mind due to the condition of afflictions will be purified and not come to fruition.

original: sems dpa'i las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba gsum pa ste gong du ji skad smos pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba gsum pa ste gong du ji skad smos pa'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the third root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva, as described above.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas kha cig la 'di skad du rigs kyi bu dag khyed nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam ma nyan cig / ma klog cig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas kha cig la 'di skad du rigs kyi bu dag khyed nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam ma nyan cig / ma klog cig /
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, a beginner bodhisattva should not say to anyone, ‘Son of noble family, do not listen to the teachings of the Hearers’ Vehicle, do not read them,

original: gzhan dag la lung ma 'bogs shig / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam chobs shig / des ni khyod kyis 'bras bu chen po rnyed par mi 'gyur zhing gzhi des ni khyed kyis nyon mongs pa mthar 'byin par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag la lung ma 'bogs shig / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam chobs shig / des ni khyod kyis 'bras bu chen po rnyed par mi 'gyur zhing gzhi des ni khyed kyis nyon mongs pa mthar 'byin par mi nus kyi /
translated: You will not find great results through that, and on that basis you will not be able to put an end to the afflictions.🔽Have faith in the teachings of the Great Vehicle.🔽Listen to the Great Vehicle.🔽Read the Great Vehicle.🔽Teach it to others.

original: theg pa chen po'i gtam 'di nyid la dad par gyis shig / theg pa chen po nyon cig / theg pa chen po lhogs shig / gzhan dag la yang lung phog shig dang des na khyed kyis ngan 'gro dang ngan song gi lam thams cad zhi bar 'gyur
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gtam 'di nyid la dad par gyis shig / theg pa chen po nyon cig / theg pa chen po lhogs shig / gzhan dag la yang lung phog shig dang des na khyed kyis ngan 'gro dang ngan song gi lam thams cad zhi bar 'gyur
translated: In that way you will pacify all the paths to the lower realms and the miserable destinies.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes smras la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes smras la /
translated: You will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.”

original: gal te de dag gis de'i tshig bzhin du mnyan te 'di 'dra ba'i lta bar gyur pa blangs na gnyis ka la yang rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis de'i tshig bzhin du mnyan te 'di 'dra ba'i lta bar gyur pa blangs na gnyis ka la yang rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they listen to his words and adopt a view like that, then both of them will commit an offense entailing expulsion.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa dag lce gnyis byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa dag lce gnyis byed pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, beginner bodhisattvas are two-faced.

original: gzhan du ston cing brjod pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa dang 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i phyir theg pa chen po 'di tshig tu 'don pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa dang ston pa dang / thos pa tsam gzhan la yang ston la /
analyzed: gzhan du ston cing brjod pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa dang 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i phyir theg pa chen po 'di tshig tu 'don pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa dang ston pa dang / thos pa tsam gzhan la yang ston la /
translated: For the sake of gain and honor, they recite, chant, read, teach, and even explain to others what they have merely heard of this Great Vehicle, while teaching otherwise and speaking differently, with different words, phrases, and verses.

original: 'di skad du bdag ni theg pa chen po pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes smra zhing /🔽gzhan dag gis pha rol po gang dag las longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de'i rkyen gyis /
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag ni theg pa chen po pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes smra zhing / gzhan dag gis pha rol po gang dag las longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de'i rkyen gyis /
translated: They say, “I am a follower of the Great Vehicle, but others are not.”🔽And because of the conditions of the gain and honor they receive from others,

original: 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i phyir de dag gzhan la phrag dog byed de /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i phyir de dag gzhan la phrag dog byed de /
translated: they become jealous of others.

original: de dag 'khrugs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag 'khrugs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They become agitated.

original: de dag gi bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod do //🔽smod do // bshung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod do // smod do // bshung ngo //
translated: They speak ill of them.🔽They disparage them.

original: rnam par smod do //
analyzed: rnam par smod do //
translated: They revile them.🔽They slander them.

original: de dag la 'dud pa de rnams la yang phrag dog gi rgyus bdag bstod cing mi'i chos bla ma bdag nyid la sgrogs so //
analyzed: de dag la 'dud pa de rnams la yang phrag dog gi rgyus bdag bstod cing mi'i chos bla ma bdag nyid la sgrogs so //
translated: Out of envy, they praise themselves and proclaim their own excellence.

original: de'i phyir de dag dngos po des pham par 'gyur zhing theg pa chen po'i bde ba las lhung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dngos po des pham par 'gyur zhing theg pa chen po'i bde ba las lhung ste /
translated: Therefore, they are defeated by that matter and fall from the happiness of the Great Vehicle.

original: de dag la lci ba chen po'i ltung ba de 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de dag la lci ba chen po'i ltung ba de 'byung zhing /
translated: For them, that is a grave downfall.

original: @40b des na ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @40b des na ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they go to the lower realms.

original: dper na mi la la zhig rin po che'i gling du 'gro bar 'dod nas gru las rgya mtshor zhugs la /
analyzed: dper na mi la la zhig rin po che'i gling du 'gro bar 'dod nas gru las rgya mtshor zhugs la /
translated: For example, suppose someone wanted to go to an island of jewels.🔽He would board a ship and set out on the great ocean.

original: de rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du bdag nyid kyis gru bshig nas de nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du bdag nyid kyis gru bshig nas de nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: But in the middle of the great ocean, he would destroy the ship himself and die there.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa theg pa chen po'i rgya mtshor 'jug par 'dod pa gang dag phrag dog gi rgyus de dang de smra ste de'i rkyen gyis de dag dad pa'i gru zhig nas shes rab kyi srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa theg pa chen po'i rgya mtshor 'jug par 'dod pa gang dag phrag dog gi rgyus de dang de smra ste de'i rkyen gyis de dag dad pa'i gru zhig nas shes rab kyi srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those beginner bodhisattvas who wish to enter the ocean of the Great Vehicle will speak about this out of jealousy. As a result, they will destroy the ship of faith and lose the life of wisdom.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa byis pa de dag la phrag dog gi rgyu dang brdzun gyi rkyen gyis lci ba chen po'i ltung ba 'byung ste ;
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa byis pa de dag la phrag dog gi rgyu dang brdzun gyi rkyen gyis lci ba chen po'i ltung ba 'byung ste ;
translated: In this way, those beginner bodhisattvas, due to the cause of jealousy and the condition of lies, will commit a grave downfall.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag byang chub sems dpa' nan tan du sbyangs pa mkhas pa skyes bu chen po gzungs dang bzod pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sa la
analyzed: gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag byang chub sems dpa' nan tan du sbyangs pa mkhas pa skyes bu chen po gzungs dang bzod pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sa la
translated: Moreover, in the future there will be beginner bodhisattvas, both householders and monastics, who will speak ill of bodhisattvas who are skilled in practice, great beings who have attained dhāraṇī, acceptance, and the levels of meditative absorption, and who will slander them.

original: legs par sbyang ba byas pa rnams kyi spyod yul mdo sde zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dag 'dzin cing tshig tu 'don la kha ton byed cing gzhan dag la yang rgya cher klog cing rab tu
analyzed: legs par sbyang ba byas pa rnams kyi spyod yul mdo sde zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dag 'dzin cing tshig tu 'don la kha ton byed cing gzhan dag la yang rgya cher klog cing rab tu
translated: They hold the Mahayana sutras that are the domain of those who have trained well, the profound sutras endowed with emptiness. They recite them, chant them, and read them widely to others and teach them extensively.

original: ston to // chos 'di dag ni kho bo nyid kyi blos rtogs nas kho bo snying rje bas de bzhin du khyod la bstan gyi khyod kyis kyang ci nas 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rnams la mngon sum du 'gyur ba de ltar sgoms shig / de ltar byas nas
analyzed: ston to // chos 'di dag ni kho bo nyid kyi blos rtogs nas kho bo snying rje bas de bzhin du khyod la bstan gyi khyod kyis kyang ci nas 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rnams la mngon sum du 'gyur ba de ltar sgoms shig / de ltar byas nas
translated: They say, “I have understood these teachings with my own mind. Out of compassion I have taught them to you in the same way. You should meditate so that you can directly perceive the profound teachings of the Buddha.”🔽They say, “If you do that,

original: khyod da ltar kho bo bzhin du ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes smra'i 'di skad du kho bos mdo sde zab mo zab pa 'di lta bu 'di bklags pa tsam gyis bstan par zad kyi mngon sum du byas nas ni ma yin no zhes ni mi smra
analyzed: khyod da ltar kho bo bzhin du ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes smra'i 'di skad du kho bos mdo sde zab mo zab pa 'di lta bu 'di bklags pa tsam gyis bstan par zad kyi mngon sum du byas nas ni ma yin no zhes ni mi smra
translated: you will see the truth just as I have.” They do not say, “I have merely read these profound sutras. I have not directly perceived them.”

original: ste rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir bdag 'tshong zhing /
analyzed: ste rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir bdag 'tshong zhing /
translated: For the sake of gain and honor, they sell themselves.

original: de'i rkyen gyis dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi spyan sngar nyes pa dang bcas pa yin te lci ba chen po'i ltung bar 'gyur
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi spyan sngar nyes pa dang bcas pa yin te lci ba chen po'i ltung bar 'gyur
translated: Because of that, they are at fault in the presence of the tathāgatas, the saints, the perfectly enlightened ones of the three times, and of all the bodhisattvas and noble beings. They have a great downfall.

original: ro // theg pa chen pos lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bslus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // theg pa chen pos lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bslus par 'gyur ro //
translated: They deceive the world with its gods through the Great Vehicle.

original: de ni nyan thos kyi theg par yang mi @41a * //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos kyi theg par yang mi @41a * //
translated: They are not even in the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: 'gyur na theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i khyad par 'thob pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'gyur na theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i khyad par 'thob pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: let alone in the special attainment of entering the Great Vehicle.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta smos kyang ci dgos dper na mi la la zhig 'brog dgon pa chen por chas la bkres pa dang skom pas nyen nas de der kha zas kyi phyir 'bras bu chen po'i shing la 'dzegs la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta smos kyang ci dgos dper na mi la la zhig 'brog dgon pa chen por chas la bkres pa dang skom pas nyen nas de der kha zas kyi phyir 'bras bu chen po'i shing la 'dzegs la /
translated: They would climb a fruit tree for food,

original: dri phun sum tshogs pa dang ro phun sum tshogs pa ma myangs par 'bras bu chen po'i shing bor te /🔽dug gi shing la 'dzegs nas dug shing gi 'bras bu zos la zos nas kyang 'chi ba'i dus byas pa ltar gang zag de yang de dang 'dra'o zhes smra'o de dag rnyed par dka' ba'i mi rnyed la rnyed nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te theg
analyzed: dri phun sum tshogs pa dang ro phun sum tshogs pa ma myangs par 'bras bu chen po'i shing bor te / dug gi shing la 'dzegs nas dug shing gi 'bras bu zos la zos nas kyang 'chi ba'i dus byas pa ltar gang zag de yang de dang 'dra'o zhes smra'o de dag rnyed par dka' ba'i mi rnyed la rnyed nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te theg
translated: but without experiencing perfect smell and perfect taste, they would abandon the fruit tree and climb a poisonous tree.🔽After eating the fruit of the poisonous tree, they would die. I say that person is like that.

original: pa chen po la 'jug par 'dod la /
analyzed: pa chen po la 'jug par 'dod la /
translated: Those who have difficulty finding a human birth, after finding it, wish to enter the Great Vehicle in dependence on a virtuous friend.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyus bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pas lci ba chen po'i ltung ba 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyus bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pas lci ba chen po'i ltung ba 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
translated: “This great heavy downfall has arisen from praising myself and disparaging others for the sake of gain and honor.

original: ltung ba lci ba des mkhas pa thams cad kyis smad par gyur pa ngan song du 'gro ba'i mi gang zag de lta bu ni rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs thams cad kyis bsten par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba lci ba des mkhas pa thams cad kyis smad par gyur pa ngan song du 'gro ba'i mi gang zag de lta bu ni rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs thams cad kyis bsten par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: “That person who, because of this heavy downfall, is despised by all the wise and goes to the lower realms should not be attended upon by any kṣatriyas, brahmins, vaiśyas, or śūdras.

original: gang de la brten pa de ni mkhas pa thams cad kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang de la brten pa de ni mkhas pa thams cad kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Anyone who attends upon him will be abandoned by all the wise.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba drug pa'o //🔽rigs kyi bu gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba drug pa'o // rigs kyi bu gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: This is the sixth root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: rgyal rigs rnams kyi mdun na 'don gdol ba dang / blon po gdol pa dang shor ba gdol pa dang blon po mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can nor che ba longs spyod che ba dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyal rigs rnams kyi mdun na 'don gdol ba dang / blon po gdol pa dang shor ba gdol pa dang blon po mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can nor che ba longs spyod che ba dag 'byung ste /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family, in the future there will be kṣatriyas, brahmins, vaiśyas, and śūdras who are arrogant, wealthy, and powerful.

original: de dag sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa mang po dag la snang ste /
analyzed: de dag sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa mang po dag la snang ste /
translated: They are seen to engage in many meritorious acts that arise from generosity.

original: gtong bas rgyags shing dregs pa de dag nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang dregs pa dang / rgyal rigs dang dge sbyong dang rgyal rigs rnams 'byed pa'i dbyen byed cing de dag rgyal rigs la brten nas dge sbyong rnams la chad pas gcod du 'jug chad pas nor 'phrog tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: gtong bas rgyags shing dregs pa de dag nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang dregs pa dang / rgyal rigs dang dge sbyong dang rgyal rigs rnams 'byed pa'i dbyen byed cing de dag rgyal rigs la brten nas dge sbyong rnams la chad pas gcod du 'jug chad pas nor 'phrog tu 'jug ste /
translated: They are arrogant and conceited because of their giving. They are proud, conceited, and arrogant. They create schisms in the warrior-nobles and in the mendicants, and in the warrior-nobles and the warrior-nobles themselves. Relying on the warrior-nobles, they cause the mendicants to be punished, and they cause them to be deprived of their wealth.

original: gnod pa des dge sbyong de dag gang zag gi'am dge 'dun gyi'am phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi'am mchod rten gyi dag dge sbyong rnams rkur bcug nas de dag la gsug tu 'bul lo //
analyzed: gnod pa des dge sbyong de dag gang zag gi'am dge 'dun gyi'am phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi'am mchod rten gyi dag dge sbyong rnams rkur bcug nas de dag la gsug tu 'bul lo //
translated: Through that harm, they cause the mendicants to steal from the individual, from the Saṅgha, from the Saṅgha of the four directions, and from the stūpa, and they offer it to them as a hiding place.

original: gdol pa de dag gis kyang rgyal rigs de dag la 'bul @41b bar 'gyur te de dag gnyi ga la rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdol pa de dag gis kyang rgyal rigs de dag la 'bul @41b bar 'gyur te de dag gnyi ga la rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those outcasts also offer it to those warrior-nobles. Both of them incur a root downfall.

original: 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh root downfall.

original: rgyal rigs gdol pa de dag kyang dge sbyong rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal rigs gdol pa de dag kyang dge sbyong rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those kṣatriyas who are like outcastes will be hostile to the mendicants.

original: chos 'di lta bu ni chos ma yin par 'dogs shing chos spangs nas chos ma yin pa la 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di lta bu ni chos ma yin par 'dogs shing chos spangs nas chos ma yin pa la 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will call this kind of Dharma “non-Dharma” and will abandon the Dharma and establish non-Dharma.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang bslab pa la mi lta zhing /
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang bslab pa la mi lta zhing /
translated: They will not look to the sūtras, the vinaya, or the training.

original: nag po bstan pa dang chen po bstan pa spangs te /
analyzed: nag po bstan pa dang chen po bstan pa spangs te /
translated: They will abandon the teaching of the dark side and the teaching of the great.

original: snying rje chen po'i tshul dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bslab pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i bslab pa dang mdo sde gzhan dag las bslab pa bstan pa de dag kyang spangs nas chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge slong rnams la gtso ba'i phyir bka' khrims gang gis dge slong rnams la gnod par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i tshul dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bslab pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i bslab pa dang mdo sde gzhan dag las bslab pa bstan pa de dag kyang spangs nas chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge slong rnams la gtso ba'i phyir bka' khrims gang gis dge slong rnams la gnod par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will abandon the way of great compassion, the training in the perfection of wisdom, the training in skill in means, and the teachings on the training in other sūtras. They will establish laws that harm the monks who possess this kind of Dharma.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang mthun pa'i rnal 'byor yid la byed pa 'dor bar byed pa dang / 'phya ba dang gnod pa mang du 'gyur ba'i khrims 'cha' bar byed do //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang mthun pa'i rnal 'byor yid la byed pa 'dor bar byed pa dang / 'phya ba dang gnod pa mang du 'gyur ba'i khrims 'cha' bar byed do //
translated: They will make rules that are full of criticism and harm.

original: rgyu des na dge slong rnams nye bar ma zhi ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bslabs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu des na dge slong rnams nye bar ma zhi ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bslabs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, the monks will not pacify the afflictions that are not yet pacified, and they will not train in what they have not yet trained in.

original: de'i tshe dge slong de dag bsam pa nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong de dag bsam pa nyams par 'gyur /
translated: At that time, those monks will have fallen in their intentions.

original: tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur /
translated: They will have fallen in their morality.

original: tshig nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig nyams par 'gyur /
translated: They will have fallen in their words.

original: lta ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have fallen in their views.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: sgyid lu ga par 'gyur ba dang / bya ba mang bar 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che zhing lung bong ltar spyod pas so //
analyzed: sgyid lu ga par 'gyur ba dang / bya ba mang bar 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che zhing lung bong ltar spyod pas so //
translated: They will be lazy, they will have many activities, they will be non-ascetics who claim to be ascetics, they will be non-celibate people who claim to be celibate, and they will behave like donkeys.

original: rig par bya ba'i chos ston pa de dag lhag par rgyal rigs 'khor dang bcas pas bkur sti byas par 'gyur rim gro dang mchod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig par bya ba'i chos ston pa de dag lhag par rgyal rigs 'khor dang bcas pas bkur sti byas par 'gyur rim gro dang mchod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who teach the Dharma will be especially honored, revered, and worshipped by the kṣatriyas and their retinues.

original: de dag kyang khyim pa rnams la dge slong spong ba la brtson pa rnams kyi bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang khyim pa rnams la dge slong spong ba la brtson pa rnams kyi bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But they will speak ill of the monks who are dedicated to meditation.

original: rgyal rigs 'khor dang bcas pa de yang dge slong spong ba la brtson pa rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur 'phya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal rigs 'khor dang bcas pa de yang dge slong spong ba la brtson pa rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur 'phya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The kṣatriyas and their retinues will become hostile to the monks who are dedicated to meditation and will ridicule them.

original: des na dge slong spong ba la brtson pa rnams kyi longs spyod dang nye bar spyod pa gang yin pa de dge slong kha ton byed pa la dga' ba rnams la byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na dge slong spong ba la brtson pa rnams kyi longs spyod dang nye bar spyod pa gang yin pa de dge slong kha ton byed pa la dga' ba rnams la byin par 'gyur te /
translated: The resources and enjoyments of the monks who are dedicated to meditation will be given to the monks who delight in chanting.

original: de dag gnyi ga la yang rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga la yang rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Both of them will have committed a root downfall.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong bsam gtan pa ni @42a * //
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan pa ni @42a * //
translated: Monks who are meditators

original: zhing dam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhing dam pa yin gyi /
translated: are a holy field.

original: klog pa dang zhal ta byed pa la gnas pa dang klog pa la brtson pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang bzod pa'i sa rnams kyi snod du gyur pa'am shin tu sbyin gnas su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: klog pa dang zhal ta byed pa la gnas pa dang klog pa la brtson pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang bzod pa'i sa rnams kyi snod du gyur pa'am shin tu sbyin gnas su gyur pa'am /
translated: Those who are established in reading and recitation and who strive in reading are vessels for the stages of meditative stabilization, retention and patient acceptance, or they are excellent fields of merit or they are fields of merit.

original: snod du gyur ba dang / 'jig rten la snang bar byed pa'am lam nye bar ston par byed pa'am las kyi zhing dang nyon mongs pa'i zhing las sems can rnams sgrol ba dang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam la 'jog pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snod du gyur ba dang / 'jig rten la snang bar byed pa'am lam nye bar ston par byed pa'am las kyi zhing dang nyon mongs pa'i zhing las sems can rnams sgrol ba dang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam la 'jog pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They do not illuminate the world, or show the path, or liberate sentient beings from the fields of karma and the fields of afflictions, or establish them on the path to nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu brgyad po 'di dag ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu brgyad po 'di dag ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Son of noble family, these are the eight root downfalls.

original: 'di dag gis nges par 'byung ba yang mdo 'di las gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gis nges par 'byung ba yang mdo 'di las gsungs pa ni /
translated: This sutra also teaches their definite deliverance:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po'i ming thos nas ngan song du ltung bas 'jigs pa'i phyir mthong bar 'dod cing rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'chags par 'dod la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po'i ming thos nas ngan song du ltung bas 'jigs pa'i phyir mthong bar 'dod cing rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'chags par 'dod la /
translated: If those bodhisattvas, fearing to fall into the lower realms, wish to see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha in order to confess their root downfalls,

original: gal te de dag byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i snying po la phyag 'tshal zhing de'i ming yang brjod na /
analyzed: gal te de dag byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i snying po la phyag 'tshal zhing de'i ming yang brjod na /
translated: and if they pay homage to the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha and recite his name,

original: rigs kyi bu de dag gi mdun du skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du de rang gi gzugs kyis gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag gi mdun du skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du de rang gi gzugs kyis gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: then, son of noble family, he will appear in their presence in whatever form is appropriate,

original: bram ze'i gzugs nas bu mo'i gzugs kyi bar gyis mdun du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze'i gzugs nas bu mo'i gzugs kyi bar gyis mdun du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: whether in the form of a brahmin or in the form of a girl.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa de la ltung ba ji lta bu byung ba de dag 'chags su 'jug go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa de la ltung ba ji lta bu byung ba de dag 'chags su 'jug go //
translated: He will make those beginner bodhisattvas confess whatever downfalls they have incurred.

original: de thabs la mkhas pa zab mo dang / theg pa chen po la spyad pa'ang nye bar ston to //
analyzed: de thabs la mkhas pa zab mo dang / theg pa chen po la spyad pa'ang nye bar ston to //
translated: He will also teach them the profound skillful means and the practice of the Great Vehicle.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i bar la yang rab tu 'jog go //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i bar la yang rab tu 'jog go //
translated: and up to the stage of non-returning.🔽

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He is also established in the stages up to the irreversible stage.🔽Thus, if he does not manifest to those who supplicate him, then that beginner bodhisattva, who has a fault, should rise at dawn, face east, sit,

original: gal te de la gsol ba 'debs pa gang yin pa de dag la mngon du ston par mi byed na byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa nyes pa dang bcas pa des tho rangs langs la shar phyogs su bltas te 'dug la bdug pas bdug par bya
analyzed: gal te de la gsol ba 'debs pa gang yin pa de dag la mngon du ston par mi byed na byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa nyes pa dang bcas pa des tho rangs langs la shar phyogs su bltas te 'dug la bdug pas bdug par bya
translated: and make offerings of incense to the god of the dawn.

original: / lha'i bu skya rengs la gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: / lha'i bu skya rengs la gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: He should supplicate the god of the dawn with these words:

original: tshig 'di skad du skya rengs skya rengs snying rje chen po skal ba chen po khyod 'dzam bu'i gling du shar ma thag tu snying rjes bdag la khebs par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: tshig 'di skad du skya rengs skya rengs snying rje chen po skal ba chen po khyod 'dzam bu'i gling du shar ma thag tu snying rjes bdag la khebs par mdzad du gsol //
translated: “Dawn, dawn, great compassion, great fortune, as soon as you rise in Jambudvīpa, may you cover me with compassion.

original: nam mkha'i snying po snying rje chen po dang ldan pa la yang bdag gi tshig gis myur du bskul te thabs gang gis bdag ltung ba 'chags par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa @42b chen po 'phags pa la thabs dang shes rab 'thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs de dag bdag gi rmi lam du bstan du gsol zhes smras pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po snying rje chen po dang ldan pa la yang bdag gi tshig gis myur du bskul te thabs gang gis bdag ltung ba 'chags par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa @42b chen po 'phags pa la thabs dang shes rab 'thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs de dag bdag gi rmi lam du bstan du gsol zhes smras pa /
translated: And to Akashagarbha, who is endowed with great compassion, I will quickly send my words, and he will show me in a dream the means by which I will confess my downfall and obtain the means and wisdom of the Mahayana.

original: de'i tshe de mal du gnyid log par bya ste 'dzam bu gling 'dir skya rengs shar ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po dang phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de mal du gnyid log par bya ste 'dzam bu gling 'dir skya rengs shar ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po dang phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, he should go to bed and fall asleep. As soon as dawn breaks in this Rose Apple Continent, he will meet the bodhisattva mahasattva Akashagarbha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa de'i rmi lam du de'i gzugs mdun du 'dug ste rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag 'chags su 'jug go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa de'i rmi lam du de'i gzugs mdun du 'dug ste rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag 'chags su 'jug go //
translated: In the dream of that beginner bodhisattva, he will appear in front of him and make him confess those root downfalls.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i thabs kyi thabs shes pa 'di lta bu yang bstan te /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i thabs kyi thabs shes pa 'di lta bu yang bstan te /
translated: And he will also teach him this kind of knowledge of the means of the Mahayana:

original: thabs shes pa la mkhas pa des byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa des de nyid du byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
analyzed: thabs shes pa la mkhas pa des byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa des de nyid du byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
translated: By that skill in means, that beginner bodhisattva obtains that very meditative absorption called “not forgetting the Awakening Mind.”

original: theg pa chen po la brtan por gnas par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la brtan por gnas par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: And he becomes firmly established in the Great Way.”

original: yang na mdo sde de nyid las gsol ba gdab pa'i sngags sngar smos pa gang yin pa des cho ga 'di byas te de las 'di skad du byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na mdo sde de nyid las gsol ba gdab pa'i sngags sngar smos pa gang yin pa des cho ga 'di byas te de las 'di skad du byung ngo //
translated: Or else, the ritual is done with the mantra of supplication mentioned earlier in that very sūtra, and it says this:

original: dgon pa'am nags 'dab bam bla gab med par aa ka ru'am rgya spos sam dus kyi rjes su 'brang bas bdugs la thal mo sbyar te phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun du yan lag lngas phyag byas la /
analyzed: dgon pa'am nags 'dab bam bla gab med par aa ka ru'am rgya spos sam dus kyi rjes su 'brang bas bdugs la thal mo sbyar te phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun du yan lag lngas phyag byas la /
translated: In a forest, a grove, or in the open air, having burned agaru, frankincense, or whatever is available at the time, with palms joined, having bowed down in all directions and in between the directions with the five limbs,

original: sngags kyi tshig 'di dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig 'di dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite these mantra words.

analyzed: 'di lta ste / su smri sha su smri sha / k'a ru ni ka tsa ra tsa ra /

translated: If the bodhisattvas of the kṣatriya class and so on are definite in their downfalls, how are the others indefinite? If they are not in the vow,

analyzed: de dag gis ltung bar ji ltar rnam par gzhag cing /

analyzed: sdom pa can dag nyes pa des zin par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do those who have vows come to possess that fault?

analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de gang du @43a * //
translated: There is no fault here, because

analyzed: gang dag la mang du 'byung ba de dag la der rang gi ming nas smos te bstan nas 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir bzlog go //

analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang phan tshun du ltung ba thams cad sprang bar bya'o //

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba che bas na gang gi yang dag par ma blangs ba na yang skal ba med pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad par 'gyur ba des sdom pa can la shin tu ches 'gyur te de ltar dpyad pas chog go //

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang rtsa ba'i ltung ba gsungs te /

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na nyan thos kyi theg pa can la rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung na phung po de nyid kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal pa med do //

translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: for those in the vehicle of the śrāvakas, if a root downfall occurs, they lack the fortune to attain complete nirvāṇa in that very lifetime.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du ltung ba ma bshags shing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byed pa de ma spangs na sangs rgyas kyis la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
