translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, if a downfall is not confessed and that attention directed toward the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is not abandoned, one lacks the fortune to attain complete nirvāṇa in the Buddha vehicle.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'di dag bde blag tu gzung ba dang 'ga' zhig gi lugs gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dag brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la tshangs par spyod par khas 'tshe ba /
translated: They are not celibate but pretend to be celibate.

original: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis bshig pa ltung ba pham pa yin yang tshul khrims 'chal pa sdig pa spyod pa'i dge slong de de'i tshe na yang lha thams cad dang mi rnams kyi bar dang bsod nams kyi gter dag gi bar ston pa dang dge ba'i bshes
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis bshig pa ltung ba pham pa yin yang tshul khrims 'chal pa sdig pa spyod pa'i dge slong de de'i tshe na yang lha thams cad dang mi rnams kyi bar dang bsod nams kyi gter dag gi bar ston pa dang dge ba'i bshes
translated: Even though he has been destroyed by various afflictions and has fallen from his vows, at that time the monk who has broken his vows and engages in negative actions is the teacher of all gods and humans and the revealer of the treasure of merit and the virtuous friend of those who are confused by the darkness of ignorance.

original: gnyen yin no //
analyzed: gnyen yin no //
translated: Even though he is a monk who has violated his vows, who has fallen away from the precepts, who has committed a defeating offense, who has transgressed the rules, who has committed evil deeds, he is still a teacher of the Dharma for all gods and humans, a treasure of merit, a spiritual friend.

original: de snod du gyur pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de snod du gyur pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though he is not a fit vessel,

original: skra dang kha spu bregs te gos ngur smrig bgos pa dang spyod lam bstan pa'i rgyu des kyang sems can mang po dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs ston par byed pa dang bde 'gro'i lam ston pa yin no //
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs te gos ngur smrig bgos pa dang spyod lam bstan pa'i rgyu des kyang sems can mang po dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs ston par byed pa dang bde 'gro'i lam ston pa yin no //
translated: by the cause of his having shaved his head and face and put on saffron robes and maintained the proper conduct, he is a teacher of the roots of various kinds of virtue for many beings and a teacher of the path to good rebirths.

original: de lta bas na nga'i phyir rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am tshul khrims 'chal pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na nga'i phyir rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am tshul khrims 'chal pa yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether he is a monk who is morally disciplined or one who is morally undisciplined, he is a teacher of the Dharma for all gods and humans, a treasure of merit, a spiritual friend.

original: gang nga'i phyir rab tu byung ba la 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yang chos dang mthun pas kyang lus la chad @44a * //
analyzed: gang nga'i phyir rab tu byung ba la 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yang chos dang mthun pas kyang lus la chad @44a * //
translated: Even a universal monarch, in accordance with the Dharma, cannot punish those who have gone forth for my sake.🔽🔽

original: pas gcod pa dang btson rar 'jug pa dang yan lag dang nying lag gcod pa dang srog gcod du mi gnang na chos ma yin pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: pas gcod pa dang btson rar 'jug pa dang yan lag dang nying lag gcod pa dang srog gcod du mi gnang na chos ma yin pa lta ci smos /
translated: For those who have gone forth for my sake, even a king who rules according to the Dharma should not inflict capital punishment, imprisonment, cutting off of limbs and appendages, or killing, not to speak of a king who rules unjustly.

original: chos 'dul ba la shi ba lta bur brjod du zin na gang zag de gi wang dang gla rtsi dang mtshungs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba la shi ba lta bur brjod du zin na gang zag de gi wang dang gla rtsi dang mtshungs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: If someone is said to be like a corpse in the discipline of the Dharma, that person is like bezoar or musk.

original: yang de nyid las ;
analyzed: yang de nyid las ;
translated: And the same text says,

original: nga'i phyir rab tu byung ba snod du gyur tam snod du ma gyur kyang rung ba rnams la gang dag 'tshe ba de dag thams cad ni dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la shin tu nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'i phyir rab tu byung ba snod du gyur tam snod du ma gyur kyang rung ba rnams la gang dag 'tshe ba de dag thams cad ni dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la shin tu nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: “Those who harm anyone who has gone forth for my sake, whether they are a worthy recipient or not, they have a great offense against all the Buddhas of the three times.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang rgyud tshig pa dang mnar med par gzhol ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang rgyud tshig pa dang mnar med par gzhol ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las /
translated: It is said that they have severed their roots of virtue, their mindstreams are burned, and they are headed for Avīci Hell.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: And the same text says,🔽“Thus, this saffron robe blessed by all the buddhas is the banner of liberation.”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos ngur smrig 'di ni thar pa'i rgyal mtshan yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las de'i tshe nyan thos khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dag sngon byas pa'i las kyi sgrib pa 'di lta bu bcom ldan 'das la 'chags te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos ngur smrig 'di ni thar pa'i rgyal mtshan yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las de'i tshe nyan thos khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dag sngon byas pa'i las kyi sgrib pa 'di lta bu bcom ldan 'das la 'chags te /
translated: And the same text says, at that time many trillions of śrāvakas and many trillions of bodhisattvas confessed to the Blessed One their karmic obscurations from previous actions:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung rab la snod du gyur pa dang snod du ma gyur pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa can gyi gang zag la smad do //
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung rab la snod du gyur pa dang snod du ma gyur pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa can gyi gang zag la smad do //
translated: “Honored Blessed One, in the scriptures of previous tathāgatas we disparaged those who were vessels and those who were not vessels, and we disparaged the persons who are disciples of the blessed buddhas.

original: bshungs so khros so //
analyzed: bshungs so khros so //
translated: We have been angry and we have been cruel.

original: bsngags pa ma lags pa dang mi snyan pa'i bda' mchid brjod do //
analyzed: bsngags pa ma lags pa dang mi snyan pa'i bda' mchid brjod do //
translated: We have spoken unpleasantly and unfavorably about them.

original: las kyi sgrib pa des na bdag cag ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag po mi bzad pa rnam pa mang po myong ngo //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa des na bdag cag ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag po mi bzad pa rnam pa mang po myong ngo //
translated: Because of these karmic obscurations, we have experienced many unbearable sufferings in the three lower realms.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same is true of the other four aggregates.🔽

original: bdag cag las kyi sgrib pa'i lhag ma de da ltar bcom ldan 'das la 'chags so //
analyzed: bdag cag las kyi sgrib pa'i lhag ma de da ltar bcom ldan 'das la 'chags so //
translated: “We confess to the Blessed One the remainder of those karmic obscurations.

original: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams la tshig gis bsdigs so //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams la tshig gis bsdigs so //
translated: Some of us have threatened the Blessed One’s hearers with words.

original: spyos brgyad do zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: spyos brgyad do zhes 'dzer to //
translated: We have scolded them.

original: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos snod du gyur pa dang / snod du ma gyur pa rnams la brdegs /🔽bsnun to zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos snod du gyur pa dang / snod du ma gyur pa rnams la brdegs / bsnun to zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Some of us have beaten and struck the Blessed One’s hearers, whether they were worthy or unworthy recipients.

original: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi gos phrogs so zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi gos phrogs so zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Some of us have stolen the Blessed One’s hearers’ robes.

original: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis @44b nyan thos rnams kyi longs spyod pa dang yongs su spyod pa rnams phrogs so zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis @44b nyan thos rnams kyi longs spyod pa dang yongs su spyod pa rnams phrogs so zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Some said, “We have taken away the enjoyments and possessions of the Blessed One’s śrāvakas.”

original: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rab tu byung ba rnams khyim par phab ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rab tu byung ba rnams khyim par phab ste /
translated: Some said, “We have made those who went forth for the sake of the Blessed One return to lay life.

original: gnas ma lags pa thob par bgyis so zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: gnas ma lags pa thob par bgyis so zhes 'dzer to //
translated: We have caused them to obtain what is not proper.”

original: kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos snod du gyur pa dang snod du ma gyur pa dang snod du ma gyur pa nongs pa ma mchis pa rnams khri mon du stsal te bdag cag las kyi sgrib pa🔽des bskal pa mang por ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal drag po mi bzad pa rnam pa mang po myong ngo zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos snod du gyur pa dang snod du ma gyur pa dang snod du ma gyur pa nongs pa ma mchis pa rnams khri mon du stsal te bdag cag las kyi sgrib pa des bskal pa mang por ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal drag po mi bzad pa rnam pa mang po myong ngo zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Some said, “Blessed One, we have imprisoned the śrāvakas of the blessed buddhas, whether they are worthy recipients or unworthy recipients, whether they are at fault or not at fault.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Because of that karmic obscuration, for many eons we have experienced the many unbearable sufferings of the three lower realms.”

original: bdag cag da ltar las kyi sgrib pa'i lhag ma de bcom ldan 'das la 'chags so //
analyzed: bdag cag da ltar las kyi sgrib pa'i lhag ma de bcom ldan 'das la 'chags so //
translated: We confess to the Blessed One the remainder of our karmic obscurations from the present time.

original: slan chad kyang sdom par bgyid do //
analyzed: slan chad kyang sdom par bgyid do //
translated: We will restrain ourselves from now on.

original: bdag cag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzung du gsol //
analyzed: bdag cag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzung du gsol //
translated: Out of love for us, Blessed One, please accept us.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag ngan song mi bzang pa las gdon du gsol zhes rgya cher gsungs so /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag ngan song mi bzang pa las gdon du gsol zhes rgya cher gsungs so / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Blessed One, please deliver us from the bad destinies, the terrible lower realms.”

original: rab tu byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i mdo las kyang gnod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i mdo las kyang gnod pa gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra on Obstructing Going Forth also describes the harms:

original: ming chen khyim pa chos bzhi dang ldan na skye ba de dang der mi dal ba rnyed par 'gyur ;
analyzed: ming chen khyim pa chos bzhi dang ldan na skye ba de dang der mi dal ba rnyed par 'gyur ;
translated: Mahānāma, householders who have four qualities will not obtain leisure in that and other lives.

original: dmus long dang blun pa dang lce med pa dang gdol par 'gyur /
analyzed: dmus long dang blun pa dang lce med pa dang gdol par 'gyur /
translated: They will be blind from birth, stupid, mute, and outcasts.

original: nam du yang bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nam du yang bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will never be happy.

original: skur ba 'debs pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be full of slander.

original: za ma dang ma ning dang / rtag par bran dang bud med du 'gyur /
analyzed: za ma dang ma ning dang / rtag par bran dang bud med du 'gyur /
translated: They will be hermaphrodites, eunuchs, and always slaves and women.

original: khyi dang phag dang bong bu dang rnga mo dang / sbrul gdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyi dang phag dang bong bu dang rnga mo dang / sbrul gdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be reborn as a dog, pig, donkey, camel, or poisonous snake.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: ming chen 'di la khyim pa sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par byas pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par 'byung ba'i sems dang rab tu 'byung ba'i sems dang 'phags pa'i lam gyi sems kyi bar chad byed pa 'di ni dang po'o //🔽gzhan yang nor la chags shing bu la chags nas las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid mi ches te /
analyzed: ming chen 'di la khyim pa sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par byas pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par 'byung ba'i sems dang rab tu 'byung ba'i sems dang 'phags pa'i lam gyi sems kyi bar chad byed pa 'di ni dang po'o // gzhan yang nor la chags shing bu la chags nas las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid mi ches te /
translated: Mahanama, the first is when a householder who has served the victorious ones of the past creates obstacles for the minds of sentient beings who are intent on renunciation, on going forth, and on the path of the noble ones.

original: bu'am bu mo'am chung ma'am nye du'i tshogs dbang phyug gi gnas la 'khod pa rab tu 'byung ba'i bar chad byed pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs so //🔽gzhan gnyis ni dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / dge sbyong dang @45a * //
analyzed: bu'am bu mo'am chung ma'am nye du'i tshogs dbang phyug gi gnas la 'khod pa rab tu 'byung ba'i bar chad byed pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs so // gzhan gnyis ni dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / dge sbyong dang @45a * //
translated: The second is when, attached to wealth and attached to children, one does not believe in the ripening of karma and creates obstacles for one’s son, daughter, wife, or retinue of relatives who are intent on going forth, saying, “This will not lead to happiness.”

original: bram ze rnams la khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: bram ze rnams la khong khro ba'o //
translated: The other two are abandoning the true Dharma and being hostile to virtuous ascetics and brahmins.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi gnod pa ni dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi gnod pa ni dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las /
translated: The harm of the ten nonvirtuous actions is taught in the Sutra Teaching the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma.

original: rnam par smin pa drag po gsungs pa lta bur blta ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa drag po gsungs pa lta bur blta ste /
translated: The harm from the ten unwholesome courses of action is described in the Sutra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma as follows:🔽“The results of these actions are very grave.”

original: de las cung zad tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las cung zad tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will mention just a few of them.

original: srog gcod pa'i rnam par smin pa nyung zad cig smos pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rnam par smin pa nyung zad cig smos pa 'di lta ste /
translated: As for the results of killing, the text says:

original: me lce la rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i bya ni gang dag me'i rtse mo la gnas kyang mi 'tshig pa ste /
analyzed: me lce la rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i bya ni gang dag me'i rtse mo la gnas kyang mi 'tshig pa ste /
translated: “There is a bird called ‘fire-tongued.’ It lives in the tips of flames and is not burned.

original: shin tu dga' zhing sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi mgo brtol nas khrag 'thung ngo //🔽thod pa'i phrag na rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i bya ni gang dag glad pa ba rtol nas rab tu 'bar zhing glad rgyas 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu dga' zhing sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi mgo brtol nas khrag 'thung ngo // thod pa'i phrag na rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i bya ni gang dag glad pa ba rtol nas rab tu 'bar zhing glad rgyas 'thung ba'o //
translated: It pecks through the heads of the hell-beings and drinks their blood.🔽There is a bird called ‘living in the skull.’ It pecks through the skull and drinks the boiling brain.

original: lce'i sha za zhes bya ba'i bya ni gang dag lce dral nas mngon du za ba ste /
analyzed: lce'i sha za zhes bya ba'i bya ni gang dag lce dral nas mngon du za ba ste /
translated: There is a bird called ‘flesh-eater.’ It tears out the tongue and eats it.

original: lce de zos shing zos nas yang skye ste /
analyzed: lce de zos shing zos nas yang skye ste /
translated: When it has eaten the tongue, it grows back again.

original: pad ma'i 'dab ma bas kyang 'jam mo //
analyzed: pad ma'i 'dab ma bas kyang 'jam mo //
translated: They are soft like lotus petals.

original: de ltar don dang mthun pa'i ming can no //
analyzed: de ltar don dang mthun pa'i ming can no //
translated: Thus, they have names that correspond to their meaning.

original: so 'byin zhes bya ba dang / mgul ba'i ming pa 'dren zhes bya ba dang / glo ba la gnas pa dang / pho ba za ba dang / mchin pa bzlog pa dang / rgyu ma'i nang spri za ba dang / sgal tshigs la dga' ba zhes bya ba dang gshis kyi gsang ba pa zhes bya ba'i bya rnams ni gang dag gshis thams cad phye ste gshis kyi bu ga brtol nas bu gar zhugs te du bzhin pa rnams kyi rkang gi snying khu 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: so 'byin zhes bya ba dang / mgul ba'i ming pa 'dren zhes bya ba dang / glo ba la gnas pa dang / pho ba za ba dang / mchin pa bzlog pa dang / rgyu ma'i nang spri za ba dang / sgal tshigs la dga' ba zhes bya ba dang gshis kyi gsang ba pa zhes bya ba'i bya rnams ni gang dag gshis thams cad phye ste gshis kyi bu ga brtol nas bu gar zhugs te du bzhin pa rnams kyi rkang gi snying khu 'thung ba'o //
translated: The birds called “teeth extractors,” “throat constrictors,” “lung dwellers,” “stomach eaters,” “liver reversers,” “intestine string eaters,” “spine lovers,” and “anus secreters” all open up the anus and enter through the anus. They drink the marrow essence of those who are crying.

original: khab kyi bu ga zhes bya ba'i bya ba'i bya ni gang dag khab lta bu'i mchus khrag 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: khab kyi bu ga zhes bya ba'i bya ba'i bya ni gang dag khab lta bu'i mchus khrag 'thung ba'o //
translated: The birds called “needle holes” drink blood with beaks like needles.

original: de bzhin du rus pa'i phrag na gnas pa dang / pags pa dag za ba dang / sder mos 'brang pa dang / tshil za ba dang / rgyus pa 'don pa dang / skra shad 'dzings pa zhes bya ba'i bya rnams ni gang dag skra rtsa nas 'don pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rus pa'i phrag na gnas pa dang / pags pa dag za ba dang / sder mos 'brang pa dang / tshil za ba dang / rgyus pa 'don pa dang / skra shad 'dzings pa zhes bya ba'i bya rnams ni gang dag skra rtsa nas 'don pa'o //
translated: In the same way, there are birds called “bone-dweller,” “skin-eater,” “claw-follower,” “fat-eater,” “sinew-puller,” and “hair-tangler,” which pull out the hair by the roots.

original: de ltar de mnar med pa'i phyogs gcig na bya 'dab 'jigs zhes bya ba dpag tshad sum 'bum par 'gyur te bya de dag dang sems can dmyal ba'i bya gzhan dag dang lhan cig tu de la lo brgya stong du mar za yang yang skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar de mnar med pa'i phyogs gcig na bya 'dab 'jigs zhes bya ba dpag tshad sum 'bum par 'gyur te bya de dag dang sems can dmyal ba'i bya gzhan dag dang lhan cig tu de la lo brgya stong du mar za yang yang skye'o //
translated: Thus, in one part of Avīci, there are birds called “wing-terror,” three hundred thousand leagues long, which together with other hell-birds eat the beings there for many hundreds of thousands of years, and then are born again.

original: de brgya la zhig na de las thar kyang de sdug bsngal mang por bskor te /
analyzed: de brgya la zhig na de las thar kyang de sdug bsngal mang por bskor te /
translated: If by some rare chance they escape from there, they are surrounded by many sufferings.

original: sa phyogs gnyis pa g-yang sa'i ngam grog cis bya ba der 'gro zhing mgon tshol skyabs tshol dpung gnyen tshol lo //
analyzed: sa phyogs gnyis pa g-yang sa'i ngam grog cis bya ba der 'gro zhing mgon tshol skyabs tshol dpung gnyen tshol lo //
translated: They go to a second place called “Abyss of the Cliff,” seeking protection, seeking refuge, seeking rescue.

original: khor yug tu me'i phung po bcu gcig gis bskor te /
analyzed: khor yug tu me'i phung po bcu gcig gis bskor te /
translated: There, they are surrounded by eleven masses of fire.

original: las kyi zhags pas bcings shing grogs med la /
analyzed: las kyi zhags pas bcings shing grogs med la /
translated: Bound by the noose of karma, alone,

original: @45b dgra rnams kyis khor yug tu bskor te dgon par phyin te /
analyzed: @45b dgra rnams kyis khor yug tu bskor te dgon par phyin te /
translated: surrounded on all sides by enemies, he arrives at the wilderness.

original: de sngar gyi sems can dmyal ba'i tshogs thams cad pas ches lhag pa'i sdug bsngal rnyed cing ngam grog rab lhung zhes bya ba'i g-yang sa'i phyogs su rgyug ste /
analyzed: de sngar gyi sems can dmyal ba'i tshogs thams cad pas ches lhag pa'i sdug bsngal rnyed cing ngam grog rab lhung zhes bya ba'i g-yang sa'i phyogs su rgyug ste /
translated: He experiences suffering that is greater than all the sufferings of the hells he has previously experienced. He runs toward the cliff called “Falling into the Abyss.”

original: ltung nas rkang pa shin tu zhu'o //
analyzed: ltung nas rkang pa shin tu zhu'o //
translated: When he falls, his feet are completely burned.

original: bteg na ni yang shin tu gzhon zhing shin tu 'jam par skye la tshor ba drag po mi bzad pa rnams kyis nyen to //
analyzed: bteg na ni yang shin tu gzhon zhing shin tu 'jam par skye la tshor ba drag po mi bzad pa rnams kyis nyen to //
translated: When he is lifted up, they grow back, very tender and soft, and he is tormented by unbearable, intense pain.

original: de ltar 'jigs pas dkrugs pa'i bzhin du gyur nas rkang lag dang yan lag dang nying lag thams cad rab tu zhu ba de la sa phyogs der ngam grog ces bya ba'i g-yang sa 'byung ste /

translated: The ripening of covetousness is stated:

original: de la las kyis byas ba'i rdzas gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba gsob gsog snying po med pa mthong nas las kyis bskul ba rmongs pa de 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la las kyis byas ba'i rdzas gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba gsob gsog snying po med pa mthong nas las kyis bskul ba rmongs pa de 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: Seeing that the substance that is grasped by the power of karma is hollow, empty, and without essence, the deluded one, urged on by karma, thinks, “This is mine.”

original: de nas sems can dmyal ba pa de rdzas ga la bder brgyug go //
analyzed: de nas sems can dmyal ba pa de rdzas ga la bder brgyug go //
translated: Then the hell being runs to the place where the substance is.

original: sems can dmyal ba des nor gang mthong ba de ni brnab sems zhes bya ba yid kyis mi dge ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pa de'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba des nor gang mthong ba de ni brnab sems zhes bya ba yid kyis mi dge ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pa de'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The substance that the hell being sees is the result of his having relied on, become habituated with, and increased covetousness, a nonvirtuous mental action.

original: de ltar mthong ba na brnab sems mang ba de'i lag nas mtshon cha 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba na brnab sems mang ba de'i lag nas mtshon cha 'byung ste /
translated: When he sees the substance, a weapon appears in the hand of the one who has much covetousness.

original: des der brgyugs pa dang sems can dmyal ba pa gzhan de dag gi lag nas kyang mtshon cha rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: des der brgyugs pa dang sems can dmyal ba pa gzhan de dag gi lag nas kyang mtshon cha rnams 'byung ste /
translated: He runs to the substance, and weapons appear in the hands of the other hell beings.

original: de dag dang de mtshon chas 'thab pa @47b la ci nas lus la sha yungs 'bru tsam yang mi lus pa de ltar bzhar te keng rus nyi tshe lus par byed do //
analyzed: de dag dang de mtshon chas 'thab pa @47b la ci nas lus la sha yungs 'bru tsam yang mi lus pa de ltar bzhar te keng rus nyi tshe lus par byed do //
translated: And when they fight with weapons, they are cut up so that not even a mustard seed’s worth of flesh remains on their bodies, and only their skeletons remain.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te //
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan dag 'byor pa mthong nas ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'byor pa mthong nas ni //
translated: When they see others who are prosperous,

original: bdag gir gyur cig snyam bsams pa //
analyzed: bdag gir gyur cig snyam bsams pa //
translated: they think, “May it be mine!”

original: brnab sems yang dag bskyed gyur pa //
analyzed: brnab sems yang dag bskyed gyur pa //
translated: They give rise to covetousness,

original: las de'i 'bras bu 'ongs pa yin /🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las de'i 'bras bu 'ongs pa yin / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the result of that action comes to them.

original: gnod sems kyi 'bras bu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi 'bras bu gsungs pa ni /
translated: The result of malice is stated:

original: las kyis bskyed pa'i seng ge dang gzhig dang sbrul khro bas zil gyis non pa rnams de'i mdun na 'dug pa de dag gis de 'jigs skrag nas gang bab bab tu bros kyang mi dge ba'i las kyis de 'bros ji ltar nus /
analyzed: las kyis bskyed pa'i seng ge dang gzhig dang sbrul khro bas zil gyis non pa rnams de'i mdun na 'dug pa de dag gis de 'jigs skrag nas gang bab bab tu bros kyang mi dge ba'i las kyis de 'bros ji ltar nus /
translated: Lions, tigers, and snakes, generated by karma, overcome by rage, stand before them. Terrified, they flee in all directions. But how can they escape, since their nonvirtuous karma is so powerful?

original: de dag gis de bzung ste bzung nas kyang thog mar glad pa la za ba nas sbrul mche ba gdug pa rnams kyis rtsi ba logs kyi bar du bzung zhing za la stag rnams ni rgyab nas za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de bzung ste bzung nas kyang thog mar glad pa la za ba nas sbrul mche ba gdug pa rnams kyis rtsi ba logs kyi bar du bzung zhing za la stag rnams ni rgyab nas za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They seize him and, having seized him, first eat his brain, and so on, until the snakes with poisonous fangs seize and eat him from the back of his neck, and the tigers eat him from behind.

original: rkang pa ni mes bsregs so //
analyzed: rkang pa ni mes bsregs so //
translated: His feet are burned by fire.

original: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyang rgyang ring po nas mda' 'phen to zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyang rgyang ring po nas mda' 'phen to zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: The henchmen of the Lord of Death shoot arrows from a distance.🔽The result of wrong views is said to be immeasurable.

original: log par lta ba'i 'bras bu ni dpag tu med pa gsungs te mdor bsdus nas brjod pa ni mtshon cha'i char dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / rdo rje'i char dang / gnam lcags dang / rdo'i char rnams kyis btab cing me'i phung po bcu rnams dang kha nas bkres pa dang skom pa'i mi 'byung bas kyang rgyun tu sreg go zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: log par lta ba'i 'bras bu ni dpag tu med pa gsungs te mdor bsdus nas brjod pa ni mtshon cha'i char dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / rdo rje'i char dang / gnam lcags dang / rdo'i char rnams kyis btab cing me'i phung po bcu rnams dang kha nas bkres pa dang skom pa'i mi 'byung bas kyang rgyun tu sreg go zhes bya'o ;
translated: In brief, it is said that he is struck by a rain of weapons, by single-pointed weapons, by vajra-weapons, by meteors, and by stone weapons, and that he is constantly burned by ten masses of fire and by the hungry ghosts that emerge from his mouth.

original: /'dod pa ni gnod pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: /'dod pa ni gnod pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ste /
translated: Desire is the root of all harm.

original: de dag gis shin tu yid 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis shin tu yid 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: One should be disgusted with it.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid las /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid las /
translated: As this text says:

original: me thab ces bya ba'i sems can dmyal ba yod de /
analyzed: me thab ces bya ba'i sems can dmyal ba yod de /
translated: There is a hell being called the hearth.

original: der las gang gis sems can rnams skye zhe na /
analyzed: der las gang gis sems can rnams skye zhe na /
translated: What karma causes sentient beings to be born there?

original: gang dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du khas 'che zhing bud med kyi glu dang gar dang rgyan rnams kyi sgra thos pa dang dgod pa dang 'jo ba dang rtse ba rnams thos nas /
analyzed: gang dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du khas 'che zhing bud med kyi glu dang gar dang rgyan rnams kyi sgra thos pa dang dgod pa dang 'jo ba dang rtse ba rnams thos nas /
translated: Those who are not ascetics but claim to be ascetics, who hear the sounds of women’s singing, dancing, and ornaments, and who hear their laughter, play, and fun,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas 'phangs pa'i blos khu ba 'chor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas 'phangs pa'i blos khu ba 'chor par 'gyur ro //
translated: lose their semen through a mind that is projected by improper mental activity.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: der sems can dmyal ba pa de dag lcags kyi char pas yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad phye mar rlog la me ma mur gyi char gyis kyang sreg cing 'tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: der sems can dmyal ba pa de dag lcags kyi char pas yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad phye mar rlog la me ma mur gyi char gyis kyang sreg cing 'tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: The beings in that hell are crushed to dust by a rain of iron and burned by a rain of live coals.
